contents.chapter_title: Chapter 1 Sainya Darsana Observing The Armies On The Battlefield

verses.sanskrit: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः । मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca – dharma-kṣetre kuru-kṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāś caiva kim akurvata sañjaya
verses.translation: Addressing Sañjaya, Emperor Dhṛtarāṣṭra said: After assembling with great enthusiasm for battle at the holy place of Kurukṣetra (dharma-kṣetra), what did my sons and the sons of Pāṇḍu do?

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच दृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा । आचार्यमुपसंगम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत् ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca – dṛṣṭvā tu pāṇḍavānīkaṁ vyūḍhaṁ duryodhanas tadā ācāryam upasaṅgamya rājā vacanam abravīt
verses.translation: Sañjaya replied: O Emperor, at that time your son Duryodhana, after observing the military arrangements of the Pāṇḍavas, approached his mentor Droṇa and spoke as follows.

verses.sanskrit: पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम् । व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: paśyaitāṁ pāṇḍu-putrāṇām ācārya mahatīṁ camūm vyūḍhāṁ drupada-putreṇa tava śiṣyeṇa dhīmatā
verses.translation: Behold, O great teacher, the military formation of the army of the sons of Pāṇḍu arranged by your gifted student, Dhṛṣṭadyumna, the son of Drupada.

verses.sanskrit: अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि । युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: atra śūrā maheṣvāsā bhīmārjuna-samā yudhi yuyudhāno virāṭaś ca drupadaśca mahārathaḥ
verses.translation: Within those ranks are great archers who are equal to Bhīma and Arjuna in war such as Sātyaki, Virāṭa and the powerful charioteer Drupada.

verses.sanskrit: धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान् । पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुंगवः ॥५॥
verses.translation: Great heroes such as Dhṛṣṭaketu, Cekitāna, the heroic king of Kāśī, Purujit, Kuntibhoja and Śaibya are also present.

verses.sanskrit: युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान् । सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: yudhāmanyuś ca vikrānta uttamaujāś ca vīryavān saubhadro draupadeyāś ca sarva eva mahārathāḥ
verses.translation: The chivalrous Yudhāmanyu, the courageous Uttamaujā, Abhimanyu the son of Subhadrā, and the sons of Draupadī are indeed all mighty chariot warriors.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम । नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: asmākaṁ tu viśiṣṭā ye tān nibodha dvijottama nāyakā mama sainyasya saṁjñārthaṁ tān bravīmi te
verses.translation: However, O best ofbrāhmaṇas, you should also know who amongst my army is qualified to lead our military force. Just for your information I shall name them.

verses.sanskrit: भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिञ्जयः । अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: bhavān bhīṣmaś ca karṇaś ca kṛpaś ca samitiñjayaḥ aśvatthāmā vikarṇaś ca saumadattis tathaiva ca
verses.translation: Your good self as well as Bhīṣma, Karṇa and Kṛpa are always victorious in battle, as well as Aśvatthāmā, Vikarṇa, Bhūriśravā and Jayadratha.

verses.sanskrit: अन्ये च बहवः शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः । नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: anye ca bahavaḥ śūrā mad-arthe tyakta-jīvitāḥ nānā-śastra-praharaṇāḥ sarve yuddha-viśāradāḥ
verses.translation: They are all armed with various weapons, and they are expert in the art of war. All of them are prepared to give up their very lives for my sake, as are many other warriors.

verses.sanskrit: अपर्याप्तं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम् । पर्याप्तं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम् ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: aparyāptaṁ tad asmākaṁ balaṁ bhīṣmābhirakṣitam paryāptaṁ tv idam eteṣāṁ balaṁ bhīmābhirakṣitam
verses.translation: Our army, protected by the might of Bhīṣma is unlimited. However, the strength of the opposition, protected by Bhīma is insufficient.

verses.sanskrit: अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिताः । भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: ayaneṣu ca sarveṣu yathā-bhāgam avasthitāḥ bhīṣmam evābhirakṣantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi
verses.translation: You must support and protect Bhīṣma at all costs, at the strategic points of our battle formation.

verses.sanskrit: तस्य सञ्जनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्धः पितामहः । सिंहनादं विनद्योच्चैः शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: tasya sañjanayan harṣaṁ kuru-vṛddhaḥ pitāmahaḥ siṁha-nādaṁ vinadyoccaiḥ śaṅkhaṁ dadhmau pratāpavān
verses.translation: Then Bhīṣma, the fearless grandsire of the Kuru Dynasty, roaring like a lion, blew his conch loudly to increase the euphoria of Duryodhana.

verses.sanskrit: ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखाः । सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: tataḥ śaṅkhāś ca bheryaś ca paṇavānaka-gomukhāḥ sahasaivābhyahanyanta sa śabdas tumulo’bhavat
verses.translation: At that point, conches, trumpets, bugles, drums and horns suddenly sounded all at once and the combined sound rose up like thunder.

verses.sanskrit: ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ । माधवः पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतुः ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: tataḥ śvetair hayair yukte mahati syandane sthitau mādhavaḥ pāṇḍavaś caiva divyau śaṅkhau pradadhmatuḥ
verses.translation: On the other side of the battlefield, both Śrī Kṛṣṇa, the husband of the goddess of wealth, and Arjuna, sitting on a wonderful chariot yoked with horses of fair hue, blew their divine conches.

verses.sanskrit: पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनञ्जयः । पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: pāñcajanyaṁ hṛṣīkeśo devadattaṁ dhanañjayaḥ pauṇḍraṁ dadhmau mahāśaṅkhaṁ bhīma-karmā vṛkodaraḥ
verses.translation: Śrī Kṛṣṇa, the Master of the senses, blew his conch-shell called Pāñcajanya. Arjuna, the winner of great wealth, blew his conch-shell called Devadatta. Bhīma, the performer of great feats, blew his conch-shell Pauṇḍra.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः । नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ ॥१६॥ काश्यश्च परमेष्वासः शिखण्डी च महारथः । धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजितः ॥१७॥ द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वशः पृथिवीपते । सौभद्रश्च महाबाहुः शङ्खान्दध्मुः पृथक्पृथक् ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: ananta-vijayaṁ rājā kuntī-putro yudhiṣṭhirah nakulaḥ sahadevaś ca sughoṣa-maṇipuṣpakau kāśyaś ca parameṣvāsaḥ śikhaṇḍī ca mahārathaḥ dhṛṣṭadyumno virāṭaś ca sātyakiś cāparājitaḥ drupado draupadeyāś ca sarvaśaḥ pṛthivī-pate saubhadraś ca mahā-bāhuḥ śaṅkhān dadhmuḥ pṛthak pṛthak
verses.translation: Yudhiṣṭhira, the son of Kuntī, blew his conch-shell Ananta-vijaya. Nakula and Sahadeva blew their conches called Sughoṣa and Maṇipuṣpaka. O emperor, the great archer the king of Kāśī, the expert chariot warrior Śikhaṇḍi, Dhṛṣṭadyumna, Virāṭa, the invincible Sātyaki, Drupada, the sons of Draupadī and Abhimanyu the mighty son of Subhadrā all blew their conches.

verses.sanskrit: स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत् । नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलोऽभ्यनुनादयन् ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: sa ghoṣo dhārtarāṣṭrāṇāṁ hṛdayāni vyadārayat nabhaś ca pṛthivīṁ caiva tumulo’bhyanunādayan
verses.translation: The hearts of the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra were shattered as the tumultuous sound reverberated throughout the sky and on the land.

verses.sanskrit: अथ व्यवस्थितान्दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान् कपिध्वजः । प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसम्पाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डवः । हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: atha vyavasthitān dṛṣṭvā dhārtarāṣṭrān kapi-dhvajaḥ pravṛtte śastra-sampāte dhanur udyamya pāṇḍavaḥ hṛṣīkeśaṁ tadā vākyam idam āha mahī-pate
verses.translation: Speaking to Dhṛtarāṣṭra, Sañjaya said: O emperor, just as the war was about to commence, Arjuna, whose chariot was decorated with the banner of Hanumān, observing your sons poised for battle, took up his bow and spoke to Hṛṣīkeśa (Śrī Kṛṣṇa, the Master of the senses), as follows.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत ॥२१॥ यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्धुकामानवस्थितान् । कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन् रणसमुद्यमे ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – senayor ubhayor madhye rathaṁ sthāpaya me’cyuta yāvad etān nirīkṣe’haṁ yoddhu-kāmān avasthitān kairmayā saha yoddhavyam asmin raṇa-samudyame
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Acyuta (Infallible One), place my chariot between both armies so that I may look upon the soldiers that I must do battle with.

verses.sanskrit: योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागताः । धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षवः ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: yotsyamānān avekṣe’haṁ ya ete’tra samāgatāḥ dhārtarāṣṭrasya durbuddher yuddhe priya-cikīrṣavaḥ
verses.translation: Let me see all those warriors that are dear to Duryodhana, the wicked son of Dhṛtarāṣṭra, assembled here for this battle.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत । सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम् ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca – evam ukto hṛṣīkeśo guḍākeśena bhārata senayor ubhayor madhye sthāpayitvā rathottamam
verses.translation: Sañjaya continued: O descendant of Bharata, being thus requested, Śrī Kṛṣṇa drew Arjuna’s grand chariot between both armies.

verses.sanskrit: भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखतः सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम् । उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरूनिति ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: bhīṣma droṇa pramukhataḥ sarveṣāṁ ca mahīkṣitām uvāca pārtha paśyaitān samavetān kurūniti
verses.translation: In front of Bhīṣma, Droṇa and all the leaders of the world, Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: O Pārtha (Arjuna, son of Pṛthā), behold the Kaurava Dynasty assembled here!

verses.sanskrit: तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान्पार्थः पितॄनथ पितामहान् । आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातॄन्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा । श्वशुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: tatrāpaśyat sthitān pārthaḥ pitṛn atha pitāmahān ācāryān mātulān bhrātṛn putrān pautrān sakhīṁs tathā śvaśurān suhṛdaś caiva senayor ubhayorapi
verses.translation: There, between the two armies, Arjuna was able to observe fatherly elders, grandfathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers, sons, grandsons, fathers-in-law and friends.

verses.sanskrit: तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेयः सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान् । कृपया परयाविष्टो विषीदन्निदमब्रवीत् ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: tān samīkṣya sa kaunteyaḥ sarvān bandhūn avasthitān kṛpayā parayāviṣṭo viṣīdann idam abravit
verses.translation: Seeing all his relatives before him on the battlefield, Arjuna, the son of Kuntī, became overcome with pity and was grief-stricken.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच दृष्ट्वेमं स्वजनं कृष्ण युयुत्सुं समुपस्थितम् । सीदन्ति मम गात्राणि मुखं च परिशुष्यति ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – dṛṣṭvemaṁ svajanaṁ kṛṣṇa yuyutsuṁ samupasthitam sīdanti mama gātrāṇi mukhaṁ ca pariśuṣyati
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Kṛṣṇa, seeing all my relatives assembled here and preparing for battle, the strength drains from my limbs and my mouth becomes parched.

verses.sanskrit: वेपथुश्च शरीरे मे रोमहर्षश्च जायते । गाण्डीवं स्रंसते हस्तात्त्वक्चैव परिदह्यते ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration: vepathuś ca śarīre me romaharṣaś ca jāyate gāṇḍīvaṁ sraṁsate hastāt tvak caiva paridahyate
verses.translation: My body trembles, my hair stands on end, my skin burns and my Gāṇḍīva bow slips from my grasp.

verses.sanskrit: न च शक्नोम्यवस्थातुं भ्रमतीव च मे मनः । निमित्तानि च पश्यामि विपरीतानि केशव ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration: na ca śaknomy-avasthātuṁ bhramatīva ca me manaḥ nimittāni ca paśyāmi viparītāni keśava
verses.translation: O Kṛṣṇa, O Keśava (Killer of the Keśī demon), I cannot keep my composure, my mind is bewildered and I see evil omens.

verses.sanskrit: न च श्रेयोऽनुपश्यामि हत्वा स्वजनमाहवे । न काङ्क्षे विजयं कृष्ण न च राज्यं सुखानि च ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration: na ca śreyo’nupaśyāmi hatvā svajanam āhave na kāṅkṣe vijayaṁ kṛṣṇa na ca rājyaṁ sukhāni ca
verses.translation: O Kṛṣṇa, I see no benefit in slaying my kinsmen in this battle. Neither do I desire victory, nor happiness by attaining a great kingdom.

verses.sanskrit: किं नो राज्येन गोविन्द किं भोगैर्जीवितेन वा । येषामर्थे काङ्क्षितं नो राज्यं भोगाः सुखानि च ॥३२॥ त इमेऽवस्थिता युद्धे प्राणांस्त्यक्त्वा धनानि च । आचार्याः पितरः पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहाः ॥३३॥ मातुलाः श्वशुराः पौत्राः श्यालाः सम्बन्धिनस्तथा । एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्नतोऽपि मधुसूदन ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration: kiṁ no rājyena govinda kiṁ bhogair jīvitena vā yeṣām arthe kāṅkṣitaṁ no rājyaṁ bhogāḥ sukhāni ca ta ime’vasthitā yuddhe prāṇāṁs tyaktvā dhanāni ca ācāryāḥ pitaraḥ putrās tathaiva ca pitāmahāḥ mātulāḥ śvaśurāḥ pautrāḥ śyālāḥ sambandhinas tathā etān na hantum icchāmi ghnato’pi madhusūdana
verses.translation: O Govinda (Kṛṣṇa), of what avail to us are kingdoms, happiness, or even life itself when all those for whom we may desire them are now arrayed on this battlefield? Of what use is a kingdom and it’s pleasures if those for whom we desire all this – our teachers, elders, sons, grandfathers, maternal uncles, fathers-in-law, grandsons, brothers-in-law and other relatives that are present here on this battlefield – are ready to jeopardise their kingdoms and their lives in this battle? O Madhusūdana (Killer of the Madhu demon), even if they wish to slay me, I have no desire to slay them.

verses.sanskrit: अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते । निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्नः का प्रीतिः स्याज्जनार्दन ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration: api trailokya-rājyasya hetoḥ kiṁ nu mahī-kṛte nihatya dhārtarāṣṭrān naḥ kā prītiḥ syāj-janārdana
verses.translation: O Janārdana (Maintainer of all living beings), what to speak of ruling this world, even if we gained sovereignty over the three worlds, what happiness would be attained by killing the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra?

verses.sanskrit: पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान्हत्वैतानाततायिनः । तस्मान्नार्हा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान्स्वबान्धवान् । स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिनः स्याम माधव ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration: pāpam evāśrayed asmān hatvaitān ātatāyinaḥ tasmān nārhā vayaṁ hantuṁ dhārtarāṣṭrān sabāndhavān svajanaṁ hi kathaṁ hatvā sukhinaḥ syāma mādhava
verses.translation: O Mādhava (husband of the goddess of fortune), great misfortune will surely come upon us if we kill our relatives, though they may be hostile towards us. It is not proper to slay the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra as well as our friends. What happiness will be derived from killing our own kin?

verses.sanskrit: यद्यप्येते न पश्यन्ति लोभोपहतचेतसः । कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं मित्रद्रोहे च पातकम् ॥३७॥ कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभिः पापादस्मान्निवर्तितुम् । कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भिर्जनार्दन ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration: yadyapyete na paśyanti lobhopahatachetasaḥ kula-kṣayakṛtaṁ doṣaṁ mitra-drohe ca pātakam kathaṁ na jñeyam asmābhiḥ pāpād asmān nivartitum kula-kṣayakṛtaṁ doṣaṁ prapaśyadbhir janārdana
verses.translation: O Janārdana, although the hearts of these men are overwhelmed by greed and they cannot see the fault in betraying one’s friends and the offence of murdering one’s kinsmen, why should we engage in such a terrible activity, knowing well the consequences?

verses.sanskrit: कुलक्षये प्रणश्यन्ति कुलधर्माः सनातनाः । धर्मे नष्टे कुलं कृत्स्नमधर्मोऽभिभवत्युत ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration: kula-kṣaye praṇaśyanti kula-dharmāḥ sanātanāḥ dharme naṣṭe kulaṁ kṛtsnam adharmo’bhibhavatyuta
verses.translation: By destroying one’s relatives, the family traditions are vanquished forever, and when such practices perish, unrighteousness prevails over the entire dynasty.

verses.sanskrit: अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यन्ति कुलस्त्रियः । स्त्रीषु दुष्टासु वार्ष्णेय जायते वर्णसङ्करः ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration: adharmābhibhavāt kṛṣṇa praduṣyanti kula-striyaḥ strīṣu duṣṭāsu vārṣṇeya jāyate varṇa-saṅkaraḥ
verses.translation: O Kṛṣṇa, descendant of Vṛṣṇi, when unrighteousness prevails then the women of the family become degraded. When the women become degraded, then undesirable offspring is the result.

verses.sanskrit: सङ्करो नरकायैव कुलघ्नानां कुलस्य च । पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रियाः ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration: saṅkaro narakāyaiva kula-ghnānāṁ kulasya ca patanti pitaro hyeṣāṁ lupta-piṇḍodaka-kriyāḥ
verses.translation: Undesirable offspring creates a dreadful condition for both the family and the destroyer of family values. Their forefathers fall down due to the discontinuation of ceremonial libations of food and water.

verses.sanskrit: दोषैरेतैः कुलघ्नानां वर्णसङ्करकारकैः । उत्साद्यन्ते जातिधर्माः कुलधर्माश्च शाश्वताः ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration: doṣair etaiḥ kula-ghnānāṁ varṇa-saṅkara-kārakaiḥ utsādyante jāti-dharmāḥ kula-dharmāś ca śāśvatāḥ
verses.translation: Such terrible deeds by the destroyers of the family create a population of unwanted progeny that totally annihilates all traditions of family and society.

verses.sanskrit: उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन । नरके नियतं वासो भवतीत्यनुशुश्रुम ॥४३॥
verses.transliteration: utsanna-kula-dharmāṇāṁ manuṣyāṇāṁ janārdana narake niyataṁ vāso bhavatīty-anuśuśruma
verses.translation: O Janārdana, I have heard that those who destroy familial, social and spiritual values eternally reside in wretched conditions.

verses.sanskrit: अहो बत महत्पापं कर्तुं व्यवसिता वयम् । यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यताः ॥४४॥
verses.transliteration: aho bata mahat-pāpaṁ kartuṁ vyavasitā vayam yad rājya-sukha-lobhena hantuṁ svajanam udyatāḥ
verses.translation: Alas, what wickedness we are determined to commit – simply due to our greed to enjoy royal pleasures we are prepared to kill our own relatives!

verses.sanskrit: यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणयः । धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत् ॥४५॥
verses.transliteration: yadi mām apratīkāram aśastraṁ śastra-pāṇayaḥ dhārtarāṣṭrā raṇe hanyus tan me kṣemataraṁ bhavet
verses.translation: If the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra, with weapons in their hands, slay me unarmed and unresisting on this battlefield, that would be considered better by me.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्त्वार्जुनः सङ्ख्ये रथोपस्थ उपाविशत् । विसृज्य सशरं चापं शोकसंविग्नमानसः ॥४६॥
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca – evam uktvārjunaḥ saṅkhye rathopastha upāviśat visṛjya saśaraṁ cāpaṁ śoka-saṁvigna-mānasaḥ
verses.translation: Sañjaya said: Having thus spoken these words, Arjuna cast aside his bow and arrows and sat on the chariot, his heart heavy with sorrow.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 2 Sankhya Yoga The Yoga Of Analysis

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच तं तथा कृपयाविष्टमश्रुपूर्णाकुलेक्षणम् । विषीदन्तमिदं वाक्यमुवाच मधुसूदनः ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca – taṁ tathā kṛpayāviṣṭam aśru-pūrṇākulekṣaṇam viṣīdantam idaṁ vākyam uvāca madhusūdanaḥ
verses.translation: Sañjaya said: Śrī Kṛṣṇa then spoke the following words to Arjuna whose heart was overwhelmed with pity and whose eyes were filled with tears.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । कुतस्त्वा कश्मलमिदं विषमे समुपस्थितम् । अनार्यजुष्टमस्वर्ग्यमकीर्तिकरमर्जुन ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – kutas tvā kaśmalam idaṁ viṣame samupasthitam anārya-juṣṭam asvargyam akīrti-karam arjuna
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: Arjuna, how has such illusion overcome you at this crucial moment? This is not appropriate for an honourable man, nor does it lead to higher planets. It is the cause of infamy.

verses.sanskrit: क्लैब्यं मा स्म गमः पार्थ नैतत्त्वय्युपपद्यते । क्षुद्रं हृदयदौर्बल्यं त्यक्त्वोत्तिष्ठ परन्तप ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: klaibyaṁ mā sma gamaḥ pārtha naitat tvayy-upapadyate kṣudraṁ hṛdaya-daurbalyaṁ tyaktvottiṣṭha parantapa
verses.translation: O Pārtha, give up this unmanliness. It does not befit you. O chastiser of enemies, get up and do not yield to this petty weakness of heart.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच कथं भीष्ममहं सङ्ख्ये द्रोणं च मधुसूदन । इषुभिः प्रतियोत्स्यामि पूजार्हावरिसूदन ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – kathaṁ bhīṣmam ahaṁ saṅkhye droṇaṁ ca madhusūdana iṣubhiḥ pratiyotsyāmi pūjārhāv-arisūdana
verses.translation: Arjuna replied: How can I counterattack such persons as Bhīṣma and Droṇa in battle, firing arrows at those who are worthy of my respect, O Madhusūdana?

verses.sanskrit: गुरूनहत्वा हि महानुभावान् श्रेयो भोक्तुं भैक्ष्यमपीह लोके । हत्वार्थकामांस्तु गुरूनिहैव भुञ्जीय भोगान् रुधिरप्रदिग्धान् ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: gurūn ahatvā hi mahānubhāvān śreyo bhoktuṁ bhaikṣyam apīha loke hatvārtha kāmāṁstu gurūn ihaiva bhuñjīya bhogān rudhira-pradigdhān
verses.translation: It is better to live in this world by begging than killing our respectable superiors. Otherwise, the wealth and property that we enjoy here in this world will be tainted with their blood.

verses.sanskrit: न चैतद्विद्मः कतरन्नो गरीयो यद्वा जयेम यदि वा नो जयेयुः । यानेव हत्वा न जिजीविषामस्- तेऽवस्थिताः प्रमुखे धार्तराष्ट्राः ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: na caitad vidmaḥ kataranno garīyo yadvā jayema yadi vā no jayeyuḥ yān eva hatvā na jijīviṣāmas te’vasthitāḥ pramukhe dhārtarāṣṭrāḥ
verses.translation: I do not know what is better for us – to conquer them or be conquered by them. If we slay the sons of Dhṛtarāṣṭra who are assembled here before us, I have no desire to live.

verses.sanskrit: कार्पण्यदोषोपहतस्वभावः पृच्छामि त्वां धर्मसम्मूढचेताः । यच्छ्रेयः स्यान्निश्चितं ब्रूहि तन्मे शिष्यस्तेऽहं शाधि मां त्वां प्रपन्नम् ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: kārpaṇya-doṣopahata-svabhāvaḥ pṛchhāmi tvāṁ dharma-sammūḍhachetāḥ yachhreyaḥ syān niścitaṁ brūhi tan me śiṣyaste’haṁ śādhi māṁ tvāṁ prapannam
verses.translation: My natural propensity as a warrior is weakening and I am bewildered as to what is righteous. Kindly tell me what is most beneficial for me. I am your disciple, surrendered unto You. Please instruct me.

verses.sanskrit: न हि प्रपश्यामि ममापनुद्याद् यच्छोकमुच्छोषणमिन्द्रियाणाम् । अवाप्य भूमावसपत्नमृद्धं राज्यं सुराणामपि चाधिपत्यम् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: na hi prapaśyāmi mamāpanudyād yac chokam ucchoṣaṇam indriyāṇām avāpya bhūmāv-asapatnam ṛddhaṁ rājyaṁ surāṇām api cādhipatyam
verses.translation: Even if I gain a substantial kingdom beyond compare and the power of the demigods, I see nothing that can remove this grief that is eroding my senses.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशं गुडाकेशः परन्तप । न योत्स्य इति गोविन्दमुक्त्वा तूष्णीं बभूव ह ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca – evam uktvā hṛṣīkeśaṁ guḍākeśaḥ parantapa na yotsya iti govindam uktvā tūṣṇīṁ babhūvaha
verses.translation: Sañjaya said: Having thus addressed Śrī Kṛṣṇa, the vigilant conqueror of enemies Arjuna declared, “O Kṛṣṇa, O Govinda, I will not fight!” and became silent.

verses.sanskrit: तमुवाच हृषीकेशः प्रहसन्निव भारत । सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये विषीदन्तमिदं वचः ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: tam uvāca hṛṣīkeśaḥ prahasann iva bhārata senayor ubhayor madhye viṣīdantam idaṁ vacaḥ
verses.translation: Descendant of Bharata, there, between the two armies, Śrī Kṛṣṇa (Hṛṣīkeśa) smiled and spoke the following words to the grief-stricken Arjuna.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । अशोच्यानन्वशोचस्त्वं प्रज्ञावादांश्च भाषसे । गतासूनगतासूंश्च नानुशोचन्ति पण्डिताः ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – aśocyān anvaśocas tvaṁ prajñāvādāṁś ca bhāṣase gatāsūn agatāsūṁś ca nānuśocanti paṇḍitāḥ
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: While speaking like a wise man, you are actually grieving for that which is unworthy of grief. The wise lament for neither the living nor the dead.

verses.sanskrit: न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः । न चैव न भविष्यामः सर्वे वयमतः परम् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: na tv-evāhaṁ jātu nāsaṁ na tvaṁ neme janādhipāḥ na caiva na bhaviṣyāmaḥ sarve vayam ataḥ param
verses.translation: There was never a time that you, nor I, nor all these warriors assembled here did not exist. Nor shall we ever cease to exist in the future.

verses.sanskrit: देहिनोऽस्मिन्यथा देहे कौमारं यौवनं जरा । तथा देहान्तरप्राप्तिर्धीरस्तत्र न मुह्यति ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: dehino’smin yathā dehe kaumāraṁ yauvanaṁ jarā tathā dehāntara prāptir dhīras tatra na muhyati
verses.translation: As theātmāpasses through the bodily transformations of childhood, youth and old age, it similarly transmigrates from one body to another at the time of death. The wise are never deluded by this transition.

verses.sanskrit: मात्रास्पर्शास्तु कौन्तेय शीतोष्णसुखदुःखदाः । आगमापायिनोऽनित्यास्तांस्तितिक्षस्व भारत ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: mātrā-sparśās tu kaunteya śītoṣṇa-sukha-duḥkha-dāḥ āgamāpāyino’nityās tāṁs titikṣasva bhārata
verses.translation: O son of Kuntī, the interaction between the senses and the sense-objects produce the sensations of cold, heat, pleasure and pain. These feelings are temporary, always appearing and then disappearing. Thus, O descendant of Bharata, you must learn to tolerate them.

verses.sanskrit: यं हि न व्यथयन्त्येते पुरुषं पुरुषर्षभ । समदुःखसुखं धीरं सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: yaṁ hi na vyathayanty-ete puruṣaṁ puruṣarṣabha sama-duḥkha-sukhaṁ dhīraṁ so’mṛtatvāya kalpate
verses.translation: O most virtuous one, a sober man who is equipoised in both pleasure and pain and remains undisturbed is certainly qualified for liberation.

verses.sanskrit: नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः । उभयोरपि दृष्टोऽन्तस्त्वनयोस्तत्त्वदर्शिभिः ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: nāsato vidyate bhāvo nābhāvo vidyate sataḥ ubhayor api dṛṣṭo’ntas tv-anayos tattva-darśibhiḥ
verses.translation: Of that which is temporary there is no eternal existence. Of that which is eternal there is no destruction or change. Seers of the truth have realised the constitutional position of both.

verses.sanskrit: अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् । विनाशमव्ययस्यास्य न कश्चित्कर्तुमर्हति ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: avināśi tu tad viddhi yena sarvam idaṁ tatam vināśam avyayasyāsya na kaścit kartum arhati
verses.translation: Know for certain that individual consciousness, which pervades the whole body, is imperishable. Nobody can destroy the indestructible individual unit of consciousness.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तवन्त इमे देहा नित्यस्योक्ताः शरीरिणः । अनाशिनोऽप्रमेयस्य तस्माद्युध्यस्व भारत ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: antavanta ime dehā nityasyoktāḥ śarīriṇaḥ anāśino’prameyasya tasmād yudhyasva bhārata
verses.translation: Embodied consciousness is eternal, imperishable and infinite. Only the material body is perishable. Therefore O Arjuna, fight!

verses.sanskrit: य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम् । उभौ तौ न विजानीतो नायं हन्ति न हन्यते ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: ya enaṁ vetti hantāraṁ yaścainaṁ manyate hatam ubhau tau na vijānīto nāyaṁ hanti na hanyate
verses.translation: One who considers the eternal unit of consciousness to be the slayer, and one who considers it to be capable of being slain are both in ignorance – for it neither slays nor is slain.

verses.sanskrit: न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचिन् नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः । अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: na jāyate mriyate vā kadācin nāyaṁ bhūtvā bhavitā vā na bhūyaḥ ajo nityaḥ śāśvato’yaṁ purāṇo na hanyate hanyamāne śarīre
verses.translation: The individual unit of consciousness neither takes birth nor dies at any time. It has never been created nor will it ever be created. It is unborn, eternal, indestructible and timeless – it is not destroyed when the material body is destroyed.

verses.sanskrit: वेदाविनाशिनं नित्यं य एनमजमव्ययम् । कथं स पुरुषः पार्थ कं घातयति हन्ति कम् ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: vedāvināśinaṁ nityaṁ ya enam ajam avyayam kathaṁ sa puruṣaḥ pārtha kaṁ ghātayati hantikam
verses.translation: O Pārtha, considering that the individual unit of consciousness is eternal, unborn, imperishable and indestructible, how can a person kill anyone, and whom does he kill?

verses.sanskrit: वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय नवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽपराणि । तथा शरीराणि विहाय जीर्णा- न्यन्यानि संयाति नवानि देही ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration: vāsāṁsi jīrṇāni yathā vihāya navāni gṛhṇāti naro’parāṇi tathā śarīrāṇi vihāya jīrṇāny-anyāni saṁyāti navāni dehī
verses.translation: Just as one removes old clothes and accepts new ones, similarly the embodied unit of consciousness gives up old bodies and accepts new bodies.

verses.sanskrit: नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः । न चैनं क्लेदयन्त्यापो न शोषयति मारुतः ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: nainaṁ chindanti śastrāṇi nainaṁ dahati pāvakaḥ na cainaṁ kledayanty-āpo na śoṣayati mārutaḥ
verses.translation: Weapons cannot cut the individual consciousness; it cannot be burned by fire; water cannot wet it and air cannot dry it.

verses.sanskrit: अच्छेद्योऽयमदाह्योऽयमक्लेद्योऽशोष्य एव च । नित्यः सर्वगतः स्थाणुरचलोऽयं सनातनः ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: acchedyo’yam adāhyo’yam akledyo’śoṣya eva ca nityaḥ sarva-gataḥ sthāṇur acalo’yaṁ sanātanaḥ
verses.translation: It is indestructible, incombustible, insoluble and cannot be withered. It is eternal, all-pervading, unchanging, immovable and primeval.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्तोऽयमचिन्त्योऽयमविकार्योऽयमुच्यते । तस्मादेवं विदित्वैनं नानुशोचितुमर्हसि ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: avyakto’yam acintyo’yam avikāryo’yam ucyate tasmād evaṁ viditvainaṁ nānuśocitum arhasi
verses.translation: It is said that it is imperceptible, inconceivable and immutable. Thus, understanding the nature of individual embodied consciousness, it is inappropriate for you to lament.

verses.sanskrit: अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम् । तथापि त्वं महाबाहो नैवं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: atha cainaṁ nitya-jātaṁ nityaṁ vā manyase mṛtam tathāpi tvaṁ mahā-bāho nainaṁ śocitum arhasi
verses.translation: Even if you believe that the individual consciousness is eternally subject to birth and death, still you have no reason to lament, O mighty-armed one.

verses.sanskrit: जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च । तस्मादपरिहार्येऽर्थे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: jātasya hi dhruvo mṛtyur dhruvaṁ janma mṛtasya ca tasmād aparihārye’rthe na tvaṁ śocitum arhasi
verses.translation: For one who is born, death is certain. For one who is dead, birth is certain. Therefore, you should not grieve over that which is inevitable.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्तादीनि भूतानि व्यक्तमध्यानि भारत । अव्यक्तनिधनान्येव तत्र का परिदेवना ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: avyaktādīni bhūtāni vyakta-madhyāni bhārata avyakta-nidhanāny-eva tatra kā paridevanā
verses.translation: O Bhārata, all living beings are unmanifest before birth, manifest between birth and death, and again unmanifest after death. What then is the reason for lamentation?

verses.sanskrit: आश्चर्यवत्पश्यति कश्चिदेन- माश्चर्यवद्वदति तथैव चान्यः । आश्चर्यवच्चैनमन्यः शृणोति श्रुत्वाप्येनं वेद न चैव कश्चित् ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration: āścaryavat paśyati kaścidenam āścaryavad vadati tathaiva cānyaḥ āścaryavac-cainam anyaḥ śṛṇoti śrutvāpy-enaṁ veda na caiva kaścit
verses.translation: Some consider the individual conscious unit as astounding, some describe it as astounding, others hear of it as astounding – and some, even after having heard about it, have no knowledge of it.

verses.sanskrit: देही नित्यमवध्योऽयं देहे सर्वस्य भारत । तस्मात्सर्वाणि भूतानि न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration: dehī nityam avadhyo’yaṁ dehe sarvasya bhārata tasmāt sarvāṇi bhūtāni na tvaṁ śocitum arhasi
verses.translation: O descendant of Bharata, the eternal individual consciousness that dwells within the bodies of all beings can never be slain. Thus, you should not lament for anyone.

verses.sanskrit: स्वधर्ममपि चावेक्ष्य न विकम्पितुमर्हसि । धर्म्याद्धि युद्धाच्छ्रेयोऽन्यत्क्षत्रियस्य न विद्यते ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration: svadharmam api cāvekṣya na vikampitum arhasi dharmyāddhi yuddhāc chreyo’nyat kṣatriyasya na vidyate
verses.translation: Moreover, considering your natural duty, you should not waver as there is no better course of action for a warrior than a battle to uphold righteousness.

verses.sanskrit: यदृच्छया चोपपन्नं स्वर्गद्वारमपावृतम् । सुखिनः क्षत्रियाः पार्थ लभन्ते युद्धमीदृशम् ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration: yadṛcchayā copapannaṁ svarga-dvāram apāvṛtam sukhinaḥ kṣatriyāḥ pārtha labhante yuddham īdṛśam
verses.translation: O Pārtha, only the most fortunate warriors are favoured with the opportunity to engage in such a war, which has come of its own accord to you as an open door to the higher planets.

verses.sanskrit: अथ चेत्त्वमिमं धर्म्यं संग्रामं न करिष्यसि । ततः स्वधर्मं कीर्तिं च हित्वा पापमवाप्स्यसि ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration: atha cet tvam imaṁ dharmyaṁ sangrāmaṁ na kariṣyasi tataḥ svadharmaṁ kīrtiṁ ca hitvā pāpam avāpsyasi
verses.translation: But if you decide not to take part in this war of righteousness, your principles ofdharmawill be lost, fame will abandon you and impiety will be incurred.

verses.sanskrit: अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानि कथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्ययाम् । सम्भावितस्य चाकीर्तिर्मरणादतिरिच्यते ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration: akīrtiṁ cāpi bhūtāni kathayiṣyanti te’vyayām sambhāvitasya cākīrtir maraṇād atiricyate
verses.translation: For all time to come, people will speak of your infamy, and for one who is great, infamy is worse than death.

verses.sanskrit: भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महारथाः । येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम् ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration: bhayād raṇād uparataṁ maṁsyante tvāṁ mahā-rathāḥ yeṣāṁ ca tvaṁ bahu-mato bhūtvā yāsyasi lāghavam
verses.translation: Illustrious warriors will believe that you ceased fighting out of fear. You will fall into disgrace in the eyes of those that hold you in great esteem.

verses.sanskrit: अवाच्यवादांश्च बहून्वदिष्यन्ति तवाहिताः । निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दुःखतरं नु किम् ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration: avācya-vādāṁś ca bahūn vadiṣyanti tavāhitāḥ nindantas tava sāmarthyaṁ tato duḥkhataraṁ nu kim
verses.translation: Your enemies will insult you with slanderous words, condemning your prowess. Alas, what could be more painful than that?

verses.sanskrit: हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम् । तस्मादुत्तिष्ठ कौन्तेय युद्धाय कृतनिश्चयः ॥३७॥
verses.transliteration: hato vā prāpsyasi svargaṁ jitvā vā bhokṣyase mahīm tasmād uttiṣṭha kaunteya yuddhāya kṛta-niścayaḥ
verses.translation: O son of Kuntī, if you are killed you will attain the higher planets, and if you are victorious you will enjoy the Earth. Therefore, be confident of your success – stand up and fight!

verses.sanskrit: सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ । ततो युद्धाय युज्यस्व नैवं पापमवाप्स्यसि ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration: sukha-duḥkhe same kṛtvā lābhālābhau jayājayau tato yuddhāya yujyasva naivaṁ pāpam avāpsyasi
verses.translation: Maintain equanimity when faced with happiness and distress, gain and loss, victory and defeat – fight, and in this way you will not incur impiety.

verses.sanskrit: एषा तेऽभिहिता साङ्ख्ये बुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां शृणु । बुद्ध्या युक्तो यया पार्थ कर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration: eṣā te’bhihitā sāṅkhye buddhir-yoge tv-imāṁ śṛṇu buddhyā yukto yayā pārtha karma-bandhaṁ prahāsyasi
verses.translation: O Arjuna, son of Pṛthā, I have revealed to you the knowledge of individual consciousness. Now hear how to act upon this knowledge, through which you will be able to release yourself from the bondage of action.

verses.sanskrit: नेहाभिक्रमनाशोऽस्ति प्रत्यवायो न विद्यते । स्वल्पमप्यस्य धर्मस्य त्रायते महतो भयात् ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration: nehābhikrama nāśo’sti pratyavāyo na vidyate svalpam apyasya dharmasya trāyate mahato bhayāt
verses.translation: There is no loss, nor is there any diminution of result in performing thisdharma. Even the slightest effort saves one from the greatest fear.

verses.sanskrit: व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिरेकेह कुरुनन्दन । बहुशाखा ह्यनन्ताश्च बुद्धयोऽव्यवसायिनाम् ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration: vyavasāyātmikā buddhir ekeha kuru-nandana bahu-śākhā hy-anantāś ca buddhayo’vyavasāyinām
verses.translation: O descendant of the Kurus, spiritual intelligence is one-pointed and exclusive. However, the intelligence of those that desire mundane enjoyment is many branched.

verses.sanskrit: यामिमां पुष्पितां वाचं प्रवदन्त्यविपश्चितः । वेदवादरताः पार्थ नान्यदस्तीति वादिनः ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration: yām imāṁ puṣpitāṁ vācaṁ pravadanty-avipaścitaḥ veda-vāda-ratāḥ pārtha nānyad astīti vādinaḥ
verses.translation: O Pārtha, those of small intelligence misinterpret theVedasand claim that there is no divine principle in creation. Thus they glorify those statements that are pleasing to the senses.

verses.sanskrit: कामात्मानः स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम् । क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति ॥४३॥
verses.transliteration: kāmātmānaḥ svarga-parā janma-karma-phala-pradām kriyā-viśeṣa-bahulāṁ bhogaiśvarya-gatiṁ prati
verses.translation: Because their hearts are filled with selfish desires and their goal is the higher planets, they prescribe many rituals that award higher birth, wealth and power and lead to enjoyment and opulence.

verses.sanskrit: भोगैश्वर्यप्रसक्तानां तयापहृतचेतसाम् । व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिः समाधौ न विधीयते ॥४४॥
verses.transliteration: bhogaiśvarya-prasaktānāṁ tayāpahṛta-cetasām vyavasāyātmikā buddhiḥ samādhau na vidhīyate
verses.translation: By such ideas these persons, contemplating sense gratification and mundane pleasures, do not attain the resolve to fix their minds on the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यो भवार्जुन । निर्द्वन्द्वो नित्यसत्त्वस्थो निर्योगक्षेम आत्मवान् ॥४५॥
verses.transliteration: traiguṇya-viṣayā vedā nistraiguṇyo bhavārjuna nirdvandvo nitya-sattva-stho niryoga-kṣema ātmavān
verses.translation: TheVedasdeal with subjects in the three modes of material nature. O Arjuna, become free from duality, situated in a state of pure spiritual consciousness, free from the pursuits for gain and preservation and thus you will transcend these three modes.

verses.sanskrit: यावानर्थ उदपाने सर्वतः सम्प्लुतोदके । तावान्सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानतः ॥४६॥
verses.transliteration: yāvān artha udapāne sarvataḥ samplutodake tāvān sarveṣu vedeṣu brāhmaṇasya vijānataḥ
verses.translation: A large lake serves all the purposes served by a small pond. Similarly, one who is the knower of the Absolute Truth realises all the purposes found within theVedas.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन । मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि ॥४७॥
verses.transliteration: karmaṇy-evādhikāraste mā phaleṣu kadācana mā karma-phala-hetur bhūr mā te saṅgo’stv-akarmaṇi
verses.translation: Your right is to perform your work, but never to the results. Never be motivated by the results of your actions, nor should you be attached to not performing your prescribed duties.

verses.sanskrit: योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय । सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते ॥४८॥
verses.transliteration: yogasthaḥ kuru karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā dhanañjaya siddhy-asiddhyoḥ samo bhūtvā samatvaṁ yoga ucyate
verses.translation: O Dhanañjaya, stand firm inyoga, perform your activities giving up attachment and be equipoised in both success and failure. Such balance is known asyoga.

verses.sanskrit: दूरेण ह्यवरं कर्म बुद्धियोगाद्धनञ्जय । बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणाः फलहेतवः ॥४९॥
verses.transliteration: dūreṇa hy-avaraṁ karma buddhi-yogād dhanañjaya buddhau śaraṇam anviccha kṛpaṇāḥ phala-hetavaḥ
verses.translation: O Dhanañjaya, fruitive activities are by far inferior to theyogaof wisdom. Therefore, take shelter in the wisdom of equanimity. Those that are motivated by the fruitive results of their actions are misers.

verses.sanskrit: बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते । तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योगः कर्मसु कौशलम् ॥५०॥
verses.transliteration: buddhi-yukto jahātīha ubhe sukṛta-duṣkṛte tasmād yogāya yujyasva yogaḥ karmasu kauśalam
verses.translation: A wise man refrains from performing both good and bad actions in this world. Thus, engage inyoga, asyogais the best of all activities.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिणः । जन्मबन्धविनिर्मुक्ताः पदं गच्छन्त्यनामयम् ॥५१॥
verses.transliteration: karma-jaṁ buddhi yuktā hi phalaṁ tyaktvā manīṣiṇaḥ janma-bandha-vinirmuktāḥ padaṁ gacchanty-anāmayam
verses.translation: The wise give up the results of their actions and thus liberate themselves from the bondage of material birth and death. Thus they attain the plane beyond all suffering.

verses.sanskrit: यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति । तदा गन्तासि निर्वेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च ॥५२॥
verses.transliteration: yadā te moha-kalilaṁ buddhir vyatitariṣyati tadā gantāsi nirvedaṁ śrotavyasya śrutasya ca
verses.translation: Once your intelligence is able to pass through the dense jungle of illusion, you will become indifferent to all that has been heard and all that is yet to be heard.

verses.sanskrit: श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला । समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि ॥५३॥
verses.transliteration: śruti-vipratipannā te yadā sthāsyati niścalā samādhāv-achalā buddhis tadā yogam avāpsyasi
verses.translation: When your mind is no longer affected by the false interpretations of theVedas, then you will attain the perfect stage ofyoga.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाधिस्थस्य केशव । स्थितधीः किं प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम् ॥५४॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – sthita-prajñasya kā bhāṣā samādhi-sthasya keśava sthita-dhīḥ kiṁ prabhāṣeta kim āsīta vrajeta kim
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Keśava, what are the characteristics of that person who is perfectly situated in divine wisdom and fully absorbed in pure spiritual consciousness (samādhi)? How does he speak? How does he sit? How does he walk?

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । प्रजहाति यदा कामान्सर्वान्पार्थ मनोगतान् । आत्मन्येवात्मना तुष्टः स्थितप्रज्ञस्तदोच्यते ॥५५॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – prajahāti yadā kāmān sarvān pārtha manogatān ātmany-evātmanā tuṣṭaḥ sthita-prajñas tadocyate
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: O Pārtha, When the living being abandons all material desires that enter the mind and becomes self-satisfied within, then that person is said to be situated in divine knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम् । नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥५७॥
verses.transliteration: yaḥ sarvatrānabhisnehas tat tat prāpya śubhāśubham nābhinandati na dveṣṭi tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā
verses.translation: One who is unattached to anything in this world and who does not become joyful or resentful on attaining good or evil, is firmly established in wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः । इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥५८॥
verses.transliteration: yadā saṁharate cāyaṁ kūrmo’ṅgānīva sarvaśaḥ indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyas tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā
verses.translation: When one is able to withdraw the senses from sense-objects, just as a tortoise withdraws its limbs, then he is firmly established in wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहारस्य देहिनः । रसवर्जं रसोऽप्यस्य परं दृष्ट्वा निवर्तते ॥५९॥
verses.transliteration: viṣayā vinivartante nirāhārasya dehinaḥ rasa-varjaṁ raso’pyasya paraṁ dṛṣṭvā nivartate
verses.translation: An embodied living being may renounce sense-objects, but the taste for enjoying them remains. However, this too also ceases for one who realises the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चितः । इन्द्रियाणि प्रमाथीनि हरन्ति प्रसभं मनः ॥६०॥
verses.transliteration: yatato hy-api kaunteya puruṣasya vipaścitaḥ indriyāṇi pramāthīni haranti prasabhaṁ manaḥ
verses.translation: Yet the turbulent senses can forcibly steal the mind of even a wise man of sound judgment, O son of Kuntī.

verses.sanskrit: तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः । वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥६१॥
verses.transliteration: tāni sarvāṇi saṁyamya yukta āsīta mat-paraḥ vaśe hi yasyendriyāṇi tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā
verses.translation: Restraining all the senses, a self-controlled person should fix his mind upon Me. Thus he becomes firmly situated in divine knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते । सङ्गात्सञ्जायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायते ॥६२॥
verses.transliteration: dhyāyato viṣayān puṁsaḥ saṅgas teṣūpajāyate saṅgāt sañjāyate kāmaḥ kāmāt krodho’bhijāyate
verses.translation: By meditating upon sense-objects, one becomes attached to them. From attachment desire appears and from desire anger manifests.

verses.sanskrit: क्रोधाद्भवति सम्मोहः सम्मोहात्स्मृतिविभ्रमः । स्मृतिभ्रंशाद् बुद्धिनाशो बुद्धिनाशात्प्रणश्यति ॥६३॥
verses.transliteration: krodhād bhavati saṁmohaḥ saṁmohāt smṛti-vibhramaḥ smṛti-bhraṁśād buddhi-nāśo buddhi-nāśāt praṇaśyati
verses.translation: Delusion manifests from anger. Delusion causes bewilderment of memory. Bewilderment of memory causes loss of intelligence and when intelligence is lost, one is destroyed.

verses.sanskrit: रागद्वेषविमुक्तैस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चरन् । आत्मवश्यैर्विधेयात्मा प्रसादमधिगच्छति ॥६४॥
verses.transliteration: rāga-dveṣa-vimuktais tu viṣayān indriyaiś caran ātma-vaśyair vidheyātmā prasādam adhigacchati
verses.translation: However, one who can control his mind and senses, and is free from both attachment and repulsion, even while in the midst of sense-objects, attains divine grace.

verses.sanskrit: प्रसादे सर्वदुःखानां हानिरस्योपजायते । प्रसन्नचेतसो ह्याशु बुद्धिः पर्यवतिष्ठते ॥६५॥
verses.transliteration: prasāde sarva-duḥkhānāṁ hānir asyopajāyate prasanna-cetaso hy-āśu buddhiḥ paryavatiṣṭhate
verses.translation: When one attains divine grace, all miseries cease. Certainly, such a person who achieves a tranquil mind develops divine wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: नास्ति बुद्धिरयुक्तस्य न चायुक्तस्य भावना । न चाभावयतः शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुतः सुखम् ॥६६॥
verses.transliteration: nāsti buddhir ayuktasya na cāyuktasya bhāvanā na cābhāvayataḥ śāntir aśāntasya kutaḥ sukham
verses.translation: One who is bereft of self-control cannot attain wisdom. Without wisdom one can never meditate. One who cannot meditate cannot achieve peace, and without peace how can one attain happiness?

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते । तदस्य हरति प्रज्ञां वायुर्नावमिवाम्भसि ॥६७॥
verses.transliteration: indriyāṇāṁ hi caratāṁ yan mano’nuvidhīyate tad asya harati prajñāṁ vāyur nāvam ivāmbhasi
verses.translation: Whichever sense the wandering mind becomes absorbed in, that sense carries away the intelligence, just as a ship at sea is swept away by a strong wind.

verses.sanskrit: तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः । इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता ॥६८॥
verses.transliteration: tasmād yasya mahā-bāho nigṛhītāni sarvaśaḥ indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyas tasya prajñā pratiṣṭhitā
verses.translation: Therefore, O mighty armed Arjuna, one whose senses are fully withdrawn from the sense-objects is firmly established in divine wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: या निशा सर्वभूतानां तस्यां जागर्ति संयमी । यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुनेः ॥६९॥
verses.transliteration: yā niśā sarva-bhūtānāṁ tasyāṁ jāgarti saṁyamī yasyāṁ jāgrati bhūtāni sā niśā paśyato muneḥ
verses.translation: That which is day for the self-controlled sage is night for all living beings, and that which is day for all living beings is night for the introspective sage.

verses.sanskrit: आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं समुद्रमापः प्रविशन्ति यद्वत् । तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वे स शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी ॥७०॥
verses.transliteration: āpūryamāṇam acala-pratiṣṭhaṁ samudram āpaḥ praviśanti yadvat tadvat kāmā yaṁ praviśanti sarve sa śāntim āpnoti na kāma-kāmī
verses.translation: Such a sage who is steadfast in facing the constant flow of desires and who does not strive to satisfy them achieves peace. He remains unaffected, just as the ocean remains calm as rivers enter into it.

verses.sanskrit: विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति निःस्पृहः । निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः स शान्तिमधिगच्छति ॥७१॥
verses.transliteration: vihāya kāmān yaḥ sarvān pumāṁś carati niḥspṛhaḥ nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ sa śāntim adhigacchati
verses.translation: Only one who abandons all desire for sense-indulgence, who lives free from possessiveness and is free of false ego can attain peace.

verses.sanskrit: एषा ब्राह्मी स्थितिः पार्थ नैनां प्राप्य विमुह्यति । स्थित्वास्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृच्छति ॥७२॥
verses.transliteration: eṣā brāhmī sthitiḥ pārtha naināṁ prāpya vimuhyati sthitvāsyām anta-kāle’pi brahma-nirvāṇam ṛcchati
verses.translation: O Pārtha, having attained realisation of the Absolute Truth one is never bewildered. If one is situated in this state at the time of death, one attainsbrahma-nirvāṇam, the abode of pure consciousness, and all suffering ceases.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 3 Karma Yoga The Yoga Of Action

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच ज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन । तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – jyāyasī cet karmaṇas te matā buddhir janārdana tat kiṁ karmaṇi ghore māṁ niyojayasi keśava
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Janārdana, O Keśava, if it is Your opinion that wisdom is better than action, then why do You wish to engage me in such violent activities?

verses.sanskrit: व्यामिश्रेणेव वाक्येन बुद्धिं मोहयसीव मे । तदेकं वद निश्चित्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्नुयाम् ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: vyāmiśreṇeva vākyena buddhiṁ mohayasīva me tad ekaṁ vada niścitya yena śreyo’ham āpnuyām
verses.translation: Your words seem to be contradictory and my mind is now confused. Therefore, kindly tell me which particular path is most beneficial for me.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । लोकेऽस्मिन् द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ । ज्ञानयोगेन साङ्ख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम् ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – loke’smin dvi-vidhā niṣṭhā purā proktā mayānagha jñāna-yogena sāṅkhyānāṁ karma-yogena yoginām
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: O faultless one, previously I explained the two paths found in this world – the path of wisdom for the empirical philosophers and the path of action for those that must perform action.

verses.sanskrit: न कर्मणामनारम्भान्नैष्कर्म्यं पुरुषोऽश्नुते । न च संन्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: na karmaṇām anārambhān naiṣkarmyaṁ puruṣo’śnute na ca sannyasanād eva siddhiṁ samadhigacchati
verses.translation: A man cannot attain the state of divine consciousness free from material action simply by abstaining from action. Neither can perfection be attained simply by renunciation.

verses.sanskrit: न हि कश्चित्क्षणमपि जातु तिष्ठत्यकर्मकृत् । कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: na hi kaścit kṣaṇam api jātu tiṣṭhaty-akarmakṛt kāryate hy-avaśaḥ karma sarvaḥ prakṛti-jair guṇaiḥ
verses.translation: One cannot abstain from activities even for a moment. Indeed, all living beings are forced to engage in activities due to the influence of the modes of material nature.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मेन्द्रियाणि संयम्य य आस्ते मनसा स्मरन् । इन्द्रियार्थान्विमूढात्मा मिथ्याचारः स उच्यते ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: karmendriyāṇi saṁyamya ya āste manasā smaran indriyārthān vimūḍhātmā mithyācāraḥ sa ucyate
verses.translation: One who controls the external senses yet mentally dwells upon the sense-objects is said to be foolish and hypocritical.

verses.sanskrit: यस्त्विन्द्रियाणि मनसा नियम्यारभतेऽर्जुन । कर्मेन्द्रियैः कर्मयोगमसक्तः स विशिष्यते ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: yas tv-indriyāṇi manasā niyamyārabhate’rjuna karmendriyaiḥ karma-yogam asaktaḥ sa viśiṣyate
verses.translation: However, that person who controls the senses with the mind and engages them inkarma-yoga(the path of selfless action) without attachment is superior, O Arjuna.

verses.sanskrit: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः । शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मणः ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: niyataṁ kuru karma tvaṁ karma jyāyo hy-akarmaṇaḥ śarīra-yātrāpi ca te na prasiddhyed akarmaṇaḥ
verses.translation: You should perform your prescribed duties, since action is better than inaction. You cannot maintain your existence without action.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः । तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसङ्गः समाचर ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: yajñārthāt karmaṇo’nyatra loko’yaṁ karma-bandhanaḥ tad-arthaṁ karma kaunteya mukta-saṅgaḥ samācara
verses.translation: All activities are meant for sacrifice (yajña) to Viṣṇu. Other than that, all other activities bind one to this material world. O son of Kuntī, work for Him alone and be free from any attachment.

verses.sanskrit: सहयज्ञाः प्रजाः सृष्ट्वा पुरोवाच प्रजापतिः । अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक् ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: saha-yajñāḥ prajāḥ sṛṣṭvā purovāca prajāpatiḥ anena prasaviṣyadhvam eṣa vo’stv iṣṭa kāmadhuk
verses.translation: In the beginning of creation, Brahmā created mankind along with the system of sacrifice and said, “Through this sacrifice may you prosper. May it fulfil all your desires.”

verses.sanskrit: देवान्भावयतानेन ते देवा भावयन्तु वः । परस्परं भावयन्तः श्रेयः परमवाप्स्यथ ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: devān bhāvayatānena te devā bhāvayantu vaḥ parasparaṁ bhāvayantaḥ śreyaḥ param avāpsyatha
verses.translation: The demigods, being satisfied with sacrifices, will also satisfy you. By mutually pleasing each other, you will attain the highest benefit.

verses.sanskrit: इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविताः । तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: iṣṭān bhogān hi vo devā dāsyante yajña-bhāvitāḥ tair dattān apradāyaibhyo yo bhuṅkte stena eva saḥ
verses.translation: Being satisfied by your performance of sacrifices, the demigods will bestow unto you all the necessities of life. But one who enjoys these gifts without offering them to the demigods is a thief.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञशिष्टाशिनः सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषैः । भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: yajña-śiṣṭāśinaḥ santo mucyante sarva-kilbiṣaiḥ bhuñjate te tvaghaṁ pāpā ye pacanty-ātma-kāraṇāt
verses.translation: Enlightened individuals are liberated from all types of impiety by accepting the remnants of foodstuffs offered in sacrifice. However, those who only cook for themselves perpetuate their own bondage.

verses.sanskrit: अन्नाद्भवन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भवः । यज्ञाद्भवति पर्जन्यो यज्ञः कर्मसमुद्भवः ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: annād bhavanti bhūtāni parjanyād anna-sambhavaḥ yajñād bhavati parjanyo yajñaḥ karma-samudbhavaḥ
verses.translation: All living beings subsist on food, and food is produced by rain. Rain is produced due to the performance of sacrifice, and sacrifice is born of prescribed activities.

verses.sanskrit: कर्म ब्रह्मोद्भवं विद्धि ब्रह्माक्षरसमुद्भवम् । तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: karma brahmodbhavaṁ viddhi brahmākṣara-samudbhavam tasmāt sarva-gataṁ brahma nityaṁ yajñe pratiṣṭhitam
verses.translation: One should know that prescribed activities originate from theVedas, and theVedasoriginate from the imperishable Absolute Truth. Thus, the omnipresent Absolute Truth is eternally present within acts of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह यः । अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: evaṁ pravartitaṁ cakraṁ nānuvartayatīha yaḥ aghāyur indriyārāmo moghaṁ pārtha sa jīvati
verses.translation: O Pārtha, one who lives in this world but does not accept the Vedic system, lives an impious life in pursuit of sense pleasure – thus he lives his life in vain.

verses.sanskrit: यस्त्वात्मरतिरेव स्यादात्मतृप्तश्च मानवः । आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: yas tv-ātmaratir eva syād ātma-tṛptaś ca mānavaḥ ātmany-eva ca santuṣṭas tasya kāryaṁ na vidyate
verses.translation: However, for one who finds pleasure in the self, there is no duty to fulfil. He rejoices in the self, and internally is completely self-satisfied.

verses.sanskrit: नैव तस्य कृतेनार्थो नाकृतेनेह कश्चन । न चास्य सर्वभूतेषु कश्चिदर्थव्यपाश्रयः ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: naiva tasya kṛtenārtho nākṛteneha kaścana na cāsya sarva-bhūteṣu kaścid artha-vyapāśrayaḥ
verses.translation: In this world, he neither gains by action, nor gains by inaction. Neither does he depend upon any other person.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मादसक्तः सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर । असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पूरुषः ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: tasmād asaktaḥ satataṁ kāryaṁ karma samācara asakto hyācaran karma param āpnoti pūruṣaḥ
verses.translation: Therefore, continue to perform your prescribed duties perfectly without attachment to the results. By acting without attachment one attains the Absolute.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादयः । लोकसंग्रहमेवापि सम्पश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: karmaṇaiva hi saṁsiddhim āsthitā janakādayaḥ loka-saṅgraham evāpi sampaśyan kartum arhasi
verses.translation: In the past, kings such as Janaka and others attained perfection by performing their prescribed duties. In order to set a proper example to the people in general, you should also act appropriately.

verses.sanskrit: यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जनः । स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: yad yad ācarati śreṣṭhas tat tad evetaro janaḥ sa yat pramāṇaṁ kurute lokas tad anuvartate
verses.translation: However a great man conducts himself, common men will follow. Accordingly, whatever standards he sets by his actions, others will follow in his footsteps.

verses.sanskrit: न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन । नानवाप्तमवाप्तव्यं वर्त एव च कर्मणि ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration: na me pārthāsti kartavyaṁ triṣu lokeṣu kiñcana nānavāptam avāptavyaṁ varta eva ca karmaṇi

verses.sanskrit: यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रितः । मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: yadi hy-ahaṁ na varteyaṁ jātu karmaṇy-atandritaḥ mama vartmānuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśaḥ
verses.translation: If I avoid activity then all men will follow My path and neglect their prescribed duties, O Pārtha.

verses.sanskrit: उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम् । सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमाः प्रजाः ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: utsīdeyur ime lokā na kuryāṁ karma ced aham saṅkarasya ca kartā syām upahanyām imāḥ prajāḥ
verses.translation: If I do not act properly, then the general populace will be ruined and I will be the cause of unwanted progeny. In this way I will cause the destruction of all beings.

verses.sanskrit: सक्ताः कर्मण्यविद्वांसो यथा कुर्वन्ति भारत । कुर्याद्विद्वांस्तथासक्तश्चिकीर्षुर्लोकसंग्रहम् ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: saktāḥ karmaṇy-avidvāṁso yathā kurvanti bhārata kuryād vidvāṁs tathāsaktaś cikīrṣur loka-saṅgraham
verses.translation: O descendant of Bharata, just as the ignorant are attached to their activities, similarly the wise must also work, but without attachment, for the welfare of all.

verses.sanskrit: न बुद्धिभेदं जनयेदज्ञानां कर्मसङ्गिनाम् । जोषयेत्सर्वकर्माणि विद्वान्युक्तः समाचरन् ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: na buddhi-bhedaṁ janayed ajñānāṁ karma-saṅginām joṣayet sarva-karmāṇi vidvān yuktaḥ samācaran
verses.translation: The wise should not disturb the minds of the ignorant who are attached to their selfish activities. Rather, remaining unattached and fully executing their duties, they should encourage the ignorant and engage them in pious activities.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृतेः क्रियमाणानि गुणैः कर्माणि सर्वशः । अहङ्कारविमूढात्मा कर्ताहमिति मन्यते ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: prakṛteḥ kriyamāṇāni guṇaiḥ karmāṇi sarvaśaḥ ahaṅkāra-vimūḍhātmā kartāham iti manyate
verses.translation: All activities are performed by the modes of nature. But those who are deluded by the false identification of the body think, “I am the doer.”

verses.sanskrit: तत्त्ववित्तु महाबाहो गुणकर्मविभागयोः । गुणा गुणेषु वर्तन्त इति मत्वा न सज्जते ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: tattvavit tu mahā-bāho guṇa-karma-vibhāgayoḥ guṇā guṇeṣu vartanta iti matvā na sajjate
verses.translation: Yet, O mighty-armed one, one who is a knower of the truth concerning action and the modes of material nature, understands that it is the modes interacting with one another and thus he remains unattached.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृतेर्गुणसम्मूढाः सज्जन्ते गुणकर्मसु । तानकृत्स्नविदो मन्दान्कृत्स्नविन्न विचालयेत् ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration: prakṛter guṇa-saṁmūḍhāḥ sajjante guṇa-karmasu tān akṛtsna-vido mandān kṛtsna-vin na vicālayet
verses.translation: Those bewildered by the modes of material nature are engrossed in material activities conducted by those modes. The wise should not disturb the ignorant who are bereft of proper knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि संन्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा । निराशीर्निर्ममो भूत्वा युध्यस्व विगतज्वरः ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration: mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi sannyasyādhyātma-cetasā nirāśīr nirmamo bhūtvā yudhyasva vigata-jvaraḥ
verses.translation: Completely surrendering all your activities unto Me, with your consciousness fully situated in the self, without any selfish motivation, without any sense of ownership and without grief – fight!

verses.sanskrit: ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवाः । श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर्मभिः ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration: ye me matam idaṁ nityam anutiṣṭhanti mānavāḥ śraddhāvanto’nasūyanto mucyante te’pi karmabhiḥ
verses.translation: Those that faithfully follow these instructions of Mine without envy will become free from the bondage of actions.

verses.sanskrit: ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम् । सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान्विद्धि नष्टानचेतसः ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration: ye tv-etad abhyasūyanto nānutiṣṭhanti me matam sarva-jñāna-vimūḍhāṁs tān viddhi naṣṭān acetasaḥ
verses.translation: However, you should know that those persons who, out of envy, do not follow My instructions are deprived of all knowledge. They have lost sight of the goal of life and are bereft of intelligence.

verses.sanskrit: सदृशं चेष्टते स्वस्याः प्रकृतेर्ज्ञानवानपि । प्रकृतिं यान्ति भूतानि निग्रहः किं करिष्यति ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration: sadṛśaṁ ceṣṭate svasyāḥ prakṛter jñānavān api prakṛtiṁ yānti bhūtāni nigrahaḥ kiṁ kariṣyati
verses.translation: Even a wise man acts according to his nature. All living beings act according to their natures, for what can repression achieve?

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ । तयोर्न वशमागच्छेत्तौ ह्यस्य परिपन्थिनौ ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration: indriyasyendriyasyārthe rāga-dveṣau vyavasthitau tayor na vaśam āgacchet tau hy-asya paripanthinau
verses.translation: The senses are attracted to and repelled by the objects of the senses. But one must not become controlled by such attraction or aversion for they are obstacles.

verses.sanskrit: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् । स्वधर्मे निधनं श्रेयः परधर्मो भयावहः ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration: śreyān svadharmo viguṇaḥ para-dharmāt svanuṣṭhitāt sva-dharme nidhanaṁ śreyaḥ para-dharmo bhayāvahaḥ
verses.translation: It is better to perform one’s own prescribed duties imperfectly rather than perform another’s duties perfectly. It is better to die while performing one’s own duties, for executing the duties of another is fraught with uncertainty.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच अथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुषः । अनिच्छन्नपि वार्ष्णेय बलादिव नियोजितः ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – atha kena prayukto’yaṁ pāpaṁ carati pūruṣaḥ anicchann api vārṣṇeya balād iva niyojitaḥ
verses.translation: Arjuna asked: O Kṛṣṇa, descendant of the Vṛṣṇis, what is it that makes a man perform impious activities even against his will, as if by force?

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । काम एष क्रोध एष रजोगुणसमुद्भवः । महाशनो महापाप्मा विद्ध्येनमिह वैरिणम् ॥३७॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – kāma eṣa krodha eṣa rajoguṇa-samudbhavaḥ mahā-śano mahā-pāpmā viddhy-enam iha vairiṇam
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: It is lust, which transforms into anger that is manifest from the mode of passion. Know this lust to be totally insatiable and extremely evil. It is the great enemy of this world.

verses.sanskrit: धूमेनाव्रियते वह्निर्यथादर्शो मलेन च । यथोल्बेनावृतो गर्भस्तथा तेनेदमावृतम् ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration: dhūmenāvriyate vahnir yathādarśo malena ca yatholbenāvṛto garbhas tathā tenedam āvṛtam
verses.translation: As a fire is covered by smoke, as a mirror is covered by dust, and as the womb covers an embryo, similarly, lust covers the consciousness of the living being.

verses.sanskrit: आवृतं ज्ञानमेतेन ज्ञानिनो नित्यवैरिणा । कामरूपेण कौन्तेय दुष्पूरेणानलेन च ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration: āvṛtaṁ jñānam etena jñānino nitya-vairiṇā kāma-rūpeṇa kaunteya duṣpūreṇānalena ca
verses.translation: O Kaunteya, the discrimination of even a wise man can become covered by this eternal nemesis in the form of lust that is like an all-devouring fire.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रियाणि मनो बुद्धिरस्याधिष्ठानमुच्यते । एतैर्विमोहयत्येष ज्ञानमावृत्य देहिनम् ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration: indriyāṇi mano buddhir asyādhiṣṭhānam ucyate etair vimohayaty eṣa jñānam āvṛtya dehinam
verses.translation: It is said that the senses, mind and intelligence are the sitting places of this enemy. Covering one’s knowledge, it bewilders the embodied living being.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मात्त्वमिन्द्रियाण्यादौ नियम्य भरतर्षभ । पाप्मानं प्रजहि ह्येनं ज्ञानविज्ञाननाशनम् ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration: tasmāt tvam indriyāṇy-ādau niyamya bharatarṣabha pāpmānaṁ prajahi hy-enaṁ jñāna-vijñāna-nāśanam
verses.translation: Therefore, O noblest amongst the Bharatas, you must first bring the senses under control and eliminate lust, which is the embodiment of all impiety and the destroyer of knowledge and realisation.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रियाणि पराण्याहुरिन्द्रियेभ्यः परं मनः । मनसस्तु परा बुद्धिर्यो बुद्धेः परतस्तु सः ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration: indriyāṇi parāṇy-āhur indriyebhyaḥ paraṁ manaḥ manasas tu parā buddhir yo buddheḥ paratas tu saḥ
verses.translation: It is said by the wise that the senses are superior to the sense-objects, the mind is superior to the senses, and the intelligence is superior to the mind. Superior to the intelligence is the individual unit of consciousness.

verses.sanskrit: एवं बुद्धेः परं बुद्ध्वा संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना । जहि शत्रुं महाबाहो कामरूपं दुरासदम् ॥४३॥
verses.transliteration: evaṁ buddheḥ paraṁ buddhvā saṁstabhyātmānam ātmanā jahi śatruṁ mahā-bāho kāma-rūpaṁ durāsadam
verses.translation: O mighty armed Arjuna, knowing the individual unit of consciousness to be superior to the intelligence, steady the mind with the pure intellect of the self and conquer this indomitable enemy in the form of lust.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 4 Jnana Yoga The Yoga Of Knowledge

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । इमं विवस्वते योगं प्रोक्तवानहमव्ययम् । विवस्वान्मनवे प्राह मनुरिक्ष्वाकवेऽब्रवीत् ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – imaṁ vivasvate yogaṁ proktavān aham avyayam vivasvān manave prāha manur ikṣvākave’bravīt
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: I disclosed this imperishable knowledge ofyogaunto Vivasvān, the sun-god. He then taught it to Vaivasvata Manu, who then instructed the same knowledge to Ikṣvāku.

verses.sanskrit: एवं परम्पराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदुः । स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्टः परन्तप ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: evaṁ paramparā prāptam imaṁ rājarṣayo viduḥ sa kāleneha mahatā yogo naṣṭaḥ parantapa
verses.translation: In this way, O conqueror of the enemy, the pious rulers understood this path of knowledge through the disciplic succession. However, this knowledge ofyogahas been lost due to the influence of time.

verses.sanskrit: स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योगः प्रोक्तः पुरातनः । भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम् ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: sa evāyaṁ mayā te’dya yogaḥ proktaḥ purātanaḥ bhakto’si me sakhā ceti rahasyaṁ hy-etad uttamam
verses.translation: I am again teaching this ancient science ofyogato you. Because you are My dear friend and devotee you can understand the transcendental mystery of which I speak.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच अपरं भवतो जन्म परं जन्म विवस्वतः । कथमेतद्विजानीयां त्वमादौ प्रोक्तवानिति ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – aparaṁ bhavato janma paraṁ janma vivasvataḥ katham etad vijānīyāṁ tvam ādau proktavān iti
verses.translation: Arjuna said: You were born only recently and the sun-god appeared long ago. So how am I to understand that in ancient times You had taught him the science ofyoga?

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन । तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – bahūni me vyatītāni janmāni tava cārjuna tāny-ahaṁ veda sarvāṇi na tvaṁ vettha parantapa
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: O conqueror of the enemy, both you and I have passed through many births. I know all of them but you do not.

verses.sanskrit: अजोऽपि सन्नव्ययात्मा भूतानामीश्वरोऽपि सन् । प्रकृतिं स्वामधिष्ठाय सम्भवाम्यात्ममायया ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: ajo’pi sannavyayātmā bhūtānām-īśvaro’pi san prakṛtiṁ svām-adhiṣṭhāya saṁbhavāmy-ātmamāyayā
verses.translation: Though I am unborn and My form is imperishable, and though I am the Controller of all things, I still remain in control of My material energy and manifest through My own potency.

verses.sanskrit: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत । अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम् ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānir bhavati bhārata abhyutthānam adharmasya tadātmānaṁ sṛjāmyaham
verses.translation: O descendant of Bharata, whenever there is a decline indharmaand a rise ofadharma, I personally appear.

verses.sanskrit: परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम् । धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: paritrāṇāya sādhūnāṁ vināśāya ca duṣkṛtām dharma-saṁsthāpanārthāya saṁbhavāmi yuge yuge
verses.translation: To protect the pious living beings and to put an end to malevolence, I appear in every age to establishdharma.

verses.sanskrit: जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः । त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: janma karma ca me divyam evaṁ yo vetti tattvataḥ tyaktvā dehaṁ punar-janma naiti māmeti so’rjuna
verses.translation: One who understands My divine appearance and activities never takes birth again after giving up this material body. He comes to Me, O Arjuna.

verses.sanskrit: वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिताः । बहवो ज्ञानतपसा पूता मद्भावमागताः ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: vīta-rāga-bhaya-krodhā man-mayā mām-upāśritāḥ bahavo jñāna-tapasā pūtā mad-bhāvam āgatāḥ
verses.translation: Freed from mundane attachment, fear and anger, and absorbed in thinking of Me, many people have taken refuge in Me and become purified by the knowledge of austerity and attained love for Me.

verses.sanskrit: ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम् । मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: ye yathā māṁ prapadyante tāṁs-tathaiva bhajāmy-aham mama vartmānuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśaḥ
verses.translation: In whatever way people surrender unto Me, I reward them accordingly. O Pārtha, all men follow My path.

verses.sanskrit: काङ्क्षन्तः कर्मणां सिद्धिं यजन्त इह देवताः । क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: kāṅkṣantaḥ karmaṇāṁ siddhiṁ yajanta iha devatāḥ kṣipraṁ hi mānuṣe loke siddhir bhavati karmajā
verses.translation: In this world, those that desire material success worship the demigods, since in human society success from such activities is quick to manifest.

verses.sanskrit: चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागशः । तस्य कर्तारमपि मां विद्ध्यकर्तारमव्ययम् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: cātur-varṇyaṁ mayā sṛṣṭaṁ guṇa-karma-vibhāgaśaḥ tasya kartāram api māṁ viddhy-akartāram avyayam
verses.translation: I have created the four social divisions that are determined by the influence of the modes of material nature and their parallel activities. Although I have created this arrangement, know that in reality I am the non-doer and that I am unchangeable.

verses.sanskrit: न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा । इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: na māṁ karmāṇi limpanti na me karma-phale spṛhā iti māṁ yo’bhijānāti karmabhir na sa badhyate
verses.translation: There is no activity that affects Me, neither do I desire the results of material activities. One who understands this is never bound bykarma.

verses.sanskrit: एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभिः । कुरु कर्मैव तस्मात्त्वं पूर्वैः पूर्वतरं कृतम् ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: evaṁ jñātvā kṛtaṁ karma pūrvair api mumukṣubhiḥ kuru karmaiva tasmāt tvaṁ pūrvaiḥ pūrvataraṁ kṛtam
verses.translation: Knowing this, in ancient times, those that desired liberation also performed action. Thus, you should also adopt the path of action as they did in the past.

verses.sanskrit: किं कर्म किमकर्मेति कवयोऽप्यत्र मोहिताः । तत्ते कर्म प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: kiṁ karma kim akarmeti kavayo’pyatra mohitāḥ tat te karma pravakṣyāmi yaj-jñātvā mokṣyase’śubhāt
verses.translation: What is action? What is inaction? – this subject bewilders even wise men. Therefore, I shall explain to you what is action, knowing which you will become liberated and attain all auspiciousness.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः । अकर्मणश्च बोद्धव्यं गहना कर्मणो गतिः ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: karmaṇo hy-api boddhavyaṁ boddhavyaṁ ca vikarmaṇaḥ akarmaṇaś ca boddhavyaṁ gahanā karmaṇo gatiḥ
verses.translation: One should understand what is prescribed action (karma), what is forbidden action (vikarma) and what is the renunciation of action (akarma). The path of action is most difficult to comprehend.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः । स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत् ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: karmaṇy-akarma yaḥ paśyed akarmaṇi ca karma yaḥ sa buddhimān manuṣyeṣu sa yuktaḥ kṛtsna-karma-kṛt
verses.translation: One who can see inaction in action and action within inaction is certainly wise amongst men. Indeed, he is ayogīand a performer of all actions.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य सर्वे समारम्भाः कामसङ्कल्पवर्जिताः । ज्ञानाग्निदग्धकर्माणं तमाहुः पण्डितं बुधाः ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: yasya sarve samārambhāḥ kāma-saṅkalpa-varjitāḥ jñānāgni-dagdha-karmāṇaṁ tam āhuḥ paṇḍitaṁ budhāḥ
verses.translation: One whose every action is free from selfish desires and who burns all his actions in the fire of knowledge is described by the learned as a wise man.

verses.sanskrit: त्यक्त्वा कर्मफलासङ्गं नित्यतृप्तो निराश्रयः । कर्मण्यभिप्रवृत्तोऽपि नैव किञ्चित्करोति सः ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: tyaktvā karma-phalāsaṅgaṁ nitya-tṛpto nirāśrayaḥ karmaṇy-abhipravṛtto’pi naiva kiñcit karoti saḥ
verses.translation: A person who has rejected the desire to enjoy the results of his actions, who does not depend upon others and who is always content, even while engaged in action, does nothing at all.

verses.sanskrit: निराशीर्यतचित्तात्मा त्यक्तसर्वपरिग्रहः । शारीरं केवलं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: nirāśīr yata cittātmā tyakta-sarva-parigrahaḥ śārīraṁ kevalaṁ karma kurvan nāpnoti kilbiṣam
verses.translation: Having no desires, controlling the mind and body, having no sense of possessiveness, such a person does not incur any wrongdoing although they may perform actions in order to maintain the body.

verses.sanskrit: यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्सरः । समः सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि न निबध्यते ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration: yadṛcchā-lābha-santuṣṭo dvandvātīto vimatsaraḥ samaḥ siddhāv-asiddhau ca kṛtvāpi na nibadhyate
verses.translation: One who is content with those things that come of their own accord, who is beyond duality, devoid of enviousness, and equal in success and failure – such a person is not bound bykarma, although he may perform actions.

verses.sanskrit: गतसङ्गस्य मुक्तस्य ज्ञानावस्थितचेतसः । यज्ञायाचरतः कर्म समग्रं प्रविलीयते ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: gata-saṅgasya muktasya jñānāvasthita-cetasaḥ yajñāyācharataḥ karma samagraṁ pravilīyate
verses.translation: Allkarmais completely dissolved for one who is detached, liberated, situated in knowledge and performs action only in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: ब्रह्मार्पणं ब्रह्म हविर्ब्रह्माग्नौ ब्रह्मणा हुतम् । ब्रह्मैव तेन गन्तव्यं ब्रह्मकर्मसमाधिना ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: brahmārpaṇaṁ brahma havir brahmāgnau brahmaṇā hutam brahmaiva tena gantavyaṁ brahma-karma-samādhinā
verses.translation: The utensils used for sacrifice are the Absolute, the sacred fire is the Absolute and the offering made is the Absolute. One whose consciousness is always absorbed in thoughts of the Absolute attains the Absolute.

verses.sanskrit: दैवमेवापरे यज्ञं योगिनः पर्युपासते । ब्रह्माग्नावपरे यज्ञं यज्ञेनैवोपजुह्वति ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: daivam evāpare yajñaṁ yoginaḥ paryupāsate brahmāgnāv-apare yajñaṁ yajñenaivopajuhvati
verses.translation: Someyogīsperform sacrifices to the demigods. Others offer themselves into the fire of the Absolute.

verses.sanskrit: श्रोत्रादीनीन्द्रियाण्यन्ये संयमाग्निषु जुह्वति । शब्दादीन्विषयानन्य इन्द्रियाग्निषु जुह्वति ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: śrotrādīnīndriyāṇy-anye saṁyamāgniṣu juhvati śabdādīn viṣayān anya indriyāgniṣu juhvati
verses.translation: Some offer the senses of hearing, seeing, touching, smelling and tasting into the fire of self-control. Others offer the sense-objects – sound, form, taste, touch and smell – into the fire of the senses.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वाणीन्द्रियकर्माणि प्राणकर्माणि चापरे । आत्मसंयमयोगाग्नौ जुह्वति ज्ञानदीपिते ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: sarvāṇīndriya-karmāṇi prāṇa-karmāṇi cāpare ātma-saṁyama-yogāgnau juhvati jñāna-dīpite
verses.translation: Some offer all the functions of the senses and the functions of the life-airs into the fire of self-purification, which is ignited by knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: द्रव्ययज्ञास्तपोयज्ञा योगयज्ञास्तथापरे । स्वाध्यायज्ञानयज्ञाश्च यतयः संशितव्रताः ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: dravya-yajñās tapo-yajñā yoga-yajñās tathāpare svādhyāya jñāna-yajñāś ca yatayaḥ saṁśita-vratāḥ
verses.translation: Someyogīssacrifice their possessions through penances or through the practice ofyoga. Some undertake severe vows and strictly sacrifice through knowledge by studying theVedas.

verses.sanskrit: अपाने जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणेऽपानं तथापरे । प्राणापानगती रुद्ध्वा प्राणायामपरायणाः । अपरे नियताहाराः प्राणान्प्राणेषु जुह्वति ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration: apāne juhvati prāṇaṁ prāṇe’pānaṁ tathāpare prāṇāpāna-gatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāma-parāyaṇāḥ apare niyatāhārāḥ prāṇān prāṇeṣu juhvati
verses.translation: Others practice control of the life-airs by offering the in-going breath into the out-going breath and out-going breath into the in-going breath, and thus restrain both. Others offer their life-airs by controlling the intake of food.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषाः । यज्ञशिष्टामृत भुजो यान्ति ब्रह्मा सनातनम् ॥३०॥ नायं लोकोऽस्त्ययज्ञस्य कुतोऽन्यः कुरुसत्तम ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration: sarve’py-ete yajña-vido yajña-kṣapita-kalmaṣāḥ yajña-śiṣṭāmṛta-bhujo yānti brahma sanātanam nāyaṁ loko’sty-ayajñasya kuto’nyaḥ kuru-sattama
verses.translation: All of them are conversant with the principles of sacrifice. They have purged themselves of impiety by their performance of sacrifice. They are satisfied with the remnants of sacrifice and thus they attain the eternal Absolute Truth. O best of the Kuru Dynasty, for one that never performs sacrifice, even the pleasures of this world are denied – then what to say of the next life?

verses.sanskrit: एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे । कर्मजान्विद्धि तान्सर्वानेवं ज्ञात्वा विमोक्ष्यसे ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration: evaṁ bahu-vidhā yajñā vitatā brahmaṇo mukhe karma-jān-viddhi tān sarvān evaṁ jñātvā vimokṣyase
verses.translation: In this way, many varieties of sacrifices have been explained in theVedas. You should understand that all of them are born of action. Knowing this, you shall be liberated.

verses.sanskrit: श्रेयान्द्रव्यमयाद्यज्ञाज्ज्ञानयज्ञः परन्तप । सर्वं कर्माखिलं पार्थ ज्ञाने परिसमाप्यते ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration: śreyān dravyamayād yajñāj jñāna-yajñaḥ parantapa sarvaṁ karmākhilaṁ pārtha jñāne parisamāpyate
verses.translation: O conqueror of the enemy, the sacrifice involving knowledge is higher than the sacrifice of material ingredients. All actions culminate in knowledge, O Pārtha.

verses.sanskrit: तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया । उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration: tad viddhi praṇipātena paripraśnena sevayā upadekṣyanti te jñānaṁ jñāninas tattva-darśinaḥ
verses.translation: Just try to understand this knowledge by approaching a self-realised person who has seen the truth. Make submissive inquiry and render service unto him. Thetattva-darśī, the seer of the truth, will instruct you and give you initiation into this sacred path.
