verses.sanskrit: यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहमेवं यास्यसि पाण्डव । येन भूतान्यशेषेण द्रक्ष्यस्यात्मन्यथो मयि ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration: yaj-jñātvā na punar moham evaṁ yāsyasi pāṇḍava yena bhūtāny-aśeṣāṇi drakṣyasy-ātmany-atho mayi
verses.translation: O son of Pāṇḍu, understanding this knowledge you will never be subject to illusion again. Through this knowledge you will see the spiritual nature of all living beings and that they are all situated within Me.

verses.sanskrit: अपि चेदसि पापेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यः पापकृत्तमः । सर्वं ज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं सन्तरिष्यसि ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration: api ced asi pāpebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pāpa-kṛttamaḥ sarvaṁ jñāna-plavenaiva vṛjinaṁ santariṣyasi
verses.translation: Even if you are most impious, you can cross over the ocean of all vices by boarding the boat of wisdom.

verses.sanskrit: यथैधांसि समिद्धोऽग्निर्भस्मसात्कुरुतेऽर्जुन । ज्ञानाग्निः सर्वकर्माणि भस्मसात्कुरुते तथा ॥३७॥
verses.transliteration: yathaidhāṁsi samiddho’gnir bhasmasāt kurute’rjuna jñānāgniḥ sarva-karmāṇi bhasmasāt kurute tathā
verses.translation: As a blazing fire turns wood into ashes, similarly the fire of wisdom renders allkarmato cinders, O Arjuna.

verses.sanskrit: न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते । तत्स्वयं योगसंसिद्धः कालेनात्मनि विन्दति ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration: na hi jñānena sadṛśaṁ pavitram iha vidyate tat svayaṁ yoga-saṁsiddhaḥ kālenātmani vindati
verses.translation: There is nothing as pure as knowledge in this world. In due course, one who is perfect inyogarealises this.

verses.sanskrit: श्रद्धावाँल्लभते ज्ञानं तत्परः संयतेन्द्रियः । ज्ञानं लब्ध्वा परां शान्तिमचिरेणाधिगच्छति ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration: śraddhāvāl labhate jñānaṁ tat-paraḥ saṁyatendriyaḥ jñānaṁ labdhvā parāṁ śāntim acireṇādhigacchati
verses.translation: Those imbued with faith and who are devoted to controlling their senses attain this knowledge very swiftly. Thus they attain supreme peace.

verses.sanskrit: अज्ञश्चाश्रद्दधानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति । नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration: ajñaś cāśraddadhānaś ca saṁśayātmā vinaśyati nāyaṁ loko’sti na paro na sukhaṁ saṁśayātmanaḥ
verses.translation: Those who are deluded, without faith and full of doubt are ruined. Such faithless people find no happiness in this world or the next.

verses.sanskrit: योगसंन्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसञ्छिन्नसंशयम् । आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration: yoga-sannyasta-karmāṇaṁ jñāna-sañchinna-saṁśayam ātma-vantaṁ na karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya
verses.translation: O Dhanañjaya,karmacannot bind one who has renounced action through the process ofyoga. His doubts are overcome by knowledge and he has thus realised the nature of the self.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मादज्ञानसम्भूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मनः । छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration: tasmād ajñāna sambhūtaṁ hṛt-sthaṁ jñānāsinātmanaḥ chittvainaṁ saṁśayaṁ yogam ātiṣṭhottiṣṭha bhārata
verses.translation: Therefore, O Bhārata, with the sword of knowledge slash these doubts of yours that have arisen out of ignorance within your heart. Taking shelter of the process ofyoga, stand and fight!

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 5 Karma Sannyasa Yoga The Yoga Of The Renunciation Of Action

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि । यच्छ्रेय एतयोरेकं तन्मे ब्रूहि सुनिश्चितम् ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – sannyāsaṁ karmaṇāṁ kṛṣṇa punar yogaṁ ca śaṁsasi yacchreya etayor ekaṁ tan me brūhi suniśchitam
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Kṛṣṇa, You talk of the renunciation of action (sannyāsa) but then again, You also speak ofkarma-yoga(the way of selfless action). Please tell me clearly, which of the two is best?

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । संन्यासः कर्मयोगश्च निःश्रेयसकरावुभौ । तयोस्तु कर्मसंन्यासात्कर्मयोगो विशिष्यते ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – sannyāsaḥ karma-yogaś ca niḥśreyasa karāv-ubhau tayos tu karma-sannyāsāt karma-yogo viśiṣyate
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa replied: Both renunciation of action (sannyāsa) and the performance of selfless action (karma-yoga) give the highest benefit. Yet, of the two, the path of selfless action is higher than the renunciation of action.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ्क्षति । निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: jñeyaḥ sa nitya-sannyāsī yo na dveṣṭi na kāṅkṣati nirdvandvo hi mahā-bāho sukhaṁ bandhāt pramucyate
verses.translation: O mighty-armed one, you should understand that one who is free of hatred and material desires is a true renunciate (sannyāsī). He is beyond duality and is easily liberated from material bondage.

verses.sanskrit: सां‍ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बालाः प्रवदन्ति न पण्डिताः । एकमप्यास्थितः सम्यगुभयोर्विन्दते फलम् ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: sāṅkhya-yogau pṛthag bālāḥ pravadanti na paṇḍitāḥ ekam apy-āsthitaḥ samyag ubhayor vindate phalam
verses.translation: Those who are immature and devoid of knowledge state that the path of renunciation and the path ofkarma-yogaare different. However, one who follows either of these paths perfectly achieves the results of both.

verses.sanskrit: यत्सां‍ख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते । एकं सां‍ख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: yat sāṅkhyaiḥ prāpyate sthānaṁ tad yogair api gamyate ekaṁ sāṅkhyaṁ ca yogaṁ ca yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati
verses.translation: That state which is achieved by renunciation is also attained bykarma-yoga. One who sees these two systems as one and the same actually sees things as they are.

verses.sanskrit: संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः । योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म नचिरेणाधिगच्छति ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: sannyāsas tu mahā-bāho duḥkham āptum ayogataḥ yoga-yukto munir brahma na cireṇādhigacchati
verses.translation: O mighty-armed one, withoutkarma-yoga,renunciation is a cause for misery. However, that wise man that performskarma-yogaquickly attains the Absolute Truth.

verses.sanskrit: योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः । सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: yoga-yukto viśuddhātmā vijitātmā jitendriyaḥ sarva-bhūtātmabhūtātmā kurvann-api na lipyate
verses.translation: One who is pure engages inkarma-yogaand controls the mind and senses. Although he engages in action, he is never contaminated and he is filled with love for all living beings.

verses.sanskrit: नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित् । पश्यञ्शृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपञ्श्वसन् ॥८॥ प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्णन्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि । इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन् ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: naiva kiñcit karomīti yukto manyeta tattva-vit paśyañ śṛṇvan spṛśañ jighrann aśnan gacchan svapan śvasan pralapan visṛjan gṛhṇann unmiṣan nimiṣann api indriyāṇīndriyārtheṣu vartanta iti dhārayan
verses.translation: One who is a knower of the truth, although he is engaged in seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, moving, sleeping, breathing, talking, evacuating, accepting objects and blinking the eyes, realises that all his sense-functions are interacting with the respective sense-objects. Therefore, he thinks, “I am not doing anything.”

verses.sanskrit: ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः । लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇy-ādhāya karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā karoti yaḥ lipyate na sa pāpena padma-patram ivāmbhasā
verses.translation: One who gives up all attachments and acts by offering all his actions unto the Supreme is never contaminated by any impiety, just as a lotus leaf is never touched by water.

verses.sanskrit: कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि । योगिनः कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वात्मशुद्धये ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: kāyena manasā buddhyā kevalair indriyair api yoginaḥ karma kurvanti saṅgaṁ tyaktvātma śuddhaye
verses.translation: By giving up all attachments, thekarma-yogīperforms actions through the medium of the body, mind, intelligence and senses simply for the purpose of self-purification.

verses.sanskrit: युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकीम् । अयुक्तः कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: yuktaḥ karma-phalaṁ tyaktvā śāntim āpnoti naiṣṭhikīm ayuktaḥ kāma-kāreṇa phale sakto nibadhyate
verses.translation: Thekarma-yogī,giving up the results of his actions, attains everlasting peace. However, the selfish worker being attached, desires the results of his actions and therefore becomes ensnared.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी । नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-karmāṇi manasā sannyasyāste sukhaṁ vaśī nava-dvāre pure dehī naiva kurvan na kārayan
verses.translation: By mentally renouncing all actions, a sense-controlled living being can happily reside within the material body, neither acting nor causing others to act.

verses.sanskrit: न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः । न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: na kartṛtvaṁ na karmāṇi lokasya sṛjati prabhuḥ na karma-phala-saṁyogaṁ svabhāvas tu pravartate
verses.translation: The Absolute Truth does not create anyone’s sense of proprietorship, one’s actions or the result of those actions. All this is enacted by the modes of material nature.

verses.sanskrit: नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः । अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तवः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: nādatte kasyacit pāpaṁ na caiva sukṛtaṁ vibhuḥ ajñānenāvṛtaṁ jñānaṁ tena muhyanti jantavaḥ
verses.translation: The Super Consciousness does not accept anyone’s pious deeds or their impious deeds. Living beings are bewildered because their knowledge is covered by ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः । तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम् ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: jñānena tu tad ajñānaṁ yeṣāṁ nāśitam ātmanaḥ teṣām ādityavaj jñānaṁ prakāśayati tat param
verses.translation: Yet for those whose ignorance has been destroyed by knowledge of the self, their knowledge, like the rising sun, reveals the Supreme Truth.

verses.sanskrit: तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः । गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: tad buddhayas tad-ātmānas tan-niṣṭhās tat-parāyaṇāḥ gacchanty-apunar-āvṛttiṁ jñāna-nirdhūta-kalmaṣāḥ
verses.translation: Those whose ignorance has been removed by knowledge, whose intelligence is absorbed in the Supreme, who contemplate the Supreme, who are fixed in Him alone and who sing His glories, never take birth again.

verses.sanskrit: विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि । शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: vidyā-vinaya-sampanne brāhmaṇe gavi hastini śuni caiva śvapāke ca paṇḍitāḥ sama-darśinaḥ
verses.translation: A wise man sees a learned and humblebrāhmaṇa, a cow, an elephant, a dog, a lowborn person and all other living beings as equal.

verses.sanskrit: इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः । निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद् ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: ihaiva tair jitaḥ sargo yeṣāṁ sāmye sthitaṁ manaḥ nirdoṣaṁ hi samaṁ brahma tasmād brahmaṇi te sthitāḥ
verses.translation: The cycle of birth and death has been conquered by those whose minds are fixed in meditating on the Absolute Truth, even while living in this world. Being faultless and possessing divine equanimity, they are situated in the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् । स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद् ब्रह्मणि स्थितः ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: na prahṛṣyet priyaṁ prāpya nodvijet prāpya cāpriyam sthira-buddhir asammūḍho brahma-vid brahmaṇi sthitaḥ
verses.translation: Being situated in the Absolute Truth, having fixed intelligence and being devoid of ignorance, one who knows the Supreme never rejoices when he attains pleasant things, nor laments upon obtaining unpleasant things.

verses.sanskrit: बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम् । स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: bāhya-sparśeṣv-asaktātmā vindaty-ātmani yat sukham sa brahma-yoga-yuktātmā sukham akṣayam aśnute
verses.translation: One whose mind is detached from external pleasures experiences the happiness found in the self. Connecting himself with the Absolute, he attains unlimited bliss.

verses.sanskrit: ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते । आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration: ye hi saṁsparśajā bhogā duḥkha-yonaya eva te ādy-antavantaḥ kaunteya na teṣu ramate budhaḥ
verses.translation: Those pleasures that are born in connection with the sense-objects give rise to misery. They have a beginning and an end. Therefore, O son of Kuntī, a wise man finds no satisfaction in the senses and sense-objects.

verses.sanskrit: शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात् । कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: śaknotīhaiva yaḥ soḍhuṁ prāk śarīra-vimokṣaṇāt kāma-krodhodbhavaṁ vegaṁ sa yuktaḥ sa sukhī naraḥ
verses.translation: Before giving up this present body, if one is able to control the senses and the impulses that arise from lust and anger, one becomes self-satisfied. Such a person is a trueyogī.

verses.sanskrit: योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव यः । स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: yo’ntaḥ-sukho’ntarārāmas tathāntar jyotireva yaḥ sa yogī brahma-nirvāṇaṁ brahma-bhūto’dhigacchati
verses.translation: One who finds happiness and bliss within and who is enlightened within is a perfectyogī. He attains the transcendental platform and achieves liberation.

verses.sanskrit: लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः । छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: labhante brahma-nirvāṇam ṛṣayaḥ kṣīṇa-kalmaṣāḥ chinna-dvaidhā yatātmānaḥ sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ
verses.translation: Yogīswho are free from vice, self-controlled, whose doubts have been removed and who are engaged in welfare work for all living beings, attain liberation in the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: कामक्रोधविमुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् । अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम् ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: kāma-krodha-vimuktānāṁ yatīnāṁ yata-cetasām abhito brahma-nirvāṇaṁ vartate viditātmanām
verses.translation: Thosesannyāsīswho constantly endeavour for perfection, who have controlled their minds, who are self-realised and who are free from lust and anger, soon achieve liberation in the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैवान्तरे भ्रुवोः । प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ ॥२७॥ यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायणः । विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: sparśān kṛtvā bahir bāhyāṁś cakṣuś caivāntare bhruvoḥ prāṇāpānau samau kṛtvā nāsābhyantara-cāriṇau yatendriya-mano-buddhir munir mokṣa-parāyaṇaḥ vigatecchā-bhaya-krodho yaḥ sadā mukta eva saḥ
verses.translation: Theyogīwho shuts out the external sense-objects and fixes his concentration between the eyebrows, stabilising the inward and outward breaths that flow through the nostrils and thus controls the senses, the mind and intelligence, is dedicated to the attainment of liberation. He is never bound by desires stemming from lust, fear and anger and is certainly always liberated.

verses.sanskrit: भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् । सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration: bhoktāraṁ yajña-tapasāṁ sarva-loka-maheśvaram suhṛdaṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ jñātvā māṁ śāntim ṛcchati
verses.translation: One attains peace by knowing Me to be the original enjoyer of all sacrifices and austerities, the Supreme Controller of all the planets, and the benefactor and friend of all living beings.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 6 Dhyana Yoga The Yoga Of Meditation

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः । स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – anāśritaḥ karma-phalaṁ kāryan karma karoti yaḥ sa sannyāsī ca yogī ca na niragnir na cākriyaḥ
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: One who performs his prescribed duties and renounces the results of those actions is ayogīand asannyāsī. One does not become asannyāsīsimply by rejecting the performance of sacrifice and performing no activities.

verses.sanskrit: यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव । न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: yaṁ sannyāsam iti prāhur yogaṁ taṁ viddhi pāṇḍava na hy-asannyasta-saṅkalpo yogī bhavati kaścana
verses.translation: O son of Pāṇḍu, that which is known assannyāsais the same asyoga. One can never become ayogīwithout renouncing the desire to satisfy the senses.

verses.sanskrit: आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते । योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: ārurukṣor muner yogaṁ karma kāraṇam ucyate yogārūḍhasya tasyaiva śamaḥ kāraṇam ucyate
verses.translation: For one who is a beginner on the path ofyoga, action is the means. For one who is already practiced inyoga, the renunciation of action is the means.

verses.sanskrit: यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते । सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: yadā hi nendriyārtheṣu na karmasv-anuṣajjate sarva-saṅkalpa-sannyāsī yogārūḍhas tadocyate
verses.translation: When one is neither attached to the sense-objects nor to the activities that lead to their enjoyment, at that time one is said to have attainedyoga.

verses.sanskrit: उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् । आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: uddhared ātmanātmānaṁ nātmānam avasādayet ātmaiva hy-ātmano bandhur ātmaiva ripur ātmanaḥ
verses.translation: Living beings must elevate themselves by the mind – they must not degrade themselves. Certainly, the mind is the friend of the living beings as well as their worst enemy.

verses.sanskrit: बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः । अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत् ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: bandhur ātmātmanas tasya yenātmaivātmanā jitaḥ anātmanastu śatrutve vartetātmaiva śatruvat
verses.translation: For one who has subdued the mind, the mind is a friend. However, for one who has not controlled the mind, the mind is the greatest enemy.

verses.sanskrit: जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः । शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: jitātmanaḥ praśāntasya paramātmā samāhitaḥ śītoṣṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣu tathā mānāpamānayoḥ
verses.translation: Those who have subdued the mind and are calm, attain realisation of Paramātmā (Super Consciousness). For such persons heat and cold, happiness and distress and honour and dishonour are all the same.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः । युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: jñāna-vijñāna-tṛptātmā kūṭastho vijitendriyaḥ yukta ityucyate yogī sama-loṣṭāśma-kāñcanaḥ
verses.translation: Theyogīwho is self-satisfied due to his knowledge and realisation, fixed in his spiritual nature and in control of his senses, sees dirt, stones and gold equally.

verses.sanskrit: सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु । साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: suhṛn-mitrāry-udāsīna-madhyastha-dveṣya-bandhuṣu sādhuṣ-vapi ca pāpeṣu sama-buddhir viśiṣyate
verses.translation: Such ayogīof impartial intelligence sees an honest well-wisher, an affectionate benefactor, an enemy, neutral persons, a mediator, the envious, a relative, the pious and the impious with equal vision.

verses.sanskrit: योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थितः । एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रहः ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: yogī yuñjīta satatam ātmānaṁ rahasi sthitaḥ ekākī yata-cittātmā nirāśīr aparigrahaḥ
verses.translation: Ayogīshould live in a solitary place with his mind and body fully controlled. He should be without desire, without a sense of possessiveness and must constantly fix his mind on theātmā, the self within.

verses.sanskrit: शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः । नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम् ॥११॥ तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः । उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: śucau deśe pratiṣṭhāpya sthiram āsanam ātmanaḥ nāty-ucchritaṁ nātinīcaṁ cailājina-kuśottaram tatraikāgraṁ manaḥ kṛtvā yata-cittendriya-kriyaḥ upaviśyāsane yuñjyād yogam ātma-viśuddhaye
verses.translation: Establishing a seat in a clean environment that is not too high or too low, ayogīshould cover his sitting place withkuśagrass, a deerskin and a cloth. Sitting on that seat, fixing his mind on one point and controlling all the activities of the mind and senses, he should practiceyogato purify himself.

verses.sanskrit: समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः । सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् ॥१३॥ प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः । मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: samaṁ kāya-śiro-grīvaṁ dhārayann acalaṁ sthiraḥ samprekṣya nāsikāgraṁ svaṁ diśaś cānavalokayan praśāntātmā vigata-bhīr brahmacāri-vrate sthitaḥ manaḥ saṁyamya mac-citto yukta āsīta mat-paraḥ
verses.translation: Holding the body, head and neck straight, he should remain still and steady, gazing at the tip of the nose without casting his glance in other directions. Undisturbed, fearless and observing a vow of celibacy, he should sit and control his mind by thinking of Me as his highest goal.

verses.sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः । शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī niyata-mānasaḥ śāntiṁ nirvāṇa-paramāṁ matsaṁsthām adhigacchati
verses.translation: In this way, theyogīcontrols his mind, withdrawing it from material desires. He then achieves supreme peace and liberation from material existence and attains My abode.

verses.sanskrit: नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः । न चातिस्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: nātyaśnata stu yogo’sti na caikāntam anaśnataḥ na cāti svapna-śīlasya jāgrato naiva cārjuna
verses.translation: One cannot practiceyogaby eating too much or too little, nor sleeping too much or too little, O Arjuna.

verses.sanskrit: युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु । युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: yuktāhāra-vihārasya yukta-ceṣṭasya karmasu yukta-svapnāvabodhasya yogo bhavati duḥkha-hā
verses.translation: Yogadestroys the suffering of one who is moderate in eating and sleeping, who performs all activities in a regulated manner and is well balanced in sleeping and waking.

verses.sanskrit: यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते । निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: yadā viniyataṁ cittam ātmany-evāvatiṣṭhate nispṛhaḥ sarva-kāmebhyo yukta ity-uchyate tadā
verses.translation: When the steady mind is fixed exclusively upon the self, then one becomes free from all material desires – such a person is said to be situated inyoga.

verses.sanskrit: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता । योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: yathā dīpo nivātastho neṅgate sopamā smṛtā yogino yata-cittasya yuñjato yogam ātmanaḥ
verses.translation: Just as a flame does not flicker in a windless place, similarly the mind of ayogīnever wavers in its concentration on the self.

verses.sanskrit: यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया । यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति ॥२०॥ सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद् बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् । वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः ॥२१॥ यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः । यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते ॥२२॥ तं विद्याद्दु:ख संयोगवियोगं योगसंज्ञितम् ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: yatroparamate cittaṁ niruddhaṁ yoga-sevayā yatra caivātmanātmānaṁ paśyann ātmani tuṣyati sukham ātyantikaṁ yat tad buddhi-grāhyam atīndriyam vetti yatra na caivāyaṁ sthitaś calati tattvataḥ yaṁ labdhvā cāparaṁ lābhaṁ manyate nādhikaṁ tataḥ yasmin sthito na duḥkhena guruṇāpi vicālyate taṁ vidyād duḥkha-saṁyoga-viyogaṁ yoga saṁjñitam sa niścayena yoktavyo yogo’nirviṇṇa-cetasā
verses.translation: When the mind is restrained and peaceful by the practice ofyoga, it becomes detached from material desires. Thus one can perceive the self and attain happiness. Being situated in this plane of eternal bliss, which is beyond the scope of the mundane senses and obtained through intelligence, one never deviates from reality. Upon gaining this position, one considers that there is nothing superior to this and does not become disturbed even in the midst of the greatest calamities. You should know that this state of being, wherein all miseries are destroyed, is known asyoga.

verses.sanskrit: स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा । सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः । मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: saṅkalpa-prabhavān kāmāṁs tyaktvā sarvān aśeṣataḥ manasaivendriya-grāmaṁ viniyamya samantataḥ
verses.translation: One should practiceyogawith determination and an unwavering mind. In order to practiceyoga, one must reject all thoughts that create material desires and withdraw the senses from the sense-objects using the mind.

verses.sanskrit: शनैः शनैरुपरमेद् बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया ।= आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: śanaiḥ śanair uparamed buddhyā dhṛti-gṛhītayā ātma-saṁsthaṁ manaḥ kṛtvā na kiñcid api cintayet
verses.translation: Gradually, one should still the mind by means of the intelligence, focusing it on the self and nothing else.

verses.sanskrit: यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् । ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत् ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: yato yato niścalati manaś cañcalam asthiram tatas tato niyamyaitad ātmany-eva vaśaṁ nayet
verses.translation: The nature of the mind is flickering and unsteady. However, one should always endeavour to control the mind from its wanderings and bring it back under the control of the higher self (ātmā).

verses.sanskrit: प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् । उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: praśānta-manasaṁ hy-enaṁ yoginaṁ sukham uttamam upaiti śānta-rajasaṁ brahma-bhūtam akalmaṣam
verses.translation: Supreme bliss comes to ayogīwho subdues his passions, whose mind is calm, who is free of vice and who is always situated on the spiritual plane.

verses.sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः । सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī vigata-kalmaṣaḥ sukhena brahma-saṁsparśam atyantaṁ sukham aśnute
verses.translation: In this way, through the constant practice ofyoga, ayogīwho is devoid of material contamination can attain eternal bliss through contact with the Absolute.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि । ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūta-stham ātmānaṁ sarva-bhūtāni cātmani īkṣate yoga-yuktātmā sarvatra sama-darśanaḥ
verses.translation: One who is connected to the Supreme sees all things equally and perceives the Supreme in all living beings and all beings within the Supreme.

verses.sanskrit: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति । तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration: yo māṁ paśyati sarvatra sarvaṁ ca mayi paśyati tasyāhaṁ na praṇaśyāmi sa ca me na praṇaśyati
verses.translation: For one who sees Me in all things and sees everything within Me, I am never lost and they are never lost to Me.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः । सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūta-sthitaṁ yo māṁ bhajaty-ekatvam āsthitaḥ sarvathā vartamāno’pi sa yogī mayi vartate
verses.translation: Thatyogīwho venerates Me, with the knowledge that I am situated in all living beings (as the Super Consciousness), abides in Me in all circumstances.

verses.sanskrit: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन । सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration: ātmaupamyena sarvatra samaṁ paśyati yo’rjuna sukhaṁ vā yadi vā duḥkhaṁ sa yogī paramo mataḥ
verses.translation: O Arjuna, one who regards the happiness and distress of all others equally, as if it were their own, is considered the best ofyogīs.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन । एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम् ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – yo’yaṁ yogas tvayā proktaḥ sāmyena madhusūdana etasyāhaṁ na paśyāmi cañcalatvāt sthitiṁ sthirām
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Madhusūdana, I cannot conceive of this system ofyogathat You have described because by nature the mind is very unsteady.

verses.sanskrit: चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद् दृढम् । तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम् ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration: cañcalaṁ hi manaḥ kṛṣṇa pramāthi balavad dṛḍham tasyāhaṁ nigrahaṁ manye vāyor iva suduṣkaram
verses.translation: The mind is erratic, disturbed, very powerful and stubborn. O Kṛṣṇa, I think that to control it is as difficult as trying to control the wind.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् । अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – asaṁśayaṁ mahā-bāho mano durnigrahaṁ calam abhyāsena tu kaunteya vairāgyeṇa ca gṛhyate
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa replied: O mighty-armed one, indeed the mind is unsteady and very difficult to control. However, it is possible to control the mind by practice and detachment, O son of Kuntī.

verses.sanskrit: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः । वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration: asaṁyatātmanā yogo duṣprāpa iti me matiḥ vaśyātmanā tu yatatā śakyo’vāptum upāyataḥ
verses.translation: My conclusion is thatyogais difficult to attain if one’s mind is uncontrolled. But one who endeavours to control the mind by the proper practice can be successful.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः । अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति ॥३७॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – ayatiḥ śraddhayopeto yogāc calita-mānasaḥ aprāpya yoga-saṁsiddhiṁ kāṁ gatiṁ kṛṣṇa gacchati
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Kṛṣṇa, what is the destination of a person who has faith but cannot control his mind by the process ofyogaand does not attain perfection?

verses.sanskrit: कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति । अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration: kaccin nobhaya-vibhraṣṭaś chhinnābhram iva naśyati apratiṣṭho mahā-bāho vimūḍho brahmaṇaḥ pathi
verses.translation: O mighty-armed Kṛṣṇa, does such a person, being both confused on the spiritual path and having no shelter, become lost like a scattered cloud?

verses.sanskrit: एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः । त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration: etan me saṁśayaṁ kṛṣṇa chettum arhasy-aśeṣataḥ tvad-anyaḥ saṁśayasyāsya chettā na hy-upapadyate
verses.translation: O Kṛṣṇa, only You can completely remove these doubts of mine and no one else.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते । न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद् दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – pārtha naiveha nāmutra vināśas tasya vidyate na hi kalyāṇa-kṛt kaścid durgatiṁ tāta gacchati
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa replied: O Pārtha, such a person does not meet with destruction, either in this world or the next. One who performs acts of virtue never suffers misfortune.

verses.sanskrit: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः । शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration: prāpya puṇya-kṛtāṁ lokān uṣitvā śāśvatīḥ samāḥ śucīnāṁ śrīmatāṁ gehe yoga-bhraṣṭo’bhijāyate
verses.translation: One who falls from the practice ofyogaattains the celestial planets of the pious and dwells there for many years. Thereafter, they take birth amongst humans in a noble and prosperous family.

verses.sanskrit: अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् । एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration: athavā yoginām eva kule bhavati dhīmatām etaddhi durlabhataraṁ loke janma yad īdṛśam
verses.translation: Otherwise they may be born into a learned family ofyogīs. Certainly such a birth is rarely achieved in this world.

verses.sanskrit: तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् । यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन ॥४३॥
verses.transliteration: tatra taṁ buddhi-saṁyogaṁ labhate paurva-dehikam yatate ca tato bhūyaḥ saṁsiddhau kuru-nandana
verses.translation: O descendant of Kuru, regaining their knowledge ofyogafrom previous births, they again endeavour to attain success.

verses.sanskrit: पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः । जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते ॥४४॥
verses.transliteration: pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hy-avaśo’pi saḥ jijñāsur api yogasya śabda-brahmātivartate
verses.translation: Due to the practices of their previous life, they are automatically attracted to theyogaprocess. Simply by inquiring about this system ofyoga,one transcends the rituals of theVedas.

verses.sanskrit: प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः । अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥४५॥
verses.transliteration: prayatnād yatamānas tu yogī saṁśuddha-kilbiṣaḥ aneka-janma-saṁsiddhas tato yāti parāṁ gatim
verses.translation: By sincere endeavour, theyogīis then purified of all contamination and achieves perfection after many lifetimes – he attains the Supreme Destination.

verses.sanskrit: तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः । कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन ॥४६॥
verses.transliteration: tapasvibhyo’dhiko yogī jñānibhyo’pi mato’dhikaḥ karmibhyaś cādhiko yogī tasmād yogī bhavārjuna
verses.translation: Such ayogīis superior to thetapasvī(one who performs severe penances), thejñānī(one who tries to achieve the Absolute by intellectual pursuits) and thekarmī(one who tries to attain salvation by performing Vedic rituals). This is My conclusion, O Arjuna – therefore become ayogī!

verses.sanskrit: योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना । श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः ॥४७॥
verses.transliteration: yoginām api sarveṣāṁ mad gatenāntarātmanā śraddhāvān bhajate yo māṁ sa me yuktatamo mataḥ
verses.translation: I consider the best of allyogīsto be thebhakti-yogīwho abides in Me, who meditates upon Me and who worships Me with firm faith.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 7 Jnana Vijnana Yoga The Yoga Of Knowledge And Realisation

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः । असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – mayy-āsakta-manāḥ pārtha yogaṁ yuñjan mad-āśrayaḥ asaṁśayaṁ samagraṁ māṁ yathā jñāsyasi tac chṛṇu
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: O Pārtha, please listen – when the mind is attached to Me and one practicesyogaand takes full shelter of Me, then you will certainly be able to know Me.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः । यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: jñānaṁ te’haṁ sa-vijñānam idaṁ vakṣyāmy-aśeṣataḥ yaj-jñātvā neha bhūyo’nyaj jñātavyam avaśiṣyate
verses.translation: I will explain to you this knowledge and its realisation. Once you understand this, there is nothing else in this world that remains to be known.

verses.sanskrit: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये । यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: manuṣyāṇāṁ sahasreṣu kaścid yatati siddhaye yatatām api siddhānāṁ kaścin māṁ vetti tattvataḥ
verses.translation: Amongst thousands of men, one may try to achieve perfection. Amongst those rare persons that endeavour for perfection, one may actually know Me.

verses.sanskrit: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च । अहंकार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: bhūmir āpo’nalo vāyuḥ khaṁ mano buddhireva ca ahaṅkāra itīyaṁ me bhinnā prakṛtir aṣṭadhā
verses.translation: Earth, water, fire, air, space, mind, intelligence and false ego – these are the eight different elements that constitute My material nature.

verses.sanskrit: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् । जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: apareyam itas tvanyāṁ prakṛtiṁ viddhi me parām jīva-bhūtāṁ mahā-bāho yayedaṁ dhāryate jagat
verses.translation: However, you should know that there is another nature, superior to this inferior nature. It is a conscious potency that consists of the living beings and maintains the universe.

verses.sanskrit: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय । अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: etad yonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇīty-upadhāraya ahaṁ kṛtsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayas tathā
verses.translation: Try to understand that all beings are manifest from these two sources and that I am the cause of the creation and annihilation of the entire universe.

verses.sanskrit: मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय । मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: mattaḥ parataraṁ nānyat kiñcid asti dhanañjaya mayi sarvam idaṁ protaṁ sūtre maṇi-gaṇā iva
verses.translation: Dhanañjaya, there is nothing superior to Me. All things rest upon Me, just like jewels strung upon a thread.

verses.sanskrit: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः । प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: raso’ham apsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śaśi-sūryayoḥ praṇavaḥ sarva-vedeṣu śabdaḥ khe pauruṣaṁ nṛṣu
verses.translation: I am the taste of water and the light of the sun and the moon, O son of Kuntī. I am the syllable‘oṁ’found in all theVedas, I am the sound in space and I am the masculinity in man.

verses.sanskrit: पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ । जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛthivyāṁ ca tejaś cāsmi vibhāvasau jīvanaṁ sarva-bhūteṣu tapaś cāsmi tapasviṣu
verses.translation: I am the original scent of the earth, I am the lustre of fire. I am the life of all creatures and the penances of the performers of austerities.

verses.sanskrit: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् । बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: bījaṁ māṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ viddhi pārtha sanātanam buddhir buddhimatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham
verses.translation: O Pārtha, know that I am the original cause of all living beings. I am the wisdom of the wise and I am the power of the powerful.

verses.sanskrit: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् । धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: balaṁ balavatāṁ cāhaṁ kāma-rāga-vivarjitam dharmāviruddho bhūteṣu kāmo’smi bharatarṣabha
verses.translation: I am the might of the mighty which is devoid of passion and attachment. I am the desire to procreate which does not violate the principles ofdharma.

verses.sanskrit: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये । मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: ye caiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasās tāmasāś ca ye matta eveti tān viddhi na tvahaṁ teṣu te mayi
verses.translation: Also, know that all things generated by the modes of goodness, passion and ignorance originate from Me alone. However, I am not in them but they are in Me.

verses.sanskrit: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत् । मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: tribhir guṇamayair bhāvair ebhiḥ sarvam idaṁ jagat mohitaṁ nābhijānāti mām ebhyaḥ param-avyayam
verses.translation: The whole world is bewildered by these three modes of nature. Thus, no one can understand Me because I am superior to these modes and unchanging.

verses.sanskrit: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया । मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: daivī hy-eṣā guṇamayī mama māyā duratyayā māmeva ye prapadyante māyām etāṁ taranti te
verses.translation: This divine potency of Mine which consists of the three modes of material nature is extremely difficult to defeat. Yet those that take shelter of Me can cross beyond it.

verses.sanskrit: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः । माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: na māṁ duṣkṛtino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ māyayāpahṛta jñānā āsuraṁ bhāvam āśritāḥ
verses.translation: The foolish, the lowest of men, those whose knowledge is covered by illusion and those who take shelter of impious activities – such unrighteous persons never surrender to Me.

verses.sanskrit: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन । आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: catur-vidhā bhajante māṁ janāḥ sukṛtino’rjuna ārto jijñāsur arthārthī jñānī ca bharatarṣabha
verses.translation: O descendant of Bharata, there are four kinds of persons who are fortunate enough to worship Me – those who are in distress, the inquisitive, those that seek wealth and those that desire self-realisation.

verses.sanskrit: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते । प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: teṣāṁ jñānī nitya-yukta eka-bhaktir viśiṣyate priyo hi jñānino’tyartham ahaṁ sa ca mama priyaḥ
verses.translation: Of these, one who desires self-realisation is superior. He is always absorbed in thoughts of Me and engaged inbhakti-yoga. I am very dear to him and he is very dear to Me.

verses.sanskrit: उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् । आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tvātmaiva me matam āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā mām evānuttamāṁ gatim
verses.translation: Certainly all of them are virtuous, yet I regard the self-realised devotee to be as My own Self because his mind is fully fixed upon Me as his ultimate goal.

verses.sanskrit: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते । वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: bahūnāṁ janmanām ante jñānavān māṁ prapadyate vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā sudurlabhaḥ
verses.translation: After many births, one who possesses knowledge surrenders unto Me. He realises that Vāsudeva is the source of everything. Such a great personality is very rare.

verses.sanskrit: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः । तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: kāmais tais tair hṛta-jñānāḥ prapadyante’nya-devatāḥ taṁ taṁ niyamam āsthāya prakṛtyā niyatāḥ svayā
verses.translation: Those whose intelligence has been lost to various material desires take shelter in other gods. Swayed by their natures they perform various rituals.

verses.sanskrit: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति । तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: yo yo yāṁ yāṁ tanuṁ bhaktaḥ śraddhayārchitum icchati tasya tasyācalāṁ śraddhāṁ tām eva vidadhāmy-aham
verses.translation: Whatever form of the demigods a man desires to worship with faith, I make his faith strong in that particular form.

verses.sanskrit: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते । लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration: sa tayā śraddhayā yuktas tasyārādhanam īhate labhate ca tataḥ kāmān mayaiva vihitān hi tān
verses.translation: One who worships that particular form with faith, only attains the fulfilment of his desires due to My sanction alone.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् । देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: antavat tu phalaṁ teṣāṁ tad bhavaty-alpa-medhasām devān deva-yajo yānti mad bhaktā yānti mām api
verses.translation: However, the results achieved by such persons of little intelligence are temporary. Those who worship the demigods reach them, but My devotees attain Me.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः । परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम् ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: avyaktaṁ vyaktim āpannaṁ manyante mām abuddhayaḥ paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mamāvyayam anuttamam
verses.translation: My nature is eternal, supreme and imperishable. Yet less intelligent persons cannot comprehend this and consider Me to be the impersonal that has now accepted a material form.

verses.sanskrit: नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः । मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: nāhaṁ prakāśaḥ sarvasya yoga-māyā-samāvṛtaḥ mūḍho’yaṁ nābhijānāti loko mām ajam avyayam
verses.translation: I do not manifest Myself to everyone. I am hidden by Myyoga-māyāpotency and thus the foolish cannot recognise Me as eternal and unborn.

verses.sanskrit: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन । भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: vedāhaṁ samatītāni vartamānāni cārjuna bhaviṣyāṇi ca bhūtāni māṁ tu veda na kaścana
verses.translation: O Arjuna, I know past, present and future. I know all living beings, but they do not know Me.

verses.sanskrit: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत । सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: icchā-dveṣa samutthena dvandva-mohena bhārata sarva-bhūtāni saṁmohaṁ sarge yānti parantapa
verses.translation: O conqueror of the enemy, at the beginning of creation, all living beings are born bewildered by the dualities of desire and hatred.

verses.sanskrit: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् । ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: yeṣāṁ tvanta-gataṁ pāpaṁ janānāṁ puṇya-karmaṇām te dvandva-moha-nirmuktā bhajante māṁ dṛḍha-vratāḥ
verses.translation: Yet those that perform pious activities become purified of all reactions – they become free from the illusion of duality and worship Me with dedication.

verses.sanskrit: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये । ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration: jarā-maraṇa-mokṣāya mām āśritya yatanti ye te brahma tad viduḥ kṛtsnam adhyātmaṁ karma cākhilam
verses.translation: Those that strive to become free from old age and death by taking shelter of Me know the Absolute Truth, the individual self and the laws of action and reaction.

verses.sanskrit: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः । प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration: sādhibhūtādhidaivaṁ māṁ sādhiyajñaṁ ca ye viduḥ prayāṇa-kāle’pi ca māṁ te vidur yukta-cetasaḥ
verses.translation: Those who know Me to be the Controller of matter, the Controller of the demigods and the recipient of all sacrifices – with their minds concentrated upon Me, they will know Me at the time of death.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 8 Taraka Brahma Yoga The Yoga Of The Supreme

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच किं तद् ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम । अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते ॥१॥ अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन । प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – kiṁ tad-brahma kim adhyātmaṁ kiṁ karma puruṣottama adhibhūtaṁ ca kiṁ proktam adhidaivaṁ kim ucyate adhiyajñaḥ kathaṁ ko’tra dehe’smin madhusūdana prayāṇa-kāle ca kathaṁ jñeyo’si niyatātmabhiḥ
verses.translation: Arjuna inquired: O Puruṣottama (Supreme Person), what is Brahman? What is the self? What iskarma? What is action? What is this material manifestation? Who are the demigods? Who is the object of sacrifice and how does He dwell within the body? O Madhusūdana, how can You be known by those who are self-controlled at the time of death?

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते । भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – akṣaraṁ brahma paramaṁ svabhāvo’dhyātmam ucyate bhūta-bhāvodbhava karo visargaḥ karma-saṁjñitaḥ
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa replied: It is said that Brahman is the imperishable Supreme, and theātmāis the original spiritual nature of the living being.Karmais that which produces birth, duration of life and death.

verses.sanskrit: अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् । अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: adhibhūtaṁ kṣaro bhāvaḥ puruṣaś cādhidaivatam adhiyajño’ham evātra dehe deha-bhṛtāṁ vara
verses.translation: This material manifestation is defined as constantly changing and this material universe is the cosmic form of the Supreme Person. I am the object of all sacrifices, situated in all living beings.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् । यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: anta-kāle ca mām eva smaran muktvā kalevaram yaḥ prayāti sa mad-bhāvaṁ yāti nāsty-atra saṁśayaḥ
verses.translation: At the time of death, one who leaves the body specifically remembering Me attains My nature – of this there is no doubt.

verses.sanskrit: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् । तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: yaṁ yaṁ vāpi smaran bhāvaṁ tyajaty-ante kalevaram taṁ tam evaiti kaunteya sadā tad-bhāva-bhāvitaḥ
verses.translation: O son of Kuntī, whatever state of being one remembers at the time of death, one certainly attains to that nature.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च । मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयः ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: tasmāt sarveṣu kāleṣu mām anusmara yudhya ca mayy-arpita-mano buddhir mām evaiṣyasy-asaṁśayaḥ
verses.translation: Therefore, always remember Me and fight! Surrender your mind and intelligence to Me and you will surely attain Me.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना । परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: abhyāsa-yoga-yuktena cetasā nānya-gāminā paramaṁ puruṣaṁ divyaṁ yāti pārthānucintayan
verses.translation: O Pārtha, one who practicesyogaand focuses his mind, without straying from the path, and meditates upon the Divine Supreme Person, certainly achieves Him.

verses.sanskrit: कविं पुराणमनुशासितार-मणोरणीयंसमनुस्मरेद्यः । सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूप-मादित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात् ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: kaviṁ purāṇam anuśāsitāram aṇor aṇīyāṁsam anusmared yaḥ sarvasya dhātāram acintya-rūpam āditya-varṇaṁ tamasaḥ parastāt
verses.translation: One should meditate upon the Supreme Person who is all-knowing, without beginning, the Supreme Controller, who is smaller than the atomic particle, yet who is the support of all things in the universe, whose form is inconceivable, who is radiant like the sun, and who is beyond material nature.

verses.sanskrit: प्रयाणकाले मनसाऽचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव । भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: prayāṇa-kāle manasā’calena bhaktyā yukto yoga-balena caiva bhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśya samyak sa taṁ paraṁ puruṣam upaiti divyam
verses.translation: At the time of death, one who remembers Him with a steady mind by drawing the life-airs between the eyebrows by dint of yogic power certainly reaches the Divine Supreme Person.

verses.sanskrit: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः । यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं संग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: yad akṣaraṁ veda-vido vadanti viśanti yad yatayo vīta-rāgāḥ yad icchanto brahmacaryaṁ caranti tat te padaṁ saṅgraheṇa pravakṣye
verses.translation: Great sages in the renounced order of life and scholars of theVedasaccept the vow of celibacy and utteroṁto enter into Brahman. I shall now explain this process to you.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च । मूध्न्या।र्धायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-dvārāṇi saṁyamya mano hṛdi-nirudhya ca mūrdhny-ādhāyātmanaḥ prāṇam āsthito yoga-dhāraṇām
verses.translation: One should control all the senses and concentrate the mind within the heart, fixing the life-airs between the eyebrows and fully absorbing oneself inyoga.

verses.sanskrit: ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् । यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: oṁ ity-ekākṣaraṁ brahma vyāharan mām anusmaran yaḥ prayāti tyajan dehaṁ sa yāti paramāṁ gatim
verses.translation: Thus, by chanting the great monosyllableoṁand remembering Me, when one leaves the material body, he will attain the Supreme Abode.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः । तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: ananya-cetāḥ satataṁ yo māṁ smarati nityaśaḥ tasyāhaṁ sulabhaḥ pārtha nitya-yuktasya yoginaḥ
verses.translation: O Pārtha, thatyogīwho is without deviation and constantly remembers Me alone, easily attains Me for he is always connected to Me.

verses.sanskrit: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् । नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: mām upetya punar janma duḥkhālayam aśāśvatam nāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṁsiddhiṁ paramāṁ gatāḥ
verses.translation: Those great personalities who have attained Me never take birth again in this temporary world of misery, for they have reached the highest destination.

verses.sanskrit: आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन । मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: ābrahma-bhuvanāl lokāḥ punar āvartino’rjuna mām upetya tu kaunteya punar janma na vidyate
verses.translation: O Arjuna, all planets up to the abode of Brahmā are places of birth and rebirth, but those who reach Me never take birth again.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद् ब्रह्मणो विदुः । रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: sahasra-yuga-paryantam aharyad brahmaṇo viduḥ rātriṁ yuga-sahasrāntāṁ te’ho-rātra-vido janāḥ
verses.translation: A day of Brahmā consists of one thousandyugasand his night also lasts for the same period.

verses.sanskrit: भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते । रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: avyaktād vyaktayaḥ sarvāḥ prabhavanty-ahar-āgame rātry-āgame pralīyante tatraivāvyakta-saṁjñake
verses.translation: At the beginning of Brahmā’s day, all things become manifest from the unmanifest state. When Brahmā’s night begins, again they all become unmanifest.

verses.sanskrit: भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते । रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: bhūta-grāmaḥ sa evāyaṁ bhūtvā bhūtvā pralīyate rātry-āgame’vaśaḥ pārtha prabhavaty-ahar-āgame
verses.translation: O Pārtha, all living beings repeatedly take birth again and again. When Brahmā’s night approaches they are absorbed into Me once more and with the arrival of Brahmā’s day they are born again.

verses.sanskrit: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः । यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: paras tasmāt tu bhāvo’nyo’vyakto’vyaktāt sanātanaḥ yaḥ sa sarveṣu bhūteṣu naśyatsu na vinaśyati
verses.translation: However, beyond this state is another unmanifest state that is eternal and cannot be destroyed when all other beings are annihilated.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम् । यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: avyakto’kṣara ity-uktas tam āhuḥ paramāṁ gatim yaṁ prāpya na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama
verses.translation: It is said to be unmanifest and eternal and is declared to be the ultimate destination, upon attaining which, one never returns. This is My Supreme Abode.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया ।= यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration: puruṣaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā labhyas tv-ananyayā yasyāntaḥ sthāni bhūtāni yena sarvam idaṁ tatam
verses.translation: O Pārtha, that Supreme Person, within whom all living beings are situated and who pervades the entire creation, can only be attained bybhakti-yoga.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः । प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: yatra kāle tv-anāvṛttim āvṛttiṁ caiva yoginaḥ prayātā yānti taṁ kālaṁ vakṣyāmi bharatarṣabha
verses.translation: O best of the descendants of Bharata, I shall now explain to you those times that theyogīsattain either liberation or rebirth at the moment of their departure.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् । तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: agnir-jyotir ahaḥ śuklaḥ ṣaṇ-māsā uttarāyaṇam tatra prayātā gacchanti brahma brahma-vido janāḥ
verses.translation: Those who know Brahman pass from this world on the path of fire and light, during the time of the waxing moon or during the six months when the sun traverses the northern hemisphere.

verses.sanskrit: धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् । तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: dhūmo rātris tathā kṛṣṇaḥ ṣaṇ-māsā dakṣiṇāyanam tatra cāndramasaṁ jyotir yogī prāpya nivartate
verses.translation: Departing on the path of darkness, during the night, during the waning moon or during the six months when the sun makes its course across the southern hemisphere – thatyogīattains the celestial lunar planet, but then returns.

verses.sanskrit: शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते । एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: śukla-kṛṣṇe gatī hy-ete jagataḥ śāśvate mate ekayā yāty-anāvṛttim anyayāvartate punaḥ
verses.translation: Both these paths of light and darkness are accepted as being permanent in this world. By one path, one does not return, by the other path, one returns.

verses.sanskrit: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन । तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: naite sṛtī pārtha jānan yogī muhyati kaścana tasmāt sarveṣu kāleṣu yoga-yukto bhavārjuna
verses.translation: Theyogīwho knows these two paths is never bewildered. Therefore, O Arjuna, at all times be fixed inyoga.

verses.sanskrit: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् । अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: vedeṣu yajñeṣu tapaḥsu caiva dāneṣu yat puṇya-phalaṁ pradiṣṭam atyeti tat sarvam idaṁ viditvā yogī paraṁ sthānam upaiti cādyam
verses.translation: Knowing this, ayogīsurpasses all kinds of pious results that are achieved through study of theVedas, by offering oblations in sacrifice, by penances and by philanthropy. Thatyogīreaches the eternal abode.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 9 Raja Guhya Yoga The Yoga Of The Greatest Secret

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे । ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – idaṁ tu te guhyatamaṁ pravakṣyāmy-anasūyave jñānaṁ vijñāna-sahitaṁ yaj jñātvā mokṣyase’śubhāt
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: Because you are not envious I shall now explain to you the greatest of all secrets. I shall explain this knowledge and its realisation, knowing which you shall become free from all inauspiciousness.

verses.sanskrit: राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् । प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम् ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: rāja-vidyā rāja-guhyaṁ pavitram idam uttamam pratyakṣāvagamaṁ dharmyaṁ susukhaṁ kartum avyayam
verses.translation: This is the greatest of all knowledge (rāja-vidyā) and the greatest of all secrets (rāja-guhya). It is most purifying and most excellent. This path ofdharmais directly perceived; it is simple to practice and imperishable.

verses.sanskrit: अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप । अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: aśraddadhānāḥ puruṣā dharmasyāsya parantapa aprāpya māṁ nivartante mṛtyu-saṁsāra-vartmani
verses.translation: O vanquisher of the enemy, those that lack faith in this path ofdharmacan never attain Me and are forced to be reborn in the continuous cycle of birth and death.

verses.sanskrit: मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना । मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: mayā tatam idaṁ sarvaṁ jagad avyakta-mūrtinā mat-sthāni sarva-bhūtāni na cāhaṁ teṣv-avasthitaḥ
verses.translation: I pervade the entire cosmos through My unmanifest form. All living beings are supported by Me, but I am not supported by them.

verses.sanskrit: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् । भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: na ca mat sthāni bhūtāni paśya me yogam aiśvaram bhūta-bhṛn na ca bhūta-stho mamātmā bhūta-bhāvanaḥ
verses.translation: Yet everything that is created does not rest in Me. Behold My divine powers! Although I am the origin of all living beings and I maintain them, I am not influenced by them nor by My material nature.

verses.sanskrit: यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान् । तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: yathākāśa-sthito nityaṁ vāyuḥ sarvatra-go mahān tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mat-sthānīty-upadhāraya
verses.translation: Try to understand that just as the mighty wind rests within the vast expanse of the sky, similarly all beings rest within Me.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् । कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-bhūtāni kaunteya prakṛtiṁ yānti māmikām kalpa-kṣaye punas tāni kalpādau visṛjāmy-aham
verses.translation: O son of Kuntī, at the end of a day of Brahmā, all living beings enter into Me. I manifest them again at the beginning of a new creation.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः । भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: prakṛtiṁ svām avaṣṭabhya visṛjāmi punaḥ punaḥ bhūta-grāmam imaṁ kṛtsnam avaśaṁ prakṛter vaśāt
verses.translation: Because I control material nature, I continuously manifest the living beings that are helplessly manipulated by their natures.

verses.sanskrit: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय । उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: na ca māṁ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya udāsīnavad āsīnam asaktaṁ teṣu karmasu
verses.translation: O Dhanañjaya, such actions cannot bind Me. I am detached and indifferent to these activities.

verses.sanskrit: मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् । हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: mayādhyakṣeṇa prakṛtiḥ sūyate sa-carācaram hetunānena kaunteya jagad viparivartate
verses.translation: Under My command, material nature produces the universe with all its moving and non-moving beings. O son of Kuntī, because of this the universe continually manifests.

verses.sanskrit: अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् । परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: avajānanti māṁ mūḍhā mānuṣīṁ tanum āśritam paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mama bhūta-maheśvaram
verses.translation: Because they do not know My divine nature as the Supreme Controller of all living beings, those who are ignorant mock Me when I assume a human form.

verses.sanskrit: मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः । राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: moghāśā mogha-karmāṇo mogha-jñānā vicetasaḥ rākṣasīm āsurīṁ caiva prakṛtiṁ mohinīṁ śritāḥ
verses.translation: All their aspirations, activities and knowledge are futile and senseless. Such persons adopt a contemptible, malicious nature and become bewildered.

verses.sanskrit: महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः । भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम् ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: mahātmānas tu māṁ pārtha daivīṁ prakṛtim āśritāḥ bhajanty-ananya-manaso jñātvā bhūtādim avyayam
verses.translation: However, those great personalities who do take shelter of My divine nature, worship Me with a steady mind and know Me to be the imperishable origin of all beings.

verses.sanskrit: सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः । नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: satataṁ kīrtayanto māṁ yatantaś ca dṛḍha-vratāḥ namasyantaś ca māṁ bhaktyā nitya-yuktā upāsate
verses.translation: They are always glorifying Me, endeavouring with determination and firmly fixed in their vows. Offering their obeisance to Me with devotion, suchbhakti-yogīsalways worship me.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते । एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: jñāna-yajñena cāpy-anye yajanto mām upāsate ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā viśvato-mukham
verses.translation: Others worship Me with the sacrifice of knowledge, considering themselves to be non-different from Me. Others worship Me in many different forms, while others venerate Me as the universal form.

verses.sanskrit: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम् । मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ kratur ahaṁ yajñaḥ svadhāham aham auṣadham mantro’ham aham evājyam aham agnir ahaṁ hutam
verses.translation: I am the ritual, I am the sacrifice, I am the offering, I am the sacred herbs, I am themantraand I am the clarified butter, I am the sacred fire and I am the act of offering.

verses.sanskrit: पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः । वेद्यं पवित्रमोंकार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: pitāham asya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ vedyaṁ pavitram oṁkāra ṛksāma yajureva ca
verses.translation: I am both the father and the mother of the universe, I am the Maintainer, the Grandsire, the object of all knowledge, the purifier, the syllableoṁand I am theṚg Veda,Sāma Vedaand theYajur Veda.

verses.sanskrit: गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् । प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम् ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: gatir bhartā prabhuḥ sākṣī nivāsaḥ śaraṇaṁ suhṛt prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṁ nidhānaṁ bījam avyayam
verses.translation: I am the supreme objective, the sustainer, the master, the witness, the abode, the shelter, and the dear-most friend. I am creation, maintenance and destruction, I am the greatest wealth and the indestructible seed.

verses.sanskrit: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च । अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: tapāmy-aham ahaṁ varṣaṁ nigṛhṇāmy-utsṛjāmi ca amṛtaṁ caiva mṛtyuś ca sad asac cāham arjuna
verses.translation: I create heat and I bring forth the rain and also withdraw it. I am eternality and I am death. I am reality and I am illusion, O Arjuna.

verses.sanskrit: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते । ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोक-मश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान् ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: trai-vidyā māṁ soma-pāḥ pūta-pāpā yajñair iṣṭvā svargatiṁ prārthayante te puṇyam āsādya surendra-lokam aśnanti divyān divi deva-bhogān
verses.translation: Those who are conversant with the threeVedasworship Me indirectly, and by drinkingsomathey become purified and attain the higher planets. By their pious activities they reach the abode of Indra where they enjoy the celestial pleasures of the demigods.

verses.sanskrit: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति । एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: te taṁ bhuktvā svarga-lokaṁ viśālaṁ kṣīṇe puṇye martya-lokaṁ viśanti evaṁ trayī-dharmam anuprapannā gatāgataṁ kāma-kāmā labhante
verses.translation: After they have experienced the extensive pleasures of the higher planets, their pious credits become exhausted and they again enter the mortal plane. Therefore, the results of those who perform Vedic rituals to obtain material enjoyment are fleeting.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते । तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration: ananyāś cintayanto māṁ ye janāḥ paryupāsate teṣāṁ nityābhiyuktānāṁ yoga-kṣemaṁ vahāmy-aham
verses.translation: But for those who are always absorbed in thoughts of Me, who worship Me and who are always associated with Me, I carry what they lack and preserve what they have.

verses.sanskrit: येऽप्यन्यदेवता भक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः । तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम् ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: ye’pyanya-devatā bhaktā yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ te’pi mām eva kaunteya yajanty-avidhi-pūrvakam
verses.translation: O Kaunteya, those that worship other demigods with faith actually worship Me, but they do so improperly.

verses.sanskrit: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च । न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ hi sarva-yajñānāṁ bhoktā ca prabhureva ca na tu mām abhijānanti tattvenātaś cyavanti te
verses.translation: It is I who am the enjoyer and object of all sacrifices. But those who are ignorant of My true nature fall down from the path of self-realisation.

verses.sanskrit: यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः । भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: yānti deva-vratā devān pitṛn yānti pitṛ-vratāḥ bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti mad yājino’pi mām
verses.translation: The worshippers of the demigods attain the realm of the demigods. The worshippers of the ancestors reach the domain of the ancestors. The worshippers of ghosts and spirits go to the world of the ghosts and spirits. But those who worship Me come to Me.

verses.sanskrit: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति । तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: patraṁ puṣpaṁ phalaṁ toyaṁ yo me bhaktyā prayacchati tad ahaṁ bhakty-upahṛtam aśnāmi prayatātmanaḥ
verses.translation: If one offers to Me with devotion a leaf, a flower, fruit or some water, I will accept that offering from My pure-hearted devotee.

verses.sanskrit: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् । यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: yat karoṣi yad aśnāsi yaj juhoṣi dadāsi yat yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣva mad arpaṇam
verses.translation: O Kaunteya, whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer in sacrifice, whatever you give in charity, whatever penances you undertake, do that as an offering unto Me.

verses.sanskrit: शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः । संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: śubhāśubha-phalair evaṁ mokṣyase karma-bandhanaiḥ sannyāsa-yoga-yuktātmā vimukto mām upaiṣyasi
verses.translation: By doing so, you will become free from the bondage ofkarmaand it’s auspicious and inauspicious effects. By renouncing the results of your actions and connecting yourself with Me, you will become liberated and attain Me.

verses.sanskrit: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः । ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration: samo’haṁ sarva-bhūteṣu na me dveṣyo’sti na priyaḥ ye bhajanti tu māṁ bhaktyā mayi te teṣu cāpy-aham
verses.translation: I am equal to all living beings. I neither hate nor favour anyone. Yet whoever worships Me with devotion is with Me and I am certainly with them.

verses.sanskrit: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् । साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration: api cet sudurācāro bhajate mām ananya-bhāk sādhur eva sa mantavyaḥ samyag vyavasito hi saḥ
verses.translation: Even if one is impious and has committed abominable acts, if he worships Me with one-pointed devotion, such a person should be considered saintly because his determination is perfect.

verses.sanskrit: क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति । कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration: kṣipraṁ bhavati dharmātmā śaśvac chāntiṁ nigacchati kaunteya pratijānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati
verses.translation: He quickly becomes virtuous again and attains everlasting peace. O Kaunteya, declare it boldly that My devotee never perishes.

verses.sanskrit: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः । स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration: māṁ hi pārtha vyapāśritya ye’pi syuḥ pāpa-yonayaḥ striyo vaiśyās tathā śūdrās te’pi yānti parāṁ gatim
verses.translation: O Pārtha, even if persons of impious birth, women, merchants (vaiśyas) and labourers (śūdras) take shelter of Me, they will also reach the highest destination.

verses.sanskrit: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा । अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration: kiṁ punar brāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā rājarṣayas tathā anityam asukhaṁ lokam imaṁ prāpya bhajasva mām
verses.translation: What to say of the purebrāhmaṇasand pious kings? Now, having come into this temporary world of misery, devote yourself to Me!

verses.sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु । मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration: man-manā bhava mad bhakto mad yājī māṁ namaskuru mām evaiṣyasi yuktvaivam ātmānaṁ mat-parāyaṇaḥ
verses.translation: Always think of Me. Be My devotee. Worship Me. Offer your respects unto Me. In this way, by dedicating yourself to Me and surrendering to Me, you will come to Me.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 10 Vibhuti Yoga The Yoga Of Divine Splendour

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः । यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – bhūya eva mahā-bāho śṛṇu me paramaṁ vacaḥ yat te’haṁ prīyamāṇāya vakṣyāmi hita-kāmyayā
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: Listen to these supreme teachings once more, O mighty-armed one. Because I desire your welfare, I shall speak them to you because you are very dear to Me.

verses.sanskrit: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः । अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: na me viduḥ sura-gaṇāḥ prabhavaṁ na maharṣayaḥ aham ādir hi devānāṁ maharṣīṇāṁ ca sarvaśaḥ
verses.translation: The demigods and great sages do not know My origin. Indeed, I am the origin of the demigods and the great sages.

verses.sanskrit: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् । असम्मूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: yo mām ajam anādiṁ ca vetti loka-maheśvaram asammūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣu sarva-pāpaiḥ pramucyate
verses.translation: One who knows Me as the birthless, beginningless Supreme Controller of all worlds is not bewildered amongst mortals, and is free from allkarma.

verses.sanskrit: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसम्मोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः । सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ॥४॥ अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः । भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: buddhir jñānam asaṁmohaḥ kṣamā satyaṁ damaḥ śamaḥ sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ bhavo’bhāvo bhayaṁ cābhayam eva ca ahiṁsā samatā tuṣṭis tapo dānaṁ yaśo’yaśaḥ bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṁ matta eva pṛthag-vidhāḥ
verses.translation: Intelligence, knowledge, freedom from delusion, tolerance, truthfulness, self-control, pleasure, misery, birth, death, fear and fearlessness, non-violence, equanimity, satisfaction, austerity, charity, fame and infamy – all these various conditions of the living beings arise from Me alone.

verses.sanskrit: महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा । मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: maharṣayaḥ sapta pūrve catvāro manavas tathā mad bhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣāṁ loka imāḥ prajāḥ
verses.translation: The Seven Sages, the Four Kumāras and the Manus, from whom all the living beings of this world have descended, are all manifest from My mind.

verses.sanskrit: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः । सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: etāṁ vibhūtiṁ yogaṁ ca mama yo vetti tattvataḥ so’vikampena yogena yujyate nātra saṁśayaḥ
verses.translation: One who knows the truth of My splendour and the process ofyogabecomes resolutely united with Me. Of this there is no doubt.

verses.sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते । इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṁ pravartate iti matvā bhajante māṁ budhā bhāva-samanvitāḥ
verses.translation: I am the source of everything. All things emanate from Me. Understanding this, the wise who are endowed with love, worship Me with all their heart.

verses.sanskrit: मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् । कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: mac-cittā mad gata-prāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam kathayantaś ca māṁ nityaṁ tuṣyanti ca ramanti ca
verses.translation: Those who are always thinking of Me, who have dedicated their lives to Me, enlighten each other and feel great satisfaction and joy by always speaking about Me.

verses.sanskrit: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् । ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: teṣāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam dadāmi buddhi-yogaṁ taṁ yena mām upayānti te
verses.translation: To those who are constantly devoted to Me and worship Me with love, I continue to bestow upon them devotional inspiration by which they may come to Me.

verses.sanskrit: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः । नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: teṣām evānukampārtham aham ajñāna-jaṁ tamaḥ nāśayāmy-ātma-bhāvastho jñāna-dīpena bhāsvatā
verses.translation: Out of compassion for them, I appear in their hearts and destroy with the shining lamp of knowledge the darkness that is born from ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् । पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ॥१२॥ आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा । असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – paraṁ brahma paraṁ dhāma pavitraṁ paramaṁ bhavān puruṣaṁ śāśvataṁ divyam ādidevam ajaṁ vibhum āhus tvām ṛṣayaḥ sarve devarṣir nāradas tathā asito devalo vyāsaḥ svayaṁ caiva bravīṣi me
verses.translation: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the Supreme refuge, and the most pure. You are the eternal Supreme Person, the most effulgent, the original divinity, unborn and all-pervading. All the sages such as Nārada, Asita, Devala and Vyāsa have stated this, just as You have declared this unto me.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव । न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: sarvam etad ṛtaṁ manye yan māṁ vadasi keśava na hi te bhagavan vyaktiṁ vidur devā na dānavāḥ
verses.translation: O Keśava, everything You have told me I accept as truth. O Master of all splendour, neither Demigods norDānavascan fully understand Your personality.

verses.sanskrit: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम । भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: svayam evātmanātmānaṁ vettha tvaṁ puruṣottama bhūta-bhāvana bhūteśa deva-deva jagat-pate
verses.translation: O Supreme Person, O Creator of all creatures, O Controller of all living beings, O Master of the demigods, O Master of the universe – You alone truly know Yourself.

verses.sanskrit: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः । याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: vaktum arhasy-aśeṣeṇa divyā hy-ātma-vibhūtayaḥ yābhir vibhūtibhir lokān imāṁs tvaṁ vyāpya tiṣṭhasi
verses.translation: Please describe to me completely Your divine powers by which You pervade all the worlds.

verses.sanskrit: कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् । केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: kathaṁ vidyām ahaṁ yogiṁs tvāṁ sadā paricintayan keṣu keṣu ca bhāveṣu cintyo’si bhagavan mayā
verses.translation: How can I constantly be absorbed in thoughts of You, O Master of all mystic powers, How can I know You and how should I meditate upon You?

verses.sanskrit: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन । भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: vistareṇātmano yogaṁ vibhūtiṁ ca janārdana bhūyaḥ kathaya tṛptir hi śṛṇvato nāsti me’mṛtam
verses.translation: O Janārdana, kindly explain to me again in detail Your mystic powers and opulence. Hearing such nectar about You, I am never satiated.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः । प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – hanta te kathayiṣyāmi divyā hy-ātma-vibhūtayaḥ prādhānyataḥ kuru-śreṣṭha nāsty-anto vistarasya me
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: Listen, O best of the Kuru Dynasty, there is no end to the extent of My powers, but I shall explain to you those divine opulences of Mine that are most prominent.

verses.sanskrit: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः । अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: aham ātmā guḍākeśa sarva-bhūtāśaya-sthitaḥ aham ādiś ca madhyaṁ ca bhūtānām anta eva ca
verses.translation: O conqueror of sleep, I am the Super Consciousness that resides in all living beings. I am the beginning, the middle and the end of all creatures.

verses.sanskrit: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् । मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: ādityānām ahaṁ viṣṇur jyotiṣāṁ ravir aṁśumān marīcir marutām asmi nakṣatrāṇām ahaṁ śaśī
