verses.translation: Of the Ādityas I am Viṣṇu. Of lights I am the blazing sun. Of the Marutas I am Marīci. Of celestial bodies I am the moon.

verses.sanskrit: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः । इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration: vedānāṁ sāma-vedo’smi devānām asmi vāsavaḥ indriyāṇāṁ manaś cāsmi bhūtānām asmi cetanā
verses.translation: Of theVedasI am theSāma Veda. Of the demigods I am Indra. Of the senses I am the mind. Of living beings I am consciousness.

verses.sanskrit: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् । वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम् ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: rudrāṇāṁ śaṅkaraś cāsmi vitteśo yakṣa-rakṣasām vasūnāṁ pāvakaś cāsmi meruḥ śikhariṇām aham
verses.translation: Of the Rudras I am Śaṅkara. Of the Yakṣas and Rākṣasas I am Kuvera. Of the Vasus I am Agni and of mountains I am Meru.

verses.sanskrit: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् । सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: purodhasāṁ ca mukhyaṁ māṁ viddhi pārtha bṛhaspatim senānīnām ahaṁ skandaḥ sarasām asmi sāgaraḥ
verses.translation: O Pārtha, know Me to be Bṛhaspati, the chief amongst priests. Of military generals I am Skanda. Of bodies of water I am the ocean.

verses.sanskrit: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् । यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: maharṣīṇāṁ bhṛgur ahaṁ girām asmy-ekam akṣaram yajñānāṁ japa-yajño’smi sthāvarāṇāṁ himālayaḥ
verses.translation: Of great sages I am Bhṛgu. Of sounds I am the monosyllabicmantraoṁ. Of sacrifices I amjapa. Of immovable things I am the Himālayas.

verses.sanskrit: अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः । गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: aśvatthaḥ sarva-vṛkṣāṇāṁ devarṣīṇāṁ ca nāradaḥ gandharvāṇāṁ citrarathaḥ siddhānāṁ kapilo muniḥ
verses.translation: Amongst all trees I am the banyan. Of celestial sages I am Nārada. Amongst Gandharvas I am Citraratha and amongst perfected beings I am Kapila Muni.

verses.sanskrit: उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् । ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: uccaiḥśravasam aśvānāṁ viddhi mām amṛtodbhavam airāvataṁ gajendrāṇāṁ narāṇāṁ ca narādhipam
verses.translation: Of horses I am known as Uccaiḥśrava, who was born from the ocean of nectar. I am Airāvata, the king of elephants and I am the monarch amongst men.

verses.sanskrit: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् । प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: āyudhānām ahaṁ vajraṁ dhenūnām asmi kāmadhuk prajanaś cāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ
verses.translation: Of weapons I am the thunderbolt. Of cows I am the Kāma-dhenu. Of progenitors I am Kāma, and of snakes I am Vāsuki.

verses.sanskrit: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् । पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम् ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration: anantaś cāsmi nāgānāṁ varuṇo yādasām aham pitṛṇām aryamā cāsmi yamaḥ saṁyamatām aham
verses.translation: Amongst the celestial Nāga-snakes I am Ananta. Amongst the inhabitants of the water I am Varuṇa. Amongst the forefathers I am Aryamā. Of chastisers I am Yama.

verses.sanskrit: पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम् । झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration: pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śastra-bhṛtām aham jhaṣāṇāṁ makaraś cāsmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī
verses.translation: Of purifiers I am the wind. Of the wielders of weapons I am Rāmacandra. Amongst aquatics I am themakaraand of rivers I am the Gaṅgā.

verses.sanskrit: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन । अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम् ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration: sargāṇām ādir antaś ca madhyaṁ caivāham arjuna adhyātma-vidyā vidyānāṁ vādaḥ pravadatām aham
verses.translation: O Arjuna, in creation I am the beginning, the middle and the end. Of wisdom I am knowledge of the self and I am the doctrine of philosophers.

verses.sanskrit: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च । अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुखः ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration: akṣarāṇām akāro’smi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya ca aham evākṣayaḥ kālo dhātāhaṁ viśvato-mukhaḥ
verses.translation: Of letters I am the letterA. Amongst compound words I am the dual. I alone am the eternal flow of the time factor and I am the Creator, who gazes in all directions.

verses.sanskrit: मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम् । कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration: mṛtyuḥ sarva-haraś cāham udbhavaś ca bhaviṣyatām kīrtiḥ śrīr vāk ca nārīṇāṁ smṛtir medhā dhṛtiḥ kṣamā
verses.translation: I am death, the destroyer of all things. I am the manifestation of all things yet to be. Of women I am Kīrtī, Śrī, Vāk, Smṛti, Medhā, Dhṛti and Kṣamā.

verses.sanskrit: बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् । मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration: bṛhat-sāma tathā sāmnāṁ gāyatrī chandasām aham māsānāṁ mārga-śīrṣo’ham ṛtūnāṁ kusumākaraḥ
verses.translation: Of the songs of theSāma VedaI am theBṛhat-Sāma. Of Vedic rhythms I am the Gāyatrī. Of months I am Mārga-śīrṣa and amongst seasons I am the flower-bearing spring.

verses.sanskrit: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् । जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम् ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration: dyūtaṁ chalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham jayo’smi vyavasāyo’smi sattvaṁ sattvavatām aham
verses.translation: I am the gambling of cheaters and of the splendid I am splendour. I am victory and determination. I am the might of the mighty.

verses.sanskrit: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जयः । मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः ॥३७॥
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṇīnāṁ vāsudevo’smi pāṇḍavānāṁ dhanañjayaḥ munīnām apy-ahaṁ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśanā kaviḥ
verses.translation: I am Vāsudeva amongst the Vṛṣṇi Dynasty. I am Arjuna amongst the Pāṇḍavas. Of philosophers I am Vyāsa and amongst scholars I am Uśanā.

verses.sanskrit: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् । मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम् ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration: daṇḍo damayatām asmi nītir asmi jigīṣatām maunaṁ caivāsmi guhyānāṁ jñānaṁ jñānavatām aham
verses.translation: I am the punishment enforced by those who chastise. I am the conduct of those that desire victory. I am the silence of secrets and I am the knowledge of the wise.

verses.sanskrit: यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन । न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration: yac cāpi sarva-bhūtānāṁ bījaṁ tad aham arjuna na tad asti vinā yat syān mayā bhūtaṁ carācaram
verses.translation: I am the seed of all living beings, O Arjuna. There is nothing moving or non-moving, that can exist without Me.

verses.sanskrit: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप । एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया ॥४०॥ nānto ‘sti mama divyānāṁ vibhūtīnāṁ parantapa eṣa tūddeśataḥ prokto vibhūter vistaro mayā
verses.translation: O conqueror of the enemy, My divine glories are unlimited. Only a fraction of their extent has been explained by Me.

verses.sanskrit: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा । तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम् ॥४१॥
verses.transliteration: yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṁ śrīmad ūrjitam eva vā tat tad evāvagaccha tvaṁ mama tejo’ṁśa sambhavam
verses.translation: Whatever exists that is wonderful, beautiful or glorious, know that it has manifest from but a particle of My power.

verses.sanskrit: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन । विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration: athavā bahunaitena kiṁ jñātena tavārjuna viṣṭabhyāham idaṁ kṛtsnam ekāṁśena sthito jagat
verses.translation: But what is the necessity of knowing all this, O Arjuna? I support the entire universe simply by a portion of Myself.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 11 Visvarupa Darsana Yoga The Yoga Of The Universal Form

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम् । यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – mad anugrahāya paramaṁ guhyam adhyātma-saṁjñitam yat tvayoktaṁ vacas tena moho’yaṁ vigato mama
verses.translation: Arjuna said: By Your mercy, You have explained the greatest secret about Your supreme nature – thus my bewilderment is gone.

verses.sanskrit: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया । त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम् ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṁ śrutau vistaraśo mayā tvattaḥ kamala-patrākṣa māhātmyam api cāvyayam
verses.translation: O lotus-eyed Kṛṣṇa, I have heard Your detailed description of the creation and destruction of all living beings, as well as Your eternal glories.

verses.sanskrit: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर । द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: evam etad yathāttha tvam ātmānaṁ parameśvara draṣṭum icchāmi te rūpam aiśvaraṁ puruṣottama
verses.translation: O Supreme Controller, what You have described about Yourself is true. O Supreme Person, I now desire to see Your form of great splendour.

verses.sanskrit: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो । योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम् ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: manyase yadi tac chakyaṁ mayā draṣṭum iti prabho yogeśvara tato me tvaṁ darśayātmānam avyayam
verses.translation: O Master of allyogīs, if You think that it is possible, then kindly show that immortal form to me.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः । नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – paśya me pārtha rūpāṇi śataśo’tha sahasraśaḥ nānā-vidhāni divyāni nānā-varṇākṛtīni ca
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa replied: Pārtha, behold My unlimited divine forms of various hues and shapes.

verses.sanskrit: पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा । बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: paśyādityān vasūn rudrān aśvinau marutas tathā bahūny-adṛṣṭa-pūrvāṇi paśyāścaryāṇi bhārata
verses.translation: O descendant of Bharata, behold the Ādityas, Vasus, Rudras, the Aśvinī-kumāras and the Marutas. Behold the multifarious amazing forms, never before seen.

verses.sanskrit: इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् । मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद् द्रष्टुमिच्छसि ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: ihaikasthaṁ jagat kṛtsnaṁ paśyādya sa-carācaram mama dehe guḍākeśa yac cānyad draṣṭum icchasi
verses.translation: O conqueror of sleep, behold in this one place the entire cosmos, including all moving and non-moving beings, all within this form of Mine along with whatever else you desire to see.

verses.sanskrit: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा । दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: na tu māṁ śakyase draṣṭum anenaiva sva-cakṣuṣā divyaṁ dadāmi te cakṣuḥ paśya me yogam aiśvaram
verses.translation: Yet you are unable to perceive this with your present eyes, therefore I will give you divine vision. Now behold My mystic splendour!

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः । दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम् ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca – evam uktvā tato rājan mahā-yogeśvaro hariḥ darśayāmāsa pārthāya paramaṁ rūpam aiśvaram
verses.translation: Sañjaya said: O Mahārāja Dhṛtarāṣṭra, having spoken thus to Pārtha, the Great Master of all mysticism, Śrī Kṛṣṇa, revealed the majesty of His universal form.

verses.sanskrit: अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम् । अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम् ॥१०॥ दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् । सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम् ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: aneka-vaktra-nayanam anekādbhuta-darśanam aneka-divyābharaṇaṁ divyānekodyatāyudham divya-mālyāmbara-dharaṁ divya-gandhānulepanam sarvāścaryamayaṁ devam anantaṁ viśvato-mukham
verses.translation: Śrī Kṛṣṇa revealed His form of infinite mouths and eyes, adorned with many divine ornaments and raising many celestial weapons. He was decorated with divine garlands and garments and anointed with heavenly fragrances. He was most wonderful, splendorous, unlimited and all-pervading.

verses.sanskrit: दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता । यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: divi sūrya-sahasrasya bhaved yugapad utthitā yadi bhāḥ sadṛśī sā syād bhāsas tasya mahātmanaḥ
verses.translation: If an infinite number of suns were to appear in the sky simultaneously, such effulgence might possibly resemble the splendour of that Supreme Person.

verses.sanskrit: तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा । अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: tatraika-sthaṁ jagat kṛtsnaṁ pravibhaktamanekadhā apaśyad deva-devasya śarīre pāṇḍavas tadā
verses.translation: At that moment, Arjuna, the son of Pāṇḍu, saw the entire cosmos within the form of the Master of the demigods.

verses.sanskrit: ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जयः । प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: tataḥ sa vismayāviṣṭo hṛṣṭa-romā dhanañjayaḥ praṇamya śirasā devaṁ kṛtāñjalir abhāṣata
verses.translation: Thus, being overwhelmed with astonishment, Arjuna’s hair stood on end and placing his hands together in prayer, he offered his obeisance to Śrī Kṛṣṇa and spoke.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान् । ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थ- मृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान् ॥ १५ ॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – paśyāmi devāṁs tava deva dehe sarvāṁs tathā bhūta-viśeṣa-saṅghān brahmāṇam īśaṁ kamalāsana stham ṛṣīṁś ca sarvān uragāṁś ca divyān
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Master, I see within Your body all the demigods and all other forms of life. I see the sages, the celestial serpents, as well as Brahmā and Śiva seated on a lotus.

verses.sanskrit: अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् । नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: aneka-bāhūdara-vaktra-netraṁ paśyāmi tvāṁ sarvato’nanta-rūpam nāntaṁ na madhyaṁ na punas tavādiṁ paśyāmi viśveśvara viśva-rūpa
verses.translation: O Master of the universe, I see Your unlimited form with innumerable arms, bellies, mouths and eyes. I see that there is no beginning, middle or end to this universal form of Yours.

verses.sanskrit: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम् । पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद् दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम् ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: kirīṭinaṁ gadinaṁ cakriṇaṁ ca tejorāśiṁ sarvato dīptimantam paśyāmi tvāṁ durnirīkṣyaṁ samantād dīptānalārka-dyutim aprameyam
verses.translation: I see You in all directions with crown, club and disc-weapon – a mass of radiance illuminating all around You like the brilliance of the sun, making You difficult to behold.

verses.sanskrit: त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् । त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: tvam akṣaraṁ paramaṁ veditavyaṁ tvamasya viśvasya paraṁ nidhānam tvam avyayaḥ śāśvata-dharma-goptā sanātanas tvaṁ puruṣo mato me
verses.translation: You are the eternal Absolute Truth known by theVedas. You are the ultimate shelter of the universe. You are the imperishable protector ofdharma. I understand You to be the eternal Supreme Person.

verses.sanskrit: अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्य-मनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् । पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम् ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: anādi-madhyāntam ananta-vīryam ananta-bāhuṁ śaśi-sūrya-netram paśyāmi tvāṁ dīpta-hutāśa-vaktraṁsva-tejasā viśvam idaṁ tapantam
verses.translation: I see that You are without beginning, middle or end. You have unlimited power and innumerable arms. Your eyes are the sun and the moon. This entire universe is scorched by the rays emanating from Your mouth like blazing fire.

verses.sanskrit: द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः । दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदं लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन् ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: dyāv-āpṛthivyor idam antaraṁ hi vyāptaṁ tvayaikena diśaś ca sarvāḥ dṛṣṭvādbhutaṁ rūpam idaṁ tavograṁ loka-trayaṁ pravyathitaṁ mahātman
verses.translation: O Great One, You completely pervade all directions including the space between the higher planets and the Earth. Seeing this wonderful and terrifying form of Yours, the three worlds tremble with fear.

verses.sanskrit: अमी हि त्वां सुरसङ्घा विशन्ति केचिद्भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति । स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घाः स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: amī hi tvāṁ sura-saṅghā viśanti kecid bhītāḥ prāñjalayo gṛṇanti svastīty-uktvā maharṣi-siddha-saṅghāḥ stuvanti tvāṁ stutibhiḥ puṣkalābhiḥ
verses.translation: The demigods enter into You and fearfully offer prayers to You with folded hands. The assembly of great sages and perfected beings offer choice prayers unto You exclaiming, “May there be auspiciousness!”

verses.sanskrit: रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च । गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घा वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration: rudrādityā vasavo ye ca sādhyā viśve’śvinau marutaś coṣmapāś ca gandharva-yakṣāsura-siddha-saṅghā vīkṣante tvāṁ vismitāś caiva sarve
verses.translation: The Rudras, Ādityas, Vasus, Sādhyas, Viśvadevas, Aśvinī-kumāras, Marutas, the forefathers, Gandharvas, Yakṣas, Asuras and Siddhas behold You and are struck with awe.

verses.sanskrit: रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रं महाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम् । बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालं दृष्ट्वा लोकाः प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम् ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: rūpaṁ mahat te bahu-vaktra-netraṁ mahā-bāho bahu-bāhūru-pādam bahūdaraṁ bahu-daṁṣṭrā-karālaṁ dṛṣṭvā lokāḥ pravyathitās tathāham
verses.translation: Seeing this immense form of Yours with it’s unlimited mouths, eyes, arms, legs, feet and bellies, dreadful with it’s many teeth – all of mankind, and myself, are terrified.

verses.sanskrit: नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णं व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम् । दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: nabhaḥ spṛśaṁ dīptam aneka-varṇaṁ vyāttānanaṁ dīpta-viśāla-netram dṛṣṭvā hi tvāṁ pravyathitāntarātmā dhṛtiṁ na vindāmi śamaṁ ca viṣṇo
verses.translation: O Vi

verses.sanskrit: दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि । दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: daṁṣṭrā-karālāni ca te mukhāni dṛṣṭvaiva kālānala-sannibhāni diśo na jāne na labhe ca śarma prasīda deveśa jagannivāsa
verses.translation: Seeing Your many mouths with their terrifying teeth, fiery like the flames of the universal annihilation, I have lost all sense of direction and composure. Be kind upon me, O Master of the demigods, O supreme shelter of the universe.

verses.sanskrit: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसङ्घैः । भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः ॥२६॥ वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि । केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु सन्दृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: amī ca tvāṁ dhṛtarāṣṭrasya putrāḥ sarve sahaivāvanipāla saṅghaiḥ bhīṣmo droṇaḥ sūta-putras tathāsau sahāsmadīyair api yodha-mukhyaiḥ
verses.translation: All the sons of Dh

verses.sanskrit: यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति । तथा तवामी नरलोकवीरा विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: yathā nadīnāṁ bahavo’mbu vegāḥ samudram evābhimukhā dravanti tathā tavāmī nara-loka-vīrā viśanti vaktrāṇy-abhivijvalanti
verses.translation: Just as rivers flow towards the ocean and finally enter it, similarly all these famous heroes enter into Your fiery mouths.

verses.sanskrit: यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गा विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः । तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोकास्-तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration: yathā pradīptaṁ jvalanaṁ pataṅgā viśanti nāśāya samṛddha-vegāḥ tathaiva nāśāya viśanti lokās tavāpi vaktrāṇi samṛddha-vegāḥ
verses.translation: Just as moths rush to their deaths by entering fire, all the worlds rush into Your mouths to their destruction.

verses.sanskrit: लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्ताल्-लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः । तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रं भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration: lelihyase grasamānaḥ samantāl lokān-samagrān-vadanair jvaladbhiḥ tejobhir āpūrya jagat samagraṁ bhāsas tavogrāḥ pratapanti viṣṇo
verses.translation: You repeatedly lick Your lips as You devour all around You with Your fiery mouths. O Viṣṇu, pervading the entire universe with Your brilliant rays, You incinerate it.

verses.sanskrit: आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद । विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यं न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम् ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration: ākhyāhi me ko bhavān ugra-rūpo namo’stu te deva-vara prasīda vijñātum icchāmi bhavantam ādyaṁ na hi prajānāmi tava pravṛttim
verses.translation: With such a terrifying form, please tell me who You are. O best of all divinities, be merciful unto me. O origin of all, I desire to know You, for I cannot fully understand Your activities.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः । ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – kālo’smi loka-kṣaya-kṛt pravṛddho lokān samāhartum iha pravṛttaḥ ṛte’pi tvāṁ na bhaviṣyanti sarve ye’vasthitāḥ pratyanīkeṣu yodhāḥ
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: Time I am, the mighty destroyer of worlds, and I come to vanquish all living beings. Even without your participation, all the warriors on the opposite side of the battlefield will be killed.

verses.sanskrit: तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वा शत्रून् भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम् । मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन् ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration: tasmāt tvam uttiṣṭha yaśo labhasva jitvā śatrūn bhuṅkṣva rājyaṁ samṛddham mayaivaite nihatāḥ pūrvam eva nimitta-mātraṁ bhava savyasācin
verses.translation: Therefore, arise and achieve glory! Conquer your foes and enjoy a prosperous empire! O best amongst archers, all your enemies have already been killed by Me – you are but an instrument.

verses.sanskrit: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान् । मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान् ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration: droṇaṁ ca bhīṣmaṁ ca jayadrathaṁ ca karṇaṁ tathānyān api yodha-vīrān mayā hatāṁs tvaṁ jahi mā vyathiṣṭhā yudhyasva jetāsi raṇe sapatnān
verses.translation: Droṇa, Bhīṣma, Jayadratha, Karṇa and other heroic soldiers have already been killed by Me. Fear not – fight! You will certainly conquer your enemy in this battle.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी । नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं सगद्गदं भीतभीतः प्रणम्य ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca – etac chrutvā vacanaṁ keśavasya kṛtāñjalir vepamānaḥ kirīṭī namaskṛtvā bhūya evāha kṛṣṇaṁ sagadgadaṁ bhīta-bhītaḥ praṇamya
verses.translation: Sañjaya said: Upon hearing Keśava’s words, the trembling Arjuna offered his obeisance and, folding his hands in prayer, spoke to Śrī Kṛṣṇa in a faltering voice.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च । रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घाः ॥३६॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – sthāne hṛṣīkeśa tava prakīrtyā jagat prahṛṣyaty-anurajyate ca rakṣāṁsi bhītāni diśo dravanti sarve namasyanti ca siddha-saṅghāḥ
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Master of the senses, it is only fitting that the whole universe should blissfully praise You and become attracted to You. Struck with terror, the wicked flee in all directions and all perfected beings offer their respects unto You.

verses.sanskrit: कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन् गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे । अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत् ॥३७॥
verses.transliteration: kasmāc ca te na nameran mahātman garīyase brahmaṇo’py-ādi-kartre ananta deveśa jagannivāsa tvam akṣaraṁ sad-asat tat-paraṁ yat
verses.translation: And, O Great One, why should they not bow down before You? You are even more exalted than Brahmā, the creator of this universe. O unlimited One, O Master of the demigods, O Supreme shelter of the universe – You are eternal, beyond that which is existent and non-existent.

verses.sanskrit: त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराणस्-त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् । वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप ॥३८॥
verses.transliteration: tvam ādidevaḥ puruṣaḥ purāṇas tvam asya viśvasya paraṁ nidhānam vettāsi vedyaṁ ca paraṁ ca dhāma tvayā tataṁ viśvam-ananta-rūpa
verses.translation: You are the Original Supreme Divinity, the Supreme Primeval Person, and the sole shelter of the whole universe. You are the knower and that which is knowable. You are the Supreme Refuge and Your infinite forms pervade the entire cosmos.

verses.sanskrit: वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च । नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते ॥३९॥
verses.transliteration: vāyur yamo’gnir varuṇaḥ śaśāṅkaḥ prajāpatis tvaṁ prapitāmahaś ca namo namaste’stu sahasra-kṛtvaḥ punaś ca bhūyo’pi namo namaste
verses.translation: You are the presiding deity of the air (Vāyu), You are the presiding deity of death (Yama), You are the presiding deity of fire (Agni), You are the presiding deity of water (Varuṇa), You are the creator and the grandfather of all living beings. I offer You my obeisance thousands of times, again and again.

verses.sanskrit: नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व । अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः ॥४०॥
verses.transliteration: namaḥ purastād atha pṛṣṭhatas te namo’stu te sarvata eva sarva ananta-vīryāmita-vikramas tvaṁ sarvaṁ samāpnoṣi tato’si sarvaḥ
verses.translation: My obeisance unto You from the front and from behind. My obeisance unto You from all directions. O Almighty One of infinite strength, You pervade all things, therefore You are all things.

verses.sanskrit: सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति । अजानता महिमानं तवेदं मया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि ॥४१॥ यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु । एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षं तत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम् ॥४२॥
verses.transliteration: sakheti matvā prasabhaṁ yad uktaṁ he kṛṣṇa he yādava he sakheti ajānatā mahimānaṁ tavedaṁ mayā pramādāt praṇayena vāpi
verses.translation: I was unaware of Your greatness and due to familiarity I have ignorantly addressed You as a friend. For whatever I have said casually such as, ‘O Kṛṣṇa, O Yādava, O friend’ and for whatever disrespect I have shown to You even in jest or while playing, relaxing, sitting together or eating, alone or in the presence of others – O Infallible One, O Inconceivable One, I beg Your forgiveness.

verses.sanskrit: पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान् । न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकः कुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव ॥४३॥
verses.transliteration: pitāsi lokasya carācarasya tvam asya pūjyaś ca gurur garīyān na tvat-samo’sty-abhyadhikaḥ kuto’nyo loka-traye’py-apratima-prabhāva
verses.translation: You are the father of all moving and non-moving beings in the universe. You are the most venerable and most glorious teacher. You have no equal within all the three worlds. How can there be anyone greater than You, O Master of incomparable power?

verses.sanskrit: तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायं प्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम् । पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम् ॥४४॥
verses.transliteration: tasmāt praṇamya praṇidhāya kāyaṁ prasādaye tvām aham īśam īḍyam piteva putrasya sakheva sakhyuḥ priyaḥ priyāyārhasi deva soḍhum
verses.translation: Therefore, O Master, I prostrate myself in front of You and beg You to be merciful unto me. O Kṛṣṇa, kindly forgive me, as a father, friend or lover would forgive a son, a friend or a beloved.

verses.sanskrit: अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे । तदेव मे दर्शय देव रूपं प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ॥४५॥
verses.transliteration: adṛṣṭa-pūrvaṁ hṛṣito’smi dṛṣṭvā bhayena ca pravyathitaṁ mano me tad eva me darśaya deva rūpaṁ prasīda deveśa jagannivāsa
verses.translation: I am happy to have seen this universal form of Yours, which has never been seen before. Yet my mind is overcome by fear. Therefore, O Master of the demigods, kindly show me that form of Nārāyaṇa, the refuge of the universe.

verses.sanskrit: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तं इच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव । तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते ॥४६॥
verses.transliteration: kirīṭinaṁ gadinaṁ cakra-hastaṁ icchāmi tvāṁ draṣṭum ahaṁ tathaiva tenaiva rūpeṇa catur-bhujena sahasra-bāho bhava viśva-mūrte
verses.translation: I wish to see that form of Yours wearing a crown and carrying the club and disc-weapon in Your hands. O one with a thousand arms, O universal form, now kindly reveal to me Your four-armed form.

verses.sanskrit: रीभगवानुवाच ।मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदंरूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात् । तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यंयन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम् ॥४७॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – mayā prasannena tavārjunedaṁ rūpaṁ paraṁ darśitam ātma-yogāt tejomayaṁ viśvam anantam ādyaṁ yan me tvad-anyena na dṛṣṭa-pūrvam
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa replied: Arjuna, being pleased with you I have shown you, through My divine potency, this radiant, infinite, primeval universal form. This form has never been seen by anyone before.

verses.sanskrit: न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानैर्-न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रैः । एवंरूपः शक्य अहं नृलोके द्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर ॥४८॥
verses.transliteration: na veda-yajñādhyayanair na dānair na ca kriyābhir na tapobhir ugraiḥ evaṁ rūpaḥ śakya ahaṁ nṛloke draṣṭuṁ tvad-anyena kuru-pravīra
verses.translation: O best of the Kuru Dynasty, no one in this world of mortals can see this form that I have revealed to you – neither by study of theVedas, nor the performance of Vedic sacrifices, nor by giving charity, nor by rituals, nor by rigorous austerities.

verses.sanskrit: मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम् । व्यपेतभीः प्रीतमनाः पुनस्त्वं तदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य ॥४९॥
verses.transliteration: mā te vyathā mā ca vimūḍha-bhāvo dṛṣṭvā rūpaṁ ghoram īdṛṅ mamedam vyapetabhīḥ prīta-manāḥ punas tvaṁ tad eva me rūpam idaṁ prapaśya
verses.translation: Do not be fearful by seeing this terrifying form of Mine. Do not be bewildered. With a tranquil mind, behold once more the form you desire to see.

verses.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः । आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा ॥५०॥
verses.transliteration: sañjaya uvāca – ity-arjunaṁ vāsudevas tathoktvā svakaṁ rūpaṁ darśayāmāsa bhūyaḥ āśvāsayāmāsa ca bhītam enaṁ bhūtvā punaḥ saumya-vapur mahātmā
verses.translation: Sañjaya said: Speaking thus, Vāsudeva (Śrī Kṛṣṇa) showed His four-armed form and then resumed His beautiful two-armed form, calming the frightened Arjuna.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन । इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः ॥५१॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – dṛṣṭvedaṁ mānuṣaṁ rūpaṁ tava saumyaṁ janārdana idānīm asmi saṁvṛttaḥ sacetāḥ prakṛtiṁ gataḥ
verses.translation: Arjuna said: Looking at Your sweet human-like form, O Janārdana, my mind is peaceful once more and I have regained my composure.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम । देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः ॥५२॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – sudurdarśam idaṁ rūpaṁ dṛṣṭavān asi yan mama devā apy-asya rūpasya nityaṁ darśana-kāṅkṣiṇaḥ
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: This form of Mine that you now see before you is most difficult to see. Even the demigods constantly desire to attain but a glimpse of it.

verses.sanskrit: नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया । शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा ॥५३॥
verses.transliteration: nāhaṁ vedair na tapasā na dānena na cejyayā śakya evaṁ vidho draṣṭuṁ dṛṣṭavān asi māṁ yathā
verses.translation: Not through theVedas, not through penances, not through philanthropic works, nor through sacrificial rituals, is it possible to see Me as you have seen Me.

verses.sanskrit: भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन । ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परन्तप ॥५४॥
verses.transliteration: bhaktyā tv-ananyayā śakya aham evaṁ vidho’rjuna jñātuṁ draṣṭuṁ ca tattvena praveṣṭuṁ ca parantapa
verses.translation: O Arjuna, I can only be fully known throughbhakti-yoga. By such devotion one can truly see Me and attain Me, O conqueror of the enemy.

verses.sanskrit: मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः । निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव ॥५५॥
verses.transliteration: mat-karma-kṛn mat-paramo mad-bhaktaḥ saṅga-varjitaḥ nirvairaḥ sarva-bhūteṣu yaḥ sa māmeti pāṇḍava
verses.translation: My devotee who serves Me, accepts Me as the Supreme, rejects all material attachments, and who is free from malice for all living beings can attain Me, O son of Pāṇḍu.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 12 Bhakti Yoga The Yoga Of Devotion

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच एवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते । ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमाः ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – evaṁ satata-yuktā ye bhaktās tvāṁ paryupāsate ye cāpy-akṣaram avyaktaṁ teṣāṁ ke yoga-vittamāḥ
verses.translation: Arjuna said: Who is best situated inyoga– those who constantly glorify You or those who are situated in Your impersonal, imperishable aspect?

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते । श्रद्धया परयोपेताः ते मे युक्ततमा मताः ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – mayy-āveśya mano ye māṁ nitya-yuktā upāsate śraddhayā parayopetās te me yuktatamā matāḥ
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa replied: Those who fix their minds upon Me, who constantly glorify Me and possess great faith – I consider them to be most perfect.

verses.sanskrit: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते । सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यञ्च कूटस्थमचलन्ध्रुवम् ॥३॥ सन्नियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः । ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: ye tv-akṣaram anirdeśyam avyaktaṁ paryupāsate sarvatra-gam acintyaṁ ca kūṭastham acalaṁ dhruvam sanniyamyendriya-grāmaṁ sarvatra sama-buddhayaḥ te prāpnuvanti mām eva sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ
verses.translation: However, those that control their senses, who are mentally composed in all situations, who are dedicated to helping all living beings and who worship My unfathomable, impersonal, inconceivable, unchanging, all-pervading aspect which is fixed and immovable – they also reach Me.

verses.sanskrit: क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम् । अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दुःखं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: kleśo’dhikataras teṣām avyaktāsakta-cetasām avyaktā hi gatir duḥkhaṁ dehavadbhir avāpyate
verses.translation: There is great difficulty for those whose minds are attached to the impersonal aspect. To progress on that path is most troublesome for embodied beings.

verses.sanskrit: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः । अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते ॥६॥ तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् । भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम् ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi sannyasya mat-parāḥ ananyenaiva yogena māṁ dhyāyanta upāsate teṣām ahaṁ samuddhartā mṛtyu-saṁsāra-sāgarāt| bhavāmi na cirāt pārtha mayy-āveśita-cetasām
verses.translation: O Pārtha, those who renounce all actions and offer them to Me, who take shelter in Me, who are fully absorbed in meditating upon achieving My association and who always worship Me – I swiftly deliver them from the ocean of birth and death.

verses.sanskrit: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय । निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: mayy-eva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṁ niveśaya nivasiṣyasi mayy eva ata ūrdhvaṁ na saṁśayaḥ
verses.translation: Fix your mind and intelligence on Me alone and ultimately you will come to Me. Of this there is no doubt.

verses.sanskrit: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम् । अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: atha cittaṁ samādhātuṁ na śaknoṣi mayi sthiram abhyāsa-yogena tato mām icchāptuṁ dhanañjaya
verses.translation: Dhanañjaya, if you cannot firmly fix your mind upon Me, then try to reach Me by the constant practice ofbhakti-yoga.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव । मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: abhyāse’pyasamartho’si mat-karma-paramo bhava mad-artham api karmāṇi kurvan siddhim avāpsyasi
verses.translation: If you cannot keep up the practices ofbhakti-yoga, then just try offering your work to Me. Thus, you will reach the perfect stage.

verses.sanskrit: अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः । सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं ततः कुरु यतात्मवान् ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: athaitad apy-aśakto’si kartuṁ mad-yogam āśritaḥ sarva-karma-phala-tyāgaṁ tataḥ kuru yatātmavān
verses.translation: If you are unable to do that, then do your work and offer the results to Me. While controlling the mind, give up all the results of your activities.

verses.sanskrit: श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते । ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्यागस्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: śreyo hi jñānam abhyāsāj jñānād dhyānaṁ viśiṣyate dhyānāt karma-phala-tyāgas tyāgāc cāntir anantaram
verses.translation: If you cannot follow this instruction then engage yourself in the cultivation of knowledge. However, meditation is superior to knowledge. Better than meditation is the renunciation of material gain, for by such renunciation one finds peace.

verses.sanskrit: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च । निर्ममो निरहङ्कारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी ॥१३॥ सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः । मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: adveṣṭā sarva-bhūtānāṁ maitraḥ karuṇa eva ca nirmamo nirahaṅkāraḥ sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ kṣamī santuṣṭaḥ satataṁ yogī yatātmā dṛḍha-niścayaḥ mayy-arpita-mano-buddhir yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
verses.translation: One who is devoid of hatred, who is friendly and compassionate to all living beings, who is devoid of any sense of possessiveness, free of egotism, objective in all circumstances, forgiving, a self-satisfied practitioner ofyoga, self-controlled, of strong determination, and whose mind and intelligence is engaged in thinking of Me – that person is My devotee and is thus very dear to Me.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः । हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: yasmān nodvijate loko lokān nodvijate ca yaḥ harṣāmarṣa-bhayodvegair mukto yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ
verses.translation: One who does not cause distress to anyone and who is never distressed by anyone, who is free from happiness, anger, fear and anxiety, is very dear to Me.

verses.sanskrit: अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः । सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: anapekṣaḥ śuchir dakṣa udāsīno gata-vyathaḥ sarvārambha-parityāgī yo mad-bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
verses.translation: One who is indifferent, pure, expert, dispassionate, free from distress, and who renounces all selfish desires is very dear to Me.

verses.sanskrit: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति । शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्यः स मे प्रियः ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: yo na hṛṣyati na dveṣṭi na śocati na kāṅkṣati śubhāśubha-parityāgī bhaktimān yaḥ sa me priyaḥ
verses.translation: One who neither rejoices nor envies, who feels neither sorrow nor desire, who rejects both auspiciousness and inauspiciousness – that person has devotion and is very dear to Me.

verses.sanskrit: समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः । शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः ॥१८॥ तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित् । अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: samaḥ śatrau ca mitre ca tathā mānāpamānayoḥ śītoṣṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣu samaḥ saṅga-vivarjitaḥ tulya-nindā-stutir maunī santuṣṭo yena kenacit aniketaḥ sthira-matir bhaktimān me priyo naraḥ
verses.translation: One who is equal to both friends and enemies, equipoised in fame and infamy, heat and cold, pleasure and pain, who is detached, equal to insult and praise, of controlled speech, satisfied in all circumstances, who has no attachment to any residence and of steady mind – that person has devotion and is very dear to Me.

verses.sanskrit: ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते । श्रद्दधाना मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: ye tu dharmyāmṛtam idaṁ yathoktaṁ paryupāsate śraddadhānā mat-paramā bhaktās te’tīva me priyāḥ
verses.translation: Those who are faithful and who follow this eternal path ofdharmathat has been described by Me, considering Me to be Supreme – such persons are very dear to Me.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 13 Prakrti Purusa Viveka Yoga The Yoga Of Differentiation

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च । एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – prakṛtiṁ puruṣam caiva kṣetraṁ kṣetrajñameva ca etad veditum icchāmi jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ ca keśava
verses.translation: Arjuna said: O Ke

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते । एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – idaṁ śarīraṁ kaunteya kṣetram ity-abhidhīyate etad yo vetti taṁ prāhuḥ kṣetrajña iti tad-vidaḥ
verses.translation: Bhagav

verses.sanskrit: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: kṣetrajñaṁ cāpi māṁ viddhi sarva-kṣetreṣu bhārata kṣetra-kṣetrajñayor jñānaṁ yat taj jñānaṁ mataṁ mama
verses.translation: You should know that I am the knower of all fields, O descendant of Bharata. I consider the knowledge of the field and its knower to be real knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् । स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: tat kṣetraṁ yac ca yādṛk ca yad vikāri yataś ca yat sa ca yo yat prabhāvaś ca tat samāsena me śṛṇu
verses.translation: Now hear from Me in brief about what that field is, what constitutes it, what are its transformations, its origin and who is the knower of the field and what is his influence.

verses.sanskrit: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक् । ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: ṛṣibhir bahudhā gītaṁ chandobhir vividhaiḥ pṛthak brahma-sūtra-padaiś caiva hetumadbhir viniścitaiḥ
verses.translation: This knowledge has been sung of in many different ways by different sages, by theVedas, and is found in the logically conclusive chapters of theVed

verses.sanskrit: महाभूतान्यहंकारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च । इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः ॥६॥ इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं संघातश्चेतना धृतिः । एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: mahā-bhūtāny-ahaṅkāro buddhir avyaktam eva ca indriyāṇi daśaikaṁ ca pañca cendriya-gocarāḥ icchā dveṣaḥ sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ saṅghātaś cetanā dhṛtiḥ etat kṣetraṁ samāsena sa-vikāram udāhṛtam
verses.translation: The main elements are the false ego, intelligence, the unmanifest material nature, the ten senses, the mind, the five sense-objects, desire, hate, pleasure, pain, the gross body, consciousness and determination. All these elements that are described here are considered to be the field.

verses.sanskrit: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् । आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः ॥८॥ इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहंकार एव च । जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम् ॥९॥ असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु । नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु ॥१०॥ मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी । विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि ॥११॥ अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् । एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: amānitvam adambhitvam ahiṁsā kṣāntir ārjavam ācāryopāsanaṁ śaucaṁ sthairyam ātma-vinigrahaḥ
verses.translation: Desirelessness, humility, non-violence, tolerance, simplicity, service to the spiritual master, purity, steadiness, self-control, detachment from sense gratification, absence of false ego, perception of the miseries of birth, death, old age and disease, detachment, freedom from attachment to wife, children and household life, perpetual equanimity in both happy and distressful circumstances, constant and firm devotion unto Me, dwelling in a solitary place, free from the desire to socialise with the masses, constant determination in achieving self-realisation and a desire to gain knowledge of the Absolute Truth – all these qualities have been declared to be knowledge. Anything contrary to this is ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्नुते । अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: jñeyaṁ yat tat pravakṣyāmi yaj jñātvā’mṛtam aśnute anādimat paraṁ brahma na sat tan nāsad ucyate
verses.translation: I shall now explain the object of knowledge, knowing which one attains immortality. It is subordinate to Me and is the eternal Supreme Brahman that is beyond material cause and effect.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् । सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: sarvataḥ pāṇi-pādaṁ tat sarvato’kṣi-śiro-mukham sarvataḥ śrutimal loke sarvam āvṛtya tiṣṭhati
verses.translation: His hands and feet are everywhere. His eyes, heads and mouths are everywhere. His ears are everywhere. Thus He exists, pervading all things.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् । असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: sarvendriya-guṇābhāsaṁ sarvendriya-vivarjitam asaktaṁ sarva-bhṛc caiva nirguṇaṁ guṇa-bhoktṛ ca
verses.translation: He illuminates all the senses and their functions, however He is devoid of any material senses Himself. He remains detached and He is the Maintainer of all. Although He is devoid of all material qualities, He is the Master of all qualities.

verses.sanskrit: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च । सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: bahir antaś ca bhūtānām acaraṁ carameva ca sūkṣmatvāt tad avijñeyaṁ dūrasthaṁ cāntike ca tat
verses.translation: He is situated in all moving and non-moving beings. He is near yet simultaneously He is far away. Thus, He is most subtle and difficult to fully understand.

verses.sanskrit: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् । भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: avibhaktaṁ ca bhūteṣu vibhaktam iva ca sthitam bhūta-bhartṛ ca taj jñeyaṁ grasiṣṇu prabhaviṣṇu ca
verses.translation: Although it seems that He is divided amongst all living beings, He is in fact undivided. He is to be known as the Creator, Maintainer and Destroyer.

verses.sanskrit: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते । ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: jyotiṣām api taj jyotis tamasaḥ paramucyate jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ jñāna-gamyaṁ hṛdi sarvasya viṣṭhitam
verses.translation: He is said to be the most brilliant of all luminaries, beyond darkness. He is knowledge, the object of knowledge and the aim of all knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः । मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: iti kṣetraṁ tathā jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ coktaṁ samāsataḥ mad-bhakta etad vijñāya mad-bhāvāyopapadyate
verses.translation: Thus the field of activities, knowledge and the object of knowledge have been briefly explained. By understanding these, My devotee attains love for Me.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि । विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसम्भवान् ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: prakṛtiṁ puruṣaṁ caiva viddhyanādī ubhāv api vikārāṁś ca guṇānś caiva viddhi prakṛti-sambhavān
verses.translation: You should know that both material nature and the living beings are without beginning. Try to understand that all transformations and the modes of nature originate from material nature.

verses.sanskrit: कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते । पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: kārya-kāraṇa-kartṛtve hetuḥ prakṛtir ucyate puruṣaḥ sukha-duḥkhānāṁ bhoktṛtve hetur ucyate
verses.translation: It is said that material nature is the source of all causes and effects. The living beings are said to be the cause of their own happiness and distress.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् । कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु ॥२२॥
verses.transliteration: puruṣaḥ prakṛtistho hi bhuṅkte prakṛti-jān guṇān kāraṇaṁ guṇa-saṅgo’sya sad-asad-yoni-janmasu
verses.translation: ituated within material nature, the living beings enjoy the modes that are born of material nature. Due to the individuals association with these modes, the living beings take birth repeatedly within higher and lower species of life.

verses.sanskrit: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः । परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः ॥२३॥
verses.transliteration: upadraṣṭānumantā ca bhartā bhoktā maheśvaraḥ paramātmeti cāpy-ukto dehe’smin puruṣaḥ paraḥ
verses.translation: The Supreme Person, who is known as the Super Consciousness (Paramātmā), resides within this body. He is the Witness of all things, the Supreme Authority, the Provider, the Maintainer and the Ultimate Controller.

verses.sanskrit: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह । सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते ॥२४॥
verses.transliteration: ya evaṁ vetti puruṣaṁ prakṛtiṁ ca guṇaiḥ saha sarvathā vartamāno’pi na sa bhūyo’bhijāyate
verses.translation: Therefore, one who fully understands the Supreme Person, material nature and the modes of material nature, never takes birth again under any circumstances.

verses.sanskrit: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना । अन्ये साङ्ख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: dhyānenātmani paśyanti kecid ātmānam ātmanā anye sāṅkhyena yogena karma-yogena cāpare
verses.translation: Through meditation, someyog

verses.sanskrit: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते । तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: anye tv-evam ajānantaḥ śrutvānyebhya upāsate te’pi cātitaranty eva mṛtyuṁ śruti-parāyaṇāḥ
verses.translation: There are also those that do not know these methods, but simply by hearing about Him from others, they engage in His worship. Because they have faith in what they have heard, they too transcend death.

verses.sanskrit: यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् । क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: yāvat saṁjāyate kiñcit sattvaṁ sthāvara-jaṅgamam kṣetra-kṣetrajña-saṁyogāt tad viddhi bharatarṣabha
verses.translation: You should understand that whatever exists, whether moving or non-moving, is simply manifest from the combination of the field and the knower of the field, O best of the Bharata Dynasty.

verses.sanskrit: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् । विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति ॥२८॥
verses.transliteration: samaṁ sarveṣu bhūteṣu tiṣṭhantaṁ parameśvaram vinaśyatsv-avinaśyantaṁ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati
verses.translation: One actually sees when he perceives the Supreme Controller as being situated in all living beings, and realises that neither the Super Consciousness nor the individual unit of consciousness is perishable.

verses.sanskrit: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् । न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥२९॥
verses.transliteration: samaṁ paśyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśvaram na hinasty-ātmanātmānaṁ tato yāti parāṁ gatim
verses.translation: By seeing the Supreme Person situated in all places equally, one does not become degraded. Thus he attains the Supreme Abode.

verses.sanskrit: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः । यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति ॥३०॥
verses.transliteration: prakṛtyaiva ca karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśaḥ yaḥ paśyati tathātmānam akartāraṁ sa paśyati
verses.translation: One who realises that all activities are performed by material nature, understands that he is not the doer.

verses.sanskrit: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति । तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा ॥३१॥
verses.transliteration: yadā bhūta-pṛthag-bhāvam eka-stham anupaśyati tata eva ca vistāraṁ brahma sampadyate tadā
verses.translation: When one truly sees, he ceases to identify the body as the self. Realising that all living beings are equal, he attains the Brahman conception and sees them expanded everywhere.

verses.sanskrit: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः । शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ॥३२॥
verses.transliteration: anāditvān nirguṇatvāt paramātmāyam avyayaḥ śarīra-stho’pi kaunteya na karoti na lipyate
verses.translation: O Son of Kunt

verses.sanskrit: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते । सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते ॥३३॥
verses.transliteration: yathā sarva-gataṁ saukṣmyād ākāśaṁ nopalipyate sarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate
verses.translation: Just as the subtle element of all-pervading space does not mix with anything, similarly, the individual unit of consciousness does not mix with the material body, although it is situated within.

verses.sanskrit: यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः । क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत ॥३४॥
verses.transliteration: yathā prakāśayaty-ekaḥ kṛtsnaṁ lokam imaṁ raviḥ kṣetraṁ kṣetrī tathā kṛtsnaṁ prakāśayati bhārata
verses.translation: O Bh

verses.sanskrit: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा । भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ॥३५॥
verses.transliteration: kṣetra-kṣetrajñayor evam antaraṁ jñāna-cakṣuṣā bhūta-prakṛti-mokṣaṁ ca ye vidur yānti te param
verses.translation: One who knows and sees the difference between the body and the self and who understands the process of liberation from material bondage, also attains the supreme goal.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 14 Gu%E1%B9%87A Traya Vibhaga Yoga The Yoga Of Understanding The Three Modes Of Material Nature

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् । यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: śrī-bhagavān uvāca – paraṁ bhūyaḥ pravakṣyāmi jñānānāṁ jñānam uttamam yaj jñātvā munayaḥ sarve parāṁ siddhim ito gatāḥ
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: I will now describe to you that knowledge which is the greatest of all types of knowledge. By knowing this, all the sages were able to attain perfection and reach the highest destination.

verses.sanskrit: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः । सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: idaṁ jñānam upāśritya mama sādharmyam āgatāḥ sarge’pi nopajāyante pralaye na vyathanti ca
verses.translation: By taking shelter of this knowledge, one attains My nature. He is neither born during creation nor does he suffer during universal annihilation.

verses.sanskrit: मम योनिर्महद् ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् । सम्भवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: mama yonir mahadbrahma tasmin garbhaṁ dadhāmyaham sambhavaḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ tato bhavati bhārata
verses.translation: O Bhārata, the vast expanse of material nature is My womb which I impregnate and wherefrom all living beings manifest.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः सम्भवन्ति याः । तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-yoniṣu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ sambhavanti yāḥ tāsāṁ brahma mahad yonir ahaṁ bīja-pradaḥ pitā
verses.translation: O son of Kuntī, all forms of life that are born in this world are ultimately born from the great womb of material nature, and I am the seed-giving father.

verses.sanskrit: सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसम्भवाः । निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम् ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: sattvaṁ rajas tama iti guṇāḥ prakṛti-sambhavāḥ nibadhnanti mahā-bāho dehe dehinam avyayam
verses.translation: Goodness, passion and ignorance are the modes born of material nature. These modes bind the immutable individual being to the material body, O mighty-armed hero.

verses.sanskrit: तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् । सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: tatra sattvaṁ nirmalatvāt prakāśakam anāmayam sukha-saṅgena badhnāti jñāna-saṅgena cānagha
verses.translation: O virtuous Arjuna, amongst these modes, goodness is free from impurities. It gives knowledge and frees one from distress. It conditions one to pleasure and knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् । तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम् ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: rajo rāgātmakaṁ viddhi tṛṣṇā-saṅga-samudbhavam tan nibadhnāti kaunteya karma-saṅgena dehinam
verses.translation: O son of Kuntī, you should know that the mode of passion manifests desire, hankering and attachment. It binds the embodied living beings to their actions.

verses.sanskrit: तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् । प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: tamas tv-ajñānajaṁ viddhi mohanaṁ sarva-dehinām pramādālasya nidrābhis tan nibadhnāti bhārata
verses.translation: You should know that the mode of ignorance bewilders all embodied beings, O Bhārata. It binds them through confusion, laziness and excessive sleep.

verses.sanskrit: सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत । ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: sattvaṁ sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhārata jñānam āvṛtya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayaty-uta
verses.translation: O Bhārata, the mode of goodness conditions one to happiness, the mode of passion creates attachment to perform action, and the mode of ignorance covers knowledge and creates bewilderment.

verses.sanskrit: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत । रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: rajas tamaś cābhibhūya sattvaṁ bhavati bhārata rajaḥ sattvaṁ tamaś caiva tamaḥ sattvaṁ rajas tathā
verses.translation: Goodness overpowers passion and ignorance, passion defeats goodness and ignorance, and ignorance overcomes goodness and passion. Thus the modes continually fight for supremacy.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते । ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: sarva-dvāreṣu dehe’smin prakāśa upajāyate jñānaṁ yadā tadā vidyād vivṛddhaṁ sattvam ityuta
verses.translation: When the light of knowledge illuminates all the senses of the body, it should be understood that the mode of goodness is most prevalent.

verses.sanskrit: लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा । रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: lobhaḥ pravṛttir ārambhaḥ karmaṇām aśamaḥ spṛhā rajasy-etāni jāyante vivṛddhe bharatarṣabha
verses.translation: O best of the Bhārata Dynasty, when the mode of passion is most predominant one is under the influence of greed, selfish activities, ambition, restlessness and hankering.

verses.sanskrit: अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च । तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: aprakāśo’pravṛttiś ca pramādo moha eva ca tamasy-etāni jāyante vivṛddhe kuru-nandana
verses.translation: O descendant of Kuru, by the influence of the mode of ignorance, then darkness, laziness, confusion and delusion are manifest.

verses.sanskrit: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् । तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: yadā sattve pravṛddhe tu pralayaṁ yāti deha-bhṛt tadottama vidāṁ lokān amalān pratipadyate
verses.translation: When an embodied being dies under the influence of the mode of goodness, he reaches the higher planets wherein those of great intellect reside.

verses.sanskrit: रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते । तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: rajasi pralayaṁ gatvā karma-saṅgiṣu jāyate tathā pralīnas tamasi mūḍha-yoniṣu jāyate
verses.translation: When one dies in the mode of passion, he is reborn amongst those who are attached to worldly activities. If one dies in the mode of ignorance, he takes birth again in the womb of unintelligent people.

verses.sanskrit: कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् । रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम् ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: karmaṇaḥ sukṛtasyāhuḥ sāttvikaṁ nirmalaṁ phalam rajasas tu phalaṁ duḥkham ajñānaṁ tamasaḥ phalam
verses.translation: It has been said that the result of good deeds is purity, the results of passionate activities is misery, and the result of actions in ignorance is bewilderment.

verses.sanskrit: सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च । प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: sattvāt sañjāyate jñānaṁ rajaso lobha eva ca pramāda-mohau tamaso bhavato’jñānam eva ca
verses.translation: Goodness gives birth to knowledge, passion gives rise to greed and ignorance breeds illusion, confusion and a lack of knowledge.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः । जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvaṁ gacchanti sattva-sthā madhye tiṣṭhanti rājasāḥ jaghanya-guṇa-vṛtti-sthā adho gacchanti tāmasāḥ
verses.translation: Those in goodness attain the higher realms, those in passion remain in the middle (the Earth planet) and those in ignorance descend to the lower planes of life.

verses.sanskrit: नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति । गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: nānyaṁ guṇebhyaḥ kartāraṁ yadā draṣṭānupaśyati guṇebhyaś ca paraṁ vetti mad-bhāvaṁ so’dhigacchati
verses.translation: When one perceives that there is no other active agent except the modes of nature, and he knows the Supreme, he attains My nature.

verses.sanskrit: गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान् । जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: guṇān etān atītya trīn dehī deha-samudbhavān janma-mṛtyu-jarā-duḥkhair vimukto’mṛtam aśnute
verses.translation: By transcending these three modes that appear within the body, one becomes liberated from the miseries of birth, death, old age and other miseries. Then one tastes the nectar of immortality.

verses.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो । किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: arjuna uvāca – kair liṅgais trīn guṇān etān atīto bhavati prabho kim ācāraḥ kathaṁ caitāṁs trīn guṇān ativartate
verses.translation: Arjuna inquired: O Kṛṣṇa, by what symptoms can one who has transcended these three modes be known? How does he act and how does he transcend these three modes?

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव । न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति ॥२२॥ उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते । गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येवं योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते ॥२३॥ समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः । तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः ॥२४॥ मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः । सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते ॥२५॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – prakāśaṁ ca pravṛttiṁ ca moham eva ca pāṇḍava na dveṣṭi sampravṛttāni na nivṛttāni kāṅkṣati
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa replied: One who does not like or dislike the presence of illumination, attachment or delusion or laments their absence, who remains dispassionate and is not affected by the modes, who remains unwavering, who is equal in both happiness and distress, who remains content in the self, who sees no intrinsic difference between a lump of earth, a stone and gold, who remains undisturbed in both favourable and unfavourable circumstances, who is wise, to whom insult and praise are equal, who considers honour and infamy to be the same, who is impartial towards both friend and enemy, and who renounces all mundane activities – such a person is considered to be beyond the modes of material nature.

verses.sanskrit: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते । स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥२६॥
verses.transliteration: māṁ ca yo’vyabhicāreṇa bhakti-yogena sevate sa guṇān samatītyaitān brahma-bhūyāya kalpate
verses.translation: One who performs service to Me inbhakti-yogawithout deviation, transcends these modes of material nature and is qualified for liberation.

verses.sanskrit: ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च । शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ॥२७॥
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇo hi pratiṣṭhāham amṛtasyāvyayasya ca śāśvatasya ca dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya ca
verses.translation: I am the foundation of the immortal, imperishable Brahman, who is the basis of eternaldharmaand supreme bliss.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 15 Puru%E1%B9%A3Ottama Yoga The Yoga Of The Supreme Person

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । ऊर्ध्वमूलमधःशाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम् । छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित् ॥१॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – ūrdhva-mūlam adhaḥ śākham aśvatthaṁ prāhur avyayam chandāṁsi yasya parṇāni yas taṁ veda sa vedavit
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: It has been told that there is an imperishable banyan tree that has its roots above, its branches below and its leaves are the Vedicmantras. One who knows this tree is the knower of theVedas.

verses.sanskrit: अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखा गुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवालाः । अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानि कर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके ॥२॥
verses.transliteration: adhaś cordhvaṁ prasṛtās tasya śākhā guṇa-pravṛddhā viṣaya-pravālāḥ adhaś ca mūlāny-anusantatāni karmānubandhīni manuṣya-loke
verses.translation: Some branches of this tree spread upwards and others grow downwards, nourished by the modes of nature. The twigs on the tree are the sense-objects, and the roots that extend downwards reach the human plane and are the cause of the binding activities of human society.

verses.sanskrit: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यते नान्तो न चादिर्न च सम्प्रतिष्ठा । अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूलं असङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्त्वा ॥३॥ ततः पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूयः । तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्ये यतः प्रवृत्तिः प्रसृता पुराणी ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: na rūpam asyeha tathopalabhyate nānto na cādir na ca sampratiṣṭhā
verses.translation: The form of this tree cannot be perceived in this world. Indeed, none can fully comprehend where the tree begins, where it ends, or where its foundation lies. One must cut down this strong-rooted banyan tree with the weapon of detachment and search out that place from which, once having gone, one never returns. One must take shelter of the Supreme Person, from whom all things have originated from time immemorial.

verses.sanskrit: निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषा अध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामाः । द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ताः सुखदुःखसंज्ञैर्-गच्छन्त्यमूढाः पदमव्ययं तत् ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: nirmāna-mohā jita-saṅga-doṣā adhyātma-nityā vinivṛtta-kāmāḥ dvandvair vimuktāḥ sukha-duḥkha-saṁjñair gacchanty-amūḍhāḥ padam avyayaṁ tat
verses.translation: Free from pride, illusion and bad association, dedicated to spiritual pursuits, forsaking lust, unburdened by the dualities of happiness and distress – such wise persons attain the eternal realm.

verses.sanskrit: न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः । यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: na tad bhāsayate sūryo na śaśāṅko na pāvakaḥ yad gatvā na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama
verses.translation: My Supreme Abode is not illumined by sun, moon or fire. Once attaining that abode, one never returns.

verses.sanskrit: ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः । मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: mamaivāṁśo jīva-loke jīva-bhūtaḥ sanātanaḥ manaḥ ṣaṣṭhānīndriyāṇi prakṛtisthāni karṣati
verses.translation: The living beings of this world are My eternal particles. These living beings struggle with the five senses and the mind, which is the sixth sense within.

verses.sanskrit: शरीरं यदवाप्नोति यच्चाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वरः । गृहीत्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: śarīraṁ yad avāpnoti yac cāpy-utkrāmatīśvaraḥ gṛhītvaitāni saṁyāti vāyur gandhān ivāśayāt
verses.translation: Whenever the individual being, the master of the body, accepts or gives up a material body, his senses and mind follow him to the next birth, just as the wind carries a fragrance from its source.

verses.sanskrit: श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च । अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: śrotraṁ cakṣuḥ sparśanaṁ ca rasanaṁ ghrāṇam eva ca adhiṣṭhāya manaś cāyaṁ viṣayān upasevate
verses.translation: The living beings enjoy the objects of the senses and preside over the ears, eyes, skin, tongue, nose and the mind.

verses.sanskrit: उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् । विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुषः ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: utkrāmantaṁ sthitaṁ vāpi bhuñjānaṁ vā guṇānvitam vimūḍhā nānupaśyanti paśyanti jñāna-cakṣuṣaḥ
verses.translation: Those who are ignorant can neither understand when the individual unit of consciousness is leaving the body, when it is residing within the body, or when it is enjoying the objects of the senses. Only those with the eyes of knowledge can perceive this.

verses.sanskrit: यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् । यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतसः ॥११॥
verses.transliteration: yatanto yoginaś cainaṁ paśyanty-ātmany-avasthitam yatanto’py akṛtātmāno nainaṁ paśyanty-acetasaḥ
verses.translation: The sincereyogīsees theātmāsituated within, but those who lack true understanding and self-control cannot perceive theātmāno matter how hard they try.

verses.sanskrit: यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भासयतेऽखिलम् । यच्चन्द्रमसि यच्चाग्नौ तत्तेजो विद्धि मामकम् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: yad āditya-gataṁ tejo jagad bhāsayate’khilam yac candramasi yac cāgnau tat tejo viddhi māmakam
verses.translation: Know that I am the light of the sun, the moon and fire that illuminates the entire world.

verses.sanskrit: गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा । पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः ॥१३॥
verses.transliteration: gām āviśya ca bhūtāni dhārayāmy-aham ojasā puṣṇāmi cauṣadhīḥ sarvāḥ somo bhūtvā rasātmakaḥ
verses.translation: By My potency I enter the earth and maintain all living beings. I nourish all plants by becoming the moon, and provide them with the essence of life.

verses.sanskrit: अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रितः । प्राणापानसमायुक्तः पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम् ॥१४॥
verses.transliteration: ahaṁ vaiśvānaro bhūtvā prāṇināṁ deham āśritaḥ prāṇāpāna-samāyuktaḥ pachāmy-annaṁ catur-vidham
verses.translation: I am the fire of digestion that resides in all beings, and I unite with the incoming and outgoing life-airs to digest all types of food.

verses.sanskrit: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टो मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनञ्च । वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम् ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: sarvasya cāhaṁ hṛdi sanniviṣṭo mattaḥ smṛtir jñānam apohanaṁ ca vedaiś ca sarvair aham eva vedyo vedānta-kṛd veda-vid eva cāham
verses.translation: I am situated in the hearts of all living beings, and from Me arises remembrance, knowledge and forgetfulness. I alone am to be known through all theVedas. I reveal theVedāntaand am the knower of theVedas.

verses.sanskrit: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च । क्षरः सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: dvāv-imau puruṣau loke kṣaraś cākṣara eva ca kṣaraḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni kūṭastho’kṣara ucyate
verses.translation: There are two types of beings – those in the material world and those in the spiritual world (Vaikuṇṭha). In the material world all living beings are fallible. In the spiritual world, all living beings are said to be infallible.

verses.sanskrit: उत्तमः पुरुषस्त्वन्यः परमात्मेत्युधाहृतः । यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वरः ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: uttamaḥ puruṣas tv-anyaḥ paramātmety-udhāhṛtaḥ yo loka-trayam āviśya bibharty-avyaya īśvaraḥ
verses.translation: Yet there is another Being – the Supreme Person, the imperishable Super Consciousness, who enters the upper, middle and lower planetary systems and maintains them.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तमः । अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: yasmāt kṣaram atīto’ham akṣarādapi cottamaḥ ato’smi loke vede ca prathitaḥ puruṣottamaḥ

verses.sanskrit: यो मामेवमसम्मूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् । स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: yo mām evam asammūḍho jānāti puruṣottamam sa sarva-vid bhajati māṁ sarva-bhāvena bhārata
verses.translation: O Bhārata, whoever is free from bewilderment knows Me as the Supreme Person. Such a person knows everything and worships Me with all his heart.

verses.sanskrit: इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ । एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: iti guhyatamaṁ śāstram idam uktaṁ mayānagha etad buddhvā buddhimān syāt kṛta-kṛtyaś ca bhārata
verses.translation: O faultless one, I have thus explained to you the greatest secret of theśāstra. By understanding this, O Bhārata, one finds wisdom and all his activities become perfect.

contents.chapter_title: Chapter 16 Daivasura Sampad Vibhaga Yoga The Yoga Of Discretion Pious And Impious Natures

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच । अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः । दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ॥१॥ अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् । दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ॥२॥ तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता । भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ॥३॥
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca – abhayaṁ sattva-saṁśuddhir jñāna-yoga-vyavasthitiḥ dānaṁ damaś ca yajñaś ca svādhyāyas tapa ārjavam ahiṁsā satyam akrodhas tyāgaḥ śāntir apaiśunam dayā bhūteṣv-aloluptvaṁ mārdavaṁ hrīr acāpalam tejaḥ kṣamā dhṛtiḥ śaucam adroho nātimānitā bhavanti sampadaṁ daivīm abhijātasya bhārata
verses.translation: Bhagavān Śrī Kṛṣṇa said: O Bhārata, these are the various qualities of one who is born with a divine nature (deva) – fearlessness, pure-heartedness, absorption in spiritual knowledge, charity, self-control, sacrifice, study of theVedas, austerity, sincerity, non-violence, truthfulness, freedom from anger, renunciation, serenity, aversion to finding faults in others, compassion for all creatures, absence of avarice, gentleness, modesty, steadiness, valour, forgiveness, patience, cleanliness, freedom from envy and the desire for prestige.

verses.sanskrit: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च । अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ॥४॥
verses.transliteration: dambho darpo’bhimānaś ca krodhaḥ pāruṣyameva ca ajñānaṁ cābhijātasya pārtha sampadam āsurīm
verses.translation: Pride, arrogance, conceit, anger, cruelty and ignorance – these are the qualities manifest in one born of an impious nature (asura).

verses.sanskrit: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता । मा शुचः सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ॥५॥
verses.transliteration: daivī sampad vimokṣāya nibandhāyāsurī matā mā śucaḥ sampadaṁ daivīm abhijāto’si pāṇḍava
verses.translation: The qualities of adevalead one to liberation, while the qualities of anasuracause bondage. Fear not, O Pāṇḍava, for you are born of the nature of adeva.

verses.sanskrit: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च । दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु ॥६॥
verses.transliteration: dvau bhūta-sargau loke’smin daiva āsura eva ca daivo vistaraśaḥ prokta āsuraṁ pārtha me śṛṇu
verses.translation: P

verses.sanskrit: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः । न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ॥७॥
verses.transliteration: pravṛttiṁ ca nivṛttiṁ ca janā na vidur āsurāḥ na śaucaṁ nāpi cācāro na satyaṁ teṣu vidyate
verses.translation: Those who areasurasby nature cannot discriminate as to what actions should be done and what actions should not be done. No purity, proper behaviour or truthfulness can be found in them.

verses.sanskrit: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् । अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ॥८॥
verses.transliteration: asatyam apratiṣṭhaṁ te jagad āhur anīśvaram aparaspara-sambhūtaṁ kim anyat kāma-haitukam
verses.translation: They claim that the world is false, without any basis and without any divinity. They believe that the source of everything is the union between male and female and that life has no purpose besides lust.

verses.sanskrit: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः । प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः ॥९॥
verses.transliteration: etāṁ dṛṣṭim avaṣṭabhya naṣṭātmāno’lpa buddhayaḥ prabhavanty-ugra-karmāṇaḥ kṣayāya jagato’hitāḥ
verses.translation: With this view, such people with depraved and small intellect flourish and engage in malicious activities for the destruction of the world.

verses.sanskrit: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः । मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः ॥१०॥
verses.transliteration: kāmam āśritya duṣpūraṁ dambha-māna-madānvitāḥ mohād gṛhītvāsad grāhān pravartante’śuci-vratāḥ
verses.translation: Attached to their insatiable lusty desires and absorbed in pride and arrogance, such people become bewildered and embrace deceitful ideologies, pledging themselves to impure activities.

verses.sanskrit: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः । कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः ॥११॥ आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः । ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ॥१२॥
verses.transliteration: cintām aparimeyāṁ ca pralayāntām upāśritāḥ kāmopabhoga-paramā etāvad iti niścitāḥ
verses.translation: Believing that slaking their greed and fulfilling their lusty desires is the ultimate goal of life, they undergo unlimited anxieties until the time of death. Bound by hundreds of ambitions and absorbed in lust and anger, they try to amass wealth by any unlawful means in order to satisfy their desires.

verses.sanskrit: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् । इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् ॥१३॥ असौ मया हतः शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि । ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ॥१४॥ आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया । यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः ॥१५॥
verses.transliteration: idam adya mayā labdham imaṁ prāpsye manoratham idam astīdam api me bhaviṣyati punar dhanam
verses.translation: They say: “I have gained this today, now I shall fulfil my other desires. This wealth belongs to me and in the future it will increase. This enemy has been slain by me and in the future I will slay others. I am in control! I am the enjoyer! I am perfect! I am powerful! I am happy! I am wealthy and aristocratic. Is there anyone equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices, give in charity and enjoy!” Thus they are deluded by ignorance.

verses.sanskrit: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः । प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ ॥१६॥
verses.transliteration: aneka-citta-vibhrāntā moha-jāla-samāvṛtāḥ prasaktāḥ kāma-bhogeṣu patanti narake’śucau
verses.translation: The minds of theasurasare full of various bewildering thoughts and thus they are ensnared in a network of illusion. As they become absorbed in fulfilling their mundane desires, they descend into a foul abyss.

verses.sanskrit: आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः । यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ॥१७॥
verses.transliteration: ātma-sambhāvitāḥ stabdhā dhana-māna-madānvitāḥ yajante nāma-yajñais te dambhenāvidhi-pūrvakam
verses.translation: Full of self-importance, stubborn and intoxicated with their wealth, they perform sacrifices in name only that are against the rules ofdharma.

verses.sanskrit: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः । मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः ॥१८॥
verses.transliteration: ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ ca saṁśritāḥ mām ātma-para-deheṣu pradviṣanto’bhyasūyakāḥ
verses.translation: Surrendering to egotism, power, pride, lust and anger, such people hate Me, who is situated in their own bodies and the bodies of others.

verses.sanskrit: तानहं द्विषतः क्रुरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् । क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ॥१९॥
verses.transliteration: tān ahaṁ dviṣataḥ krurān saṁsāreṣu narādhamān kṣipāmy-ajasram aśubhān āsurīṣv-eva yoniṣu
verses.translation: Such envious and cruel persons are perpetually born among the impious and unrighteous where they suffer in the repeated cycle of birth and death, for they are the lowest of all mankind.

verses.sanskrit: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि । मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ॥२०॥
verses.transliteration: āsurīṁ yonim āpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani mām aprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yānty-adhamāṁ gatim
verses.translation: O Kaunteya, continually taking birth amongst the impious, such foolish persons never attain Me. Rather, they fall to the most abominable destinations.

verses.sanskrit: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः । कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् ॥२१॥
verses.transliteration: tri-vidhaṁ narakasyedaṁ dvāraṁ nāśanam ātmanaḥ kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṁ tyajet
